title: Exploring Ensemble Classifiers and Filter-Based Feature Selection for Predicting On-Time Graduation Using Multidimensional Student Data
authors: Wiyli Yustanti, Ricky Eka Putra, I Gusti Putu Asto Buditjahjanto, Andi Iwan Nurhidayat
publish: 2025 Eight International Conference on Vocational Education and Electrical Engineering (ICVEE)
abstract: Timely graduation is a key performance indicator in higher education and a critical goal for students, institutions, and policymakers. This study investigates the effectiveness of various machine learning algorithms in predicting students’ graduation timeliness using multidimensional data, which includes both academic and non-academic attributes. A comparative analysis was conducted using classification models, including Random Forest, XGBoost, LightGBM, Support Vector Machine (SVM), K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Naive Bayes, Logistic Regression, and ensemble methods such as Bagging, Voting, and Stacking. To handle class imbalance and enhance model robustness, class weighting, SMOTE (Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique), and hyperparameter tuning were applied. The experimental results show that LightGBM consistently outperformed all other models, achieving the highest test accuracy (0.72), ROC AUC (0.71), and macro-average F1-score (0.64). This indicates LightGBM’s ability to effectively balance precision and recall for both the ontime graduation and not on-time graduation classes. Other ensemble methods, such as Random Forest and Stacked Models, also demonstrated competitive results. In contrast, traditional models like Naive Bayes and Logistic Regression underperformed, particularly in identifying students at risk of delayed graduation. These findings confirm the potential of LightGBM as a reliable model for predicting graduation outcomes and highlight the importance of integrating both academic and socioeconomic factors in educational data analytics.

title: Evaluation of Cooperative Cognitive Radio System for White Spectral Space Detection using the Covariance Detector
authors: Rafael G. Ramirez Montecinos, Mateo I. Luna Rico, Marcelo Molina Silva, Jussif J. Abularach Arnez, Luiz Da Silva Mello, Carlos V. Rodríguez R, Leonardo H. Gonsioroski
publish: 2025 Eight International Conference on Vocational Education and Electrical Engineering (ICVEE)
abstract: Wireless spectrum is increasingly scarce, which motivates the need for robust methods to detect unused bands—especially under challenging conditions like low SNR and fading. This study proposes integrating Spectral Covariance Sensing (SCS) into a cooperative cognitive radio framework, leveraging hard-decision fusion schemes (AND, OR, Majority) to enhance detection stability. Using real Advanced Television Systems Committee(ATSC) signal data, the detection performance was evaluated across various SNR levels. The results show that cooperative sensing significantly improves detection probability under low SNR, with the OR rule achieving the highest detection rate (e.g., ≈90% at –30 dB) and the majority rule providing the best overall trade-off between reliability and false alarms. These findings demonstrate the practical value of cooperative SCS systems in dynamic spectrum environments.

title: Hybrid Encryption Algorithm Based on Feistel Network and Vigenère Cipher
authors: Estelito R. Medallada, Jessie R. Paragas
publish: 2025 Eight International Conference on Vocational Education and Electrical Engineering (ICVEE)
abstract: This paper introduces a hybrid encryption algorithm that addresses the predictable key patterns, limited character support, and low diffusion inherent in the classical Vigenère cipher. To overcome these issues, an Extended Vigenère cipher (mod 256) is embedded as the round function within a 16round Feistel network. The design operates on 128-bit plaintext blocks using a 128-bit master key and incorporates a layered permutation stage based on constants derived from Euler’s number and a novel key scheduling mechanism based on pi, both intended to enhance confusion and diffusion. Security was evaluated using avalanche effect measurements and selected NIST statistical tests. The hybrid algorithm achieved an average avalanche effect of 52.41 percent, significantly outperforming the Extended Vigenère cipher baseline of 1.45 percent, and passed all applied randomness tests. The algorithm is well-suited for lightweight cryptographic applications such as IoT, with future work planned to evaluate its runtime efficiency and resource usage.

title: Designing and Modeling of Wind Turbine Power Plant Using MATLAB
authors: Harpreet Kaur Channi, Rozy Rani, Ramandeep Sandhu, Harpreet Kaur
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Wind energy is a clean and sustainable source for electricity generation, and its efficient utilization requires accurate modeling and simulation tools. This paper presents a comprehensive MATLAB-Simulink-based model of a wind turbine power plant, integrating aerodynamic, mechanical, and electrical subsystems. Blade Element Momentum Theory (BEMT) is employed to simulate aerodynamic behavior, and rotor dynamics which are incorporated to assess torque and power output. The study investigates the impact of blade pitch angle and wind speed on power generation. A MATLAB-Simulink environment is used to simulate system performance under varying operating conditions. The results demonstrate the model’s effectiveness in predicting active and reactive power outputs. Comparative analysis with baseline models confirms the enhanced efficiency achieved through optimized design parameters. The proposed simulation framework supports the development of reliable, scalable wind energy solutions.

title: Designing and Implementing a Trustless E-Commerce System with Blockchain-Integrated NFT for Product Verification
authors: Prayitno, Eko Prasetyo, Dwi Krisnandi, Maulana Arya Yoga Juliansyah, Tri Raharjo Yudantoro
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electronic and Electrical Engineering and Intelligent System (ICE3IS)
abstract: Medium-sized businesses in the apparel sector often face challenges in ensuring product authenticity, manual sales reporting, and inventory management errors. This study designs and implements a blockchain-based e-commerce platform integrated with Non-Fungible Token (NFT) technology to ensure the authenticity of products and enhance customer trust. The system issues digital certificates using NFTs, while blockchain provides transparent and tamper-proof verification. The research employs a mixed-method approachqualitative needs analysis and quantitative system evaluation including NFT generation time, transaction latency, and load testing. Results show that the system achieves an average NFT minting time of 1.8 seconds and supports up to 250 concurrent transactions with 98.7% success rate. User surveys ($\mathrm{n}=30$) indicate 92% satisfaction with usability and trust improvement. This study contributes a novel hybrid model combining ecommerce usability with blockchain immutability, and provides a secure, scalable reference architecture for trustless online retail platforms.

title: Empowering Data-Driven Decision Making: The Rise of Self-Service Data Wrangling in the Age of Automation
authors: Gnanendra Bachu
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: As organizations increasingly rely on data-driven insights, the challenge of preparing and cleaning raw data has emerged as a major bottleneck. Traditional ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes often require technical expertise, limiting accessibility for domain experts and business users. This paper explores the evolution of self-service data wrangling, a paradigm shift that empowers non-technical users to prepare, refine, and analyze data with minimal reliance on IT teams. We examine the role of automation, AI-driven augmentation, and intuitive interfaces in modern data preparation tools. Additionally, we highlight industry case studies demonstrating improved efficiency and accuracy in sectors such as healthcare, finance, and retail. Finally, we discuss the implications for product managers developing data-centric solutions, emphasizing the importance of usability, trust, and integration with broader analytics ecosystems. The future of data wrangling lies in democratizing access to data, reducing time-to-insight, and enabling agile decision-making at scale

title: A Deep Learning CNN–BiLSTM Approach for Real-Time Traffic Flow Prediction
authors: Revathi. B, Nambi Rajeswari G, Rathna S, S. Teitsana Devi, Gomathi N
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: This study proposes a hybrid deep learning framework that combines Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory (BiLSTM) networks for short-term traffic flow prediction in urban road networks. The model was trained and evaluated using openly accessible Indian datasets, including Delhi Traffic Police and Bangalore Traffic Management Centre records, along with international benchmarks such as PeMS and METR-LA. The workflow involves data preprocessing, spatial feature extraction through CNN, and temporal sequence modeling via BiLSTM, resulting in a compact architecture with approximately 85,000 trainable parameters optimized for real-time deployment. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed CNN–BiLSTM consistently outperforms baselines such as ARIMA, SVR, and standalone LSTM, achieving lower error rates across all datasets. On the Delhi dataset, the model achieved an MAE of 5.23, RMSE of 8.74, MAPE of 11.2%, and R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> of 0.91, while on METR-LA it achieved an MAE of 4.02, RMSE of 6.97, MAPE of 9.8%, and R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> of 0.92. These results indicate the model’s ability to capture complex spatiotemporal dependencies in heterogeneous traffic environments while maintaining computational efficiency, making it suitable for real-time intelligent transportation systems.

title: RCNN-based Embryo In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) Concept
authors: Jansi Sophia Mary. C, Elamathi. V, Thamizharuvi. A, Swathi. J, Gomathi. M
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: In vitro fertilization (IVF) axes the capacity to select viable embryos for transfer and pregnancy. Traditional methods depend on comparisons of morphological assessments done manually by a human embryologist, which are mutable, subjective, and observer-dependent. In response, an automatic deep learning system to improve the accuracy of the embryo selection is suggested. It is used for preprocessing like noise removal, contrast enhancement, and region scaling to enhance image quality and emphasize relevant features. Embryos detection and segmentation were done using a Region-based Convolutional Neural Network (RCNN) to select Regions of Interest (ROI) and classify them according to their developmental stage and quality. The RCNN model is trained over annotated embryo images scored by experts, which can extract and learn both morphological features of clinical importance. This method substantially minimizes human bias, quickens the assessment process, and enhances the consistency of embryo grading. The system has extracted correct information with a precision of 96% and recall of 96%, giving the F1-score 94% significant result. This AI-enabled workflow is a scalable solution for embryology labs, enabling better IVF results, real-time mirroring, and decision support in reproductive medicine.

title: Research on optimization of potential distribution of 220kV surge arrester based on finite element method
authors: Huize Liu, Hongfeng Zhao
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: During the continuous operation of AC gapless metal oxide arrester (MOA), due to the influence of stray capacitance, the potential distribution becomes uneven. The voltage borne by the resistor near the high-voltage end is usually greater than that borne by the resistor far away from the highvoltage end, which may cause damage to the entire arrester over time. Therefore, this paper studies the potential distribution and voltage balancing measures of high voltage metal oxide arrester. Using COMSOL finite element simulation software, the influence of grading ring size and resistor arrangement on potential distribution was analyzed. Through the research, the optimization effect of MOA potential distribution under different structural arrangements is obtained, which provides guidance for improving the structural design and operation reliability of MOA.

title: A Machine Learning Model for Evaluating Service Quality and Customer Satisfaction in Insurance Companies
authors: Mangapathi Rao Chintapalli, Srinivas. D
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: This study suggests a machine learning algorithm which would analyze the quality of service and level of satisfaction among customers of an insurance firm. Its main goals will be building of a model to measure the parameters of service quality, how service quality correlates with the customer loyalty, and how service quality affects the customer retention. Decision tree and regression models, as examples of using the machine learning technique, were used to analyze customer data and determine the patterns that impact the satisfaction rates. The model proved to be competent in terms of its prediction capabilities and its accuracy measures show promise of the model being applied in real-world insurance data. The result indicated that service quality has become one of the great determinants of the loyalty of the customers, which directly affects retention and market shares. The research demonstrates the relevance of machine learning method to the enhancement of the process of the service quality assessment with practical implications to insurance organizations in order to increase customer satisfaction and competitiveness.

title: Fuzzy Logic-Integrated BiLSTM Network for Sequence-Based English Translation Pattern Recognition
authors: B. Subhashini, Vandna Vandna, V. Kalpana, D Y Kiran Kumar, P. Mano Paul, S. Suganya
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The ability to better detect patterns in English translation is crucial for the development of smarter and more accurate translation algorithms. Knowing the ins and outs of the English language is essential for seeing translation patterns and making sense of the outcomes. Because many translated texts retain the same grammatical structures as the source language, detection and modelling play a crucial role in improving these translations. In order to correct the input data, the proposed method uses CRF for NER, stemming, sentence alignment, and tokenisation. Features are obtained using TF-IDF and BoW. The FuzzyBiLSTM-AM model is able to detect bidirectional sequential relationships by combining fuzzy logic with a bidirectional LSTM and an AM. In order to collect the initial geographical and contextual data, an FNN is utilised. Across all tests, the proposed technique enhances pattern recognition for English translations by 99.11%. Based on these findings, the method can learn and identify trends in translation, which bodes well for the development of more effective translation tools and their application in the classroom.

title: Hybrid EfficientNet-B0 with CBAM and Focal Loss for Rose Leaf Multi-Class Classification
authors: D. Ferlin Deva Shahila, Berakhah.F. Stanley, R. Jeen Retna Kumar, Babitha Lincy R, Valantina Stephen, Yeswanth Hanumanthu
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: We present a new deep learning approach for automatically classifying rose plant leaf diseases using a hybrid architecture based on EfficientNet-B0 combined Yeswanth Hanumanthu with a Convolutional Block Attention Module (CBAM). Our model classifies rose leaves into 5 different classes: Bacterial infection, Fungal infection, Pest damage, Viral infection, and Healthy. In order to overcome the class imbalance typical of plant disease datasets, we use Focal Loss to pay more attention to the harder examples and better performance on underrepresented classes than conventional approaches. To help with generalization and robustness of the model against varying lighting conditions, we use image preprocessing techniques like histogram equalization, rotation, and brightness augmentation. The proposed system was able to measure and achieve great evaluation metrics, i.e 94.87% accuracy, 93.65% precision, 92.80% recall, 93.22% F1-score, and a low loss value of 0.1584 on the test data. By incorporating CBAM, the model learns to focus on areas of the leaf that are relevant with respect to the diseased regions in the leaf which enhances classification performance, as well as interpretability. The compact nature of the model allows for it to be deployed on edge computing devices to allow for on-field real-time disease monitoring in smart agriculture situations. This work can greatly assist our goal of developing intelligent and automated tools for monitoring rose plant health, thus the ability to promote sustainable horticulture practices and improve early intervention for diseases.

title: A Meta Analytic Review of Supervised and Unsupervised Learning Techniques For Real-Time Vehicle Fault Prediction and Safety Enhancement
authors: Kaminee S. Patil, Ati Jain
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Despite rapid advances in applying machine-learning techniques to automotive predictive-maintenance and safety systems, several critical research gaps remain. First, the field still lacks standardized, publicly available benchmark datasets and common evaluation protocols, making it difficult to compare algorithms across studies and operating conditions. Second, real-time deployment is hindered by the high computational cost of deep-learning models and by incomplete solutions for fusing heterogeneous, high-volume sensor streams on resource-constrained edge hardware. Third, most current approaches provide limited model interpretability, which hampers industry adoption and regulatory approval; transparent, explainable architectures are therefore an urgent priority. Fourth, existing studies rarely address data imbalance, domain shift, and the diverse environmental scenarios that vehicles encounter in the real world, pointing to a need for robust transfer-learning and continual-learning strategies. Finally, ensuring end-to-end cyber security and functional safety for connected, over-the-air–updatable ML pipelines remains an open challenge. Addressing these gaps will unlock a wide array of high- impact applications. Improved predictive-maintenance models will reduce unplanned downtime for commercial fleets, extend electric-vehicle battery life, and optimize spare-parts logistics. In safety, enhanced perception and decision-making algorithms will bolster advanced driver-assistance functions, driver-state monitoring, and autonomous navigation, thereby lowering accident rates. Beyond the automotive domain, the same real- time fault-prediction frameworks can benefit rail and aviation maintenance, while robust, low-latency perception stacks are directly transferable to mobile robotics, smart-city traffic control, and industrial automation.

title: Research on Two-Stage Day-Ahead Scheduling Optimization of Pumped Storage Based on Adaboost.R2-LSTM-GA-PSO
authors: Jianshan Zhao, Haifeng Wang, Tang Fei, Yaojin Chen
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: This paper proposes an adaptive boosting recurrent neural network based on Adaboost.R2-LSTM for power load forecasting and a GA-PSO-enhanced particle swarm optimization algorithm for developing dispatch schemes to coordinate wind-solar-thermal-pumped storage power systems. A two-stage optimization dispatch model is constructed, encompassing power load forecasting and source-load matching day-ahead dispatch. The paper first analyzes the challenges in power systems that incorporate wind/solar generation, thermal power, and pumped storage. Following algorithm modeling and evaluation, it utilizes the predicted power load to optimize dispatch strategies for dayahead scheduling. This optimization utilizes an enhanced particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithm, taking into account constraints such as unit start-up/shutdown, output capacity, and ramping requirements. This paper utilizes power load data from a specific region for training. By selecting appropriate parameters and conducting case simulations via MATLAB, it achieves high-precision 24-hour power load forecasts. The resulting joint optimization strategy demonstrates effectiveness and superiority in enhancing economic efficiency, promoting renewable energy integration, and mitigating dispatch risks.

title: Adaptive Optimization with Federated Learning for Gait Severity Gradation Based on IMU - FedGait
authors: Subhrangshu Adhikary, Sree Teja Nadella, Sai Deepak Varalasetty, Arindam Ghosh, Subrata Nandi
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Remote, affordable, intelligent, accurate, scalable and privacy-preserved diagnosis of the severity of gait diseases is a long-standing challenge. Solving this can help monitor patients with locomotor diseases like hemiplegia, Parkinson’s disease, osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and injury. State-Of-the-art diagnosis methods often use wearable sensors, pressure plate sensors and spatiotemporal observations. Some of these are either not portable, are expensive or need medical-grade precision. This creates an urgent need for a framework to solve these issues. As smartphones are widely available and contain IMU sensors, they can be used to solve this state-of-the-art limitation. This paper proposes using only one smartphone to classify disease severity (particularly hemiplegia, which affects 3.35 million people worldwide). We tracked 35 human subjects with consent and IRB approval using a smartphone, used generative adversarial network augmentations to overcome limited sample space and further proposed a client level adaptive optimisation technique for federated learning which, on the one hand, added privacy to user data and, on the other hand, the adaptiveness increased the classification accuracy from 75.4% to 93%.

title: Low Grid Loss-Oriented Layout and Cluster Control Optimization for Distributed PV Micro-Power Stations
authors: Feng Zhou, Zheng Wang, Hao Si, Yuxing Zhou
publish: 2025 10th International Seminar on Computer Technology, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (ISCME)
abstract: To address the challenges of lacking unified planning and dispatch for distributed PV in practical applications, this paper proposes a method for the optimal layout and cluster operational control of distributed PV micro-power stations. A mathematical model based on the PSO algorithm is established with the objective of minimizing grid loss to optimize the interconnection capacity and siting of distributed PV within the distribution network. Furthermore, the paper proposes a cluster control optimization scheme targeting the power output of the PV micro-power station cluster. Through a case study of an 8-node distribution network, the optimal individual unit capacity and installation locations are determined. The results verify that the proposed method can, within a specific period and with minimal grid loss, stably enhance both the power output of the energy storage system and the overall voltage profile, offering an effective technical path to address the challenges of distributed energy resource grid integration.

title: EV Sales Prediction Using Machine Learning
authors: Aarya Yadav, Harshada Jadhav, Priyanka Zankar, Shivani Sankpal, Nikhil B. Sardar
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The global transition to sustainable energy sources has led to a considerable increase in the adoption of electric vehicles (EVs), making precise forecasting of EV sales an important area of research. This study investigates the potential applications of various machine learning models for forecasting future EV sales in various worldwide areas.A comparison of support vector machines (SVM), gradient boosting, random forests, decision trees, and linear regression has been conducted. The findings demonstrate that the Random Forest model consistently outperforms other models in terms of predicted accuracy.

title: Fault Characterization of 39-Phase Angular Brushless Excitation and Rotating Rectifier Systems in Nuclear Power Plants
authors: Jiaxing Yan, Feng Niu, Jien Ma, Youtong Fang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: As the core excitation device of large-capacity nuclear power units, the multiphase brushless excitation system often faces rotating rectifier faults during actual operation, among which rectifier open-circuit and phase open-circuit faults can significantly affect the safe and stable operation of the main generator. This study focuses on the above fault types, and analyzes the harmonic characteristics of the stator excitation current of the 39-phase brushless excitation system in the case of single-tube-open-circuit and single-phase-open-circuit conditions of the rotating rectifier, and carries out the experiments of tube-open-circuit and phase-open-circuit of rotating rectifier system in the loading conditions, and the measured data effectively verifies the accuracy of theoretical analysis results.

title: Personalized Drug Recommendation using Ensemble Machine Learning: A Predictive Analytics Approach
authors: Rohan Kumar Rai, Ashish Kumar Singh, Om Prakash Suthar
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Asthma treatment varies significantly from one individual to another, necessitating personalized treatment plans for each person. This investigation proposes a tailored drug recommendation system that leverages machine learning alongside individualized clinical data from patients. We employed Exploratory Data Analysis and feature engineering to examine a dataset comprising 18,215 records. Three models were trained and tested: Random Forest, XG Boost, and a Hybrid ensemble. Both XG Boost and the Hybrid model achieved an accuracy of 85%, surpassing traditional methods in precision and recall. The system provides physicians with a method to enhance their decision-making regarding asthma treatment through personalized medication suggestions derived from data analysis.

title: Graph-based Contextual Reasoning for Small Object Detection and Semantic Mapping in Urban SAR Images
authors: Anandh Nagarajan, N Malligeswari, P. Poornima, K. Bhanu Rajesh Naidu, S. Subha, K. Deepa
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Accurate small object detection and semantic mapping in urban Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imagery remain critical challenges due to the presence of speckle noise, complex urban landscapes, and the subtle spatial signatures of small targets. This paper introduces a novel framework titled "Graph-Based Contextual Reasoning for Small Object Detection and Semantic Mapping in Urban SAR Images," which leverages advanced graph neural networks (GNNs) to exploit both spatial and contextual dependencies within SAR data. The proposed method constructs an adaptive graph from the SAR image, where each node represents a potential object or region, and edges encode contextual relationships based on local texture, intensity, and structural cues. By integrating multi-scale attention mechanisms and graph convolutional operations, the model efficiently distinguishes small objects from clutter and provides fine-grained semantic segmentation of urban features. Extensive experiments on real-world urban SAR datasets demonstrate the superiority of the approach in terms of detection accuracy, robustness to noise, and semantic labeling precision compared to state-of-the-art methods. This work paves the way for next-generation SAR-based urban scene understanding and supports applications in surveillance, infrastructure monitoring, and smart city development.

title: Unraveling Causal Pathways in Heart Failure: A LiNGAM Approach to Understanding Clinical Factors Influencing Patient Outcomes
authors: Aakansha Khanna, Pratyansh Singh, Inderdeep Kaur, Aakriti Khanna
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Clinical variables and heart failure patient outcomes are examined using the Linear Non-Gaussian Acyclic Model (LiNGAM). We preprocess 13 demographic, clinical, and binary data from 299 UC Irvine Machine Learning Repository Heart Failure Clinical Records patients. We found strong causal links between serum creatinine, age, and mortality. Higher blood creatinine levels and age increase mortality, according to LiNGAM's causal graph. The unanticipated negative connection between high blood pressure and mortality reveals a diverse function in heart failure development. This study suggests causal pathway-based personalized heart failure therapy to improve outcomes.

title: Comparative Analysis of Machine Learning Classifiers for Premature Atrial Contraction Detection
authors: Wina Salsabila Lestari, Estananto Estananto, Muhammad Ary Murti
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Internet of Things and Intelligence Systems (IoTaIS)
abstract: Premature Atrial Contraction (PAC) is one of benign arrhythmia that commonly found in arrhythmia patient. Without taking the right precaution, it can lead into several complications such as Atrial Fibrillation, Stroke, or Mortality. PAC can be detected by analyzing P-waves and RR intervals. To mitigate these risks, detecting PAC at an early stage can be considered critical. The aim of this study is to compare the performance of Support Vector Machine (SVM), Random Forest (RF), and the Ensemble Method based on the extracted features of the dataset to detect Premature Atrial Contraction (PAC). Analysis steps that are used start from load dataset, preprocessing data, extracting features, balancing data using Borderline-SMOTE and Random Under sampling, followed by train and testing the model. Based on evaluation metrics, the Voting Classifier of SVM and RF utilizing 29 features achieved the best performance, attaining 97.12% accuracy and 83.78%F1-Score. Although Voting Classifier received the highest performance, RF model are considered to be the more efficient due to less complicated and has small gap of performance which achieve 96.69% accuracy and 81.92% F1-Score.

title: Densely Packed Dual Port MIMO Antennas Electromagnetic Interference Reduction with EBG Structures
authors: Masum Billah, Apu Roy, Muhammad Nouman Khan, Rijvi Haque
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Networks, Communications and Information Technology (CNCIT)
abstract: This paper presents the design, simulation, and characterization of a dual-element microstrip antenna array integrated with an electromagnetic bandgap (EBG) structure and an inverted T-shaped ground plane for ultra-wideband (UWB) applications. The proposed antenna operates across the 3.16–11.36 GHz band, ensuring compatibility with WiMAX, 5G, Wi-Fi, satellite communication, and radar systems. Fabricated on an FR-4 substrate (ε<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">r</inf> = 4.4, tanδ = 0.02, thickness = 0.8 mm), the design offers practical feasibility and seamless integration into modern communication devices. Simulation results obtained using HFSS 2021 demonstrate excellent impedance matching, with |S<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">₁₁</inf>| below -10 dB across the entire band, along with high inter-element isolation (|S<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">₂₁</inf>| < -32 dB), which is crucial for MIMO applications. The EBG and inverted T-shaped DGS effectively suppress surface waves, optimize current distribution, and minimize electromagnetic interferences. Radiation characteristics reveal stable performance, with an efficiency exceeding 90.26% and a peak directive gain of 11.80 dBi at 10 GHz. The antenna exhibits omnidirectional radiation, making it suitable for a wide range of wireless applications.

title: Development of a smart glove based on magnetic-field perception and artificial intelligence for smart healthcare
authors: Tliongprasoet Santliara, Surasak Khmnsoitong, Apiwat Tawatsanon, Komkrit Chomsuwan, Tanes Tanitteerapan, Supachai Puengsungwan
publish: 2025 International Conference on Power, Energy and Innovations (ICPEI)
abstract: Wearable smart gloves have proven highly effective in healthcare monitoring and rehabilitation, and they are now a key component of modern smart healthcare applications. Smart gloves are especially promising; however, challenges such as ease of use, compactness, and affordability persist for elderly users. This paper presents the development of a new ripe of smart glove utilizing magnetic-field perception that is easy to wear, compact, and affordable, designed to measure the gripping ability of affected individuals. Additionally, the proposed system comprises magnetic field senders and sensors, a microcontroller for data processing, and a cloud-based platform for storage and analysis. To evaluate the performance of the proposed method, The experimental results are compared with three AI models, namely Random Forest (RF), K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), and Support Vector Machine (SVM), which were applied for the classification of grip ability levels. The experimental results show that the SVM model achieved the highest classification accuracy of 95% based on extracted feature vectors from magnetic field data.

title: Ant Colony Clustering Algorithm and Application in the City Classification
authors: Jiashan Zhang
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Information Technology (AICIT)
abstract: Clustering, which aims to divide a given set of objects into several categories according to certain rules, is one of the most important research topics in production and scientific research. It is widely applied to practical problems, such as knowledge discovery, artificial intelligence, scientific data analysis, business, biology, medical diagnosis, text mining, and web data mining and so on. Many scholars from all over the world have conducted research on clustering problems. Ant colony clustering algorithm (ACCA), which integrates ACA into clustering, is an efficient swarm intelligence algorithm. In this article, an effective Ant Colony Clustering Algorithm, in which novel picking-up and dropping strategy is introduced, is proposed. It is applied to classification of city classification. The experiments indicate that ant colony clustering algorithm can solve city-classification problem efficiently and successfully.

title: Grid Integrated PV Powered EV Charging Station Energy Management with Neural Network Controller
authors: Shravani Chapala
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: There is a greater need for sustainable and efficient charging infrastructure due to the growing number of electric cars (EVs) and the increasing need for clean energy. This article details the development and validation of a MATLAB/Simulink-based intelligent energy management system for a grid-integrated photovoltaic (PV) electric vehicle (EV) charging station. The proposed system utilizes a Neural Network Controller (NNC) to efficiently coordinate power flow among the PV array, energy storage system (ESS), electric vehicles, and the utility grid. The neural network is trained to predict solar generation, EV load demand, and storage behavior, enabling real-time decision-making to minimize grid dependency, reduce operational costs, and enhance energy reliability. In order to model the system’s dynamic behavior under different charging situations and solar irradiation levels, a comprehensive MATLAB/Simulink model is created. Simulation results confirm that the NNC-based energy management approach improves performance, ensures optimal energy utilization, and maintains a balanced and stable power supply. Its paper shows that it is possible to combine AI methods and renewable energy solutions when developing energy-saving and smart EV charging facilities.

title: Fake Job Detection using Naive Bayes and TF-IDF in Machine Learning
authors: Laxmi Raja, Karthick S, Rohith V S, Dharsan R
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: This study presents a machine learning framework to address the growing problem of misleading job ads on online recruitment sites. The proposed system uses TF-IDF vectorization, cosine similarity analysis, and Naïve Bayes classification to effectively detect and filter fraudulent job postings. As online job portals grow, they provide more access to job opportunities, but they also expose job seekers to harmful listings that can result in financial loss, identity theft, and emotional distress. The proposed model includes real-time detection and the ability to learn by constantly updating its dataset with new job postings, which improves classification performance over time. Experimental results show that the Naïve Bayes classifier performs better than other models, achieving higher accuracy in telling apart legitimate and spam job listings. With its ability to scale and adapt, the framework offers a dependable solution for improving the security and trustworthiness of online job markets.

title: Hybrid LSTM–CNN Model for Real-Time Anomaly Detection in IoT-Enabled Smart Solar Energy Networks
authors: B. Hari Kumar, V. Tamilselvan, Raj Kumar Gupta, Arulkumar. P, Manikandan S, Radhakrishnan P
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Identifying irregularities in IoT-enabled smart solar energy systems is essential for maintaining continuous power generation and operational dependability. Current models frequently struggle to achieve a compromise between precision and real-time speed, particularly in edge-computing contexts. This proposed paper presents a hybrid deep learning model that combines 1D Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) with Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) units to deal with spatial interdependence across sensor channels and the temporal dynamics of solar data. Real-time multivariate data streams are preprocessed and input into the hybrid architecture to identify irregularities such as power fluctuations, shading, or device malfunctions. The system is implemented on edge hardware with improvements like quantisation and pruning. Evaluation of a Kaggle-sourced dataset reveals the model's exceptional efficacy: an accuracy of 98.6%, precision of 98.1%, recall of 97.9%, and an F1-score of 98.0%, outperforming baseline methods like as LSTM, CNN, and Random Forest. This proposed study enhances real-time solar network surveillance and offers a scalable framework for intelligent anomaly identification in distributed energy systems.

title: Real-time Machine Data Monitoring and Alerting System for Controlling Defective Work in The Production Process
authors: Montagon Krutrarak, Kittiched Kaivijit, Chaiyong Soemphol
publish: 2025 International Conference on Power, Energy and Innovations (ICPEI)
abstract: In the manufacturing industry, reducing defects and downtime is important for improving efficiency. This research presents a real-time data monitoring and alerting system designed for Full Can Inspector (FCI) machines to help control production defects. The system uses Internet of Things (IoT) technology to send machine data to an SQL database. A web dashboard shows this information and sends real-time alerts when defects exceed set limits. The system was tested for 4 months in a beverage factory, and the results showed excellent performance. Key findings include 100% accuracy in detecting all defect events, an average alert speed of less than 5 seconds, and 99.9% system uptime. The system’s sensitive alerts were triggered 438 times at the 1-minute level, 373 times at the 10minute level, and 363 times at the 60-minute level. Overall, the system greatly improves visibility into production problems, allows for faster responses, and provides valuable data for long-term efficiency improvements.

title: From Clicks to Community: Leveraging Social Computing, Data Mining, and Generative AI for Customer Retention and Ecosystem Growth in ECommerce
authors: Karan Kumar Ratra, Dhruv Kumar Seth, Deepika Verma, Hemant Burman
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Modern e-commerce thrives on interactive digital channels and virtual communities, with advances in social computing, data mining, and generative AI unlocking new opportunities for customer acquisition, retention, and platform resilience. This paper proposes a cross-platform framework that transforms passive clicks into active community engagement and buying intent. The system integrates generative AI for hyper-personalized content creation, recommendations, and sentiment-aware interactions; predictive data mining for trend discovery, churn prediction, and inventory optimization; and social computing for uncovering behavioral patterns and fostering digital communities. Grounded in recent studies (2020–2025), the framework demonstrates significant impact: more than 30% improvements in loyalty and repeat purchases, conversion rates up to four times higher, and buyer journeys accelerated by nearly 50% compared to conventional digital models. The architecture also incorporates privacy-by-design, explainable AI, and scalable cloud-native deployment to mitigate challenges in trust, ethics, and system performance. Findings provide both a theoretical foundation and a practical roadmap for integrating AI-driven personalization and community building in e-commerce, offering value to researchers, practitioners, and policymakers pursuing sustainable digital innovation.

title: Automated Forensic Analysis: The use of Robotics in Digital Crime Scene Investigation
authors: Kanika Pandit, Renu Mahajan
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Digital forensic experts benefit from robotic system applications through an innovative approach that drives their investigative work. Digital crimes presently increase at a speed faster than traditional criminal investigation protocols can evolve. The paper examines how Digital Crime scene investigations benefit from Robotic Process Automation by analyzing the practical implementation of crime scene mapping together with evidence collection as well as automated data acquisition and malware analysis and forensic DNA analysis. The use of robotics in criminal investigations enhances operational efficiency while ensuring exact data collection through improved safety measures that allow investigators to manage better levels of mental and physical exhaustion. The study acknowledges deployment barriers which include high costs and inconsistent operational protocols in addition to moral dilemmas and instructor needs. Forces need to conduct more research about artificial intelligence robotics and cloud computing systems in forensics investigations but should study analytical frameworks for cyber-physical systems at the same time.

title: Detection of Emotions, Age, Gender in Speech using Deep Learning Models
authors: Chiluveri Mounika, CH. Sreenivasa Rao, Medi Koushik Goud, Patlolla Nishanth Reddy
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: This study introduces an advanced framework for Speech Emotion Recognition (SER) that integrates demographic characteristics—specifically age and gender—with acoustic features like Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficients (MFCCs), chroma, and spectral attributes to enhance emotion classification. The system employs various machine learning models, including Support Vector Machine (SVM), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), and Random Forest (RF), to effectively categorize emotional states from audio recordings. Results from experiments show that the combination of demographic features and acoustic traits leads to improved performance of the model, achieving a total accuracy of 87.5%. These results underscore the effectiveness of a multi-feature approach for creating more robust and personalized systems for emotion recognition across different speaker demographics.

title: Inclusive Education via Emotion-Aware Tutoring using Real-Time Recognition
authors: Gurusigaamani Ayyanar Muthulingam, Velmurugan Subbiah Parvathy, T. Siva Manikanta Reddy, A. Venkata Sai Krishna, D. Venkatesu, B. Venkata Kowshik
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: In this paper, we present an Emotion-Aware Intelligent Tutoring System (EA-ITS), a system designed to improve learning by paying attention to students' feelings. It applies instant facial emotion recognition (FER) to identify how a student feels, and then changes its teaching style accordingly. Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) are used for emotion detection through feature extraction and classification from streaming video input. Identified emotions instigate automatic modifications in content difficulty, feedback mode, and pacing to sustain interest and increase retention. Experiments demonstrate strong emotion recognition accuracy and significant gains in learner motivation, satisfaction, and performance over conventional ITS. The findings indicate the potential of integrating affective computing with adaptive tutoring for personalized, empathetic, real-time learning.

title: A 22-30 GHz GaAs Power Amplifier with 24.1 dBm Peak Output Power and 41.2% Peak PAE
authors: Shiyang Gao, Peigen Zhou, Wenyan Lyu, Yuren Mi, Jixin Chen, Wei Hong
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: In this paper, a <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$22-30 \text{GHz}$</tex> broadband power amplifier (PA) with high output power, high gain and high poweradded efficiency (PAE) is presented. Designed in <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$0.1 \mu \mathrm{m}$</tex> GaAs pHEMT technology, the PA exhibits a peak saturated output power (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{P}_{\text{sat }}$</tex>) of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{2 4. 1 d B m}$</tex> and an output <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{1 d B}$</tex> compression point (OP1dB) of 21.7 dBm at 23 GHz, with power-added efficiency of 41.2% at an input power level of 0 dBm. The PA achieves larger than 29.3 dB small signal gain and a measured <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{P}_{\text{sat }}$</tex> above 23.3 dBm across the frequency range, the PAE is higher than 33% over a wide frequency range from 22 to 30 GHz. The measured 1-dB <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathrm{P}_{\text{sat }}$</tex> bandwidth of the PA is from 21 to 30 GHz. The PA consumes 143 mA with a supply voltage of 4 V and a chip area of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$2.7 \times 1.1 \text{mm}^{2}$</tex>.

title: Signal Integrity Analysis of Ramp Interconnects for Packaging
authors: Cheng-Ji Zhao, Ji-Dong Liu, Gang Zhang, Yan-Qun Liu, Xin-Ni Hu, Wan-Chun Tang
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: 3D printed interconnects stand out for superior RF performance and enhanced mechanical reliability for electronics packaging. In this paper, ramp CPW transmission line interconnects are designed to interface the silicon die with the packaging substrate over the 10-40 GHz frequency band. The transmission line impedance matching theory is utilized to ascertain the optimal signal trace width of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$18.59 \mu \mathrm{m}$</tex> and slot width of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$8.93 \mu \mathrm{m}$</tex>. For various leadframe sizes, the ensuing simulation results exhibit an insertion loss of less than 0.35 dB per interconnect across the whole operation range. This 3D interconnects technology for SoP offers significant advantages over traditional wire bonding.

title: Research on Energy Balancing of Sodium-Ion Batteries Based on Adaptive Active–Passive Balancing Circuit and Segmented Balancing Strategy
authors: Yi Yang, Shiping Zhao, Quan Ran, Yuxuan Yao, Yaojiang Li, Haoran Zhang
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Information Technology (AICIT)
abstract: To address the issues of slow balancing speed and low energy transfer efficiency in series-connected sodium-ion battery packs during the balancing process, this paper proposes an adaptive hierarchical active–passive hybrid balancing topology. The proposed structure employs the state of charge (SOC) and terminal voltage of individual cells as balancing variables, and adopts a segmented balancing control strategy to achieve rapid synchronization among cells. First, the overall architecture, operating principle, and derivation of key parameters of the proposed topology are elaborated in detail. Then, a hierarchical balancing control strategy is designed based on the topology. Finally, simulation models of various topologies are constructed on the Matlab/Simulink platform to perform comparative verification of balancing performance. Simulation results demonstrate that, in an eight-cell series-connected battery pack, the proposed adaptive active–passive hybrid topology improves balancing speed by 84.19% and energy transfer efficiency by 4.1% compared with conventional single-layer topologies. Furthermore, with the introduction of the segmented balancing strategy, the balancing speed is additionally improved by 2.86%, resulting in an overall improvement of 87.05% compared with traditional methods. These results effectively validate the superiority and practicality of the proposed topology and control strategy.

title: Robust Electrical Performance of Diamond Schottky Barrier Diodes Post 10 MGy Hard X-ray Exposure
authors: Phongsaphak Sittimart, Shinya Ohmagari
publish: 2025 Research, Invention, and Innovation Congress: Innovative Electricals and Electronics (RI2C)
abstract: Pseudo-vertical diamond Schottky barrier diodes (SBDs) were fabricated on a CVD-grown diamond substrate. The radiation hardness of the diamond SBDs was examined using hard X-ray irradiation at a radiation absorption dose of 10 MGy. Before the irradiation, ideality factor (n), Schottky barrier height (ϕ<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">b</inf>), breakdown voltage, and breakdown field (E<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">max</inf>) of the diamond SBDs were 1.09, 1.35 eV, 750 V, and 2.5 MV/cm, respectively. After irradiation, these electrical parameters remained almost constant. These results suggest that diamond SBD is an extremely radiation-hard electronic device, making it well-suited to applications in extreme environments, such as space and nuclear technologies.

title: Towards a Framework for Automatic Evaluation of Key Management Schemes in Wireless Ad Hoc Networks
authors: Ahlem Nasri, Abdelhabib Bourouis, Kenza Gasmi
publish: 2025 International Conference on Smart-Green Technology in Electrical and Information Systems (ICSGTEIS)
abstract: Key management schemes (KMSs) are essential for secure communication in wireless ad hoc networks (WANETs). However, current KMS evaluation approaches are largely qualitative and narrowly scoped, limiting their effectiveness in guiding optimal KMS selection. This paper introduces an automated evaluation framework that defines a comprehensive set of performance metrics encompassing security, efficiency, scalability, and resilience. A simulationbased environment is designed to assess KMSs under diverse attacker models and scenarios. By addressing the lack of standardization and the subjectivity of manual methods, the framework supports more objective and reproducible evaluations. The preliminary implementation phase demonstrates its feasibility and value for both WANET designers and researchers.

title: Passive Binary Coding Metamaterial Reconfigurable Intelligent Surfaces (RIS) with Steerable Reflection Beam for Next Generation Communication
authors: Nur Hasni Marzuki, Muzammil Jusoh, Thennarasan Sabapathy, Muhammad Fitra Zambak, Mohamed Nasrun Osman, Muhammad Ramlee Kamarudin, Huda A. Majid, Suhail Ashgar Qureshi
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: Reconfigurable Intelligent Surfaces (RIS) are used as an aided device to ensure the signal gets connected in the presence of blockages between the transmitter and the receiver. Utilizing diverse steered angles elucidates the potential enhancements in shaping the future of telecommunications, including improved signal strength and reduced interference. Moreover, it offers a versatile solution for optimizing coverage and connectivity in complex environments. This study presents the innovative application of passive binary coding metamaterial reconfigurable intelligent surfaces (PBCM-RIS) operating at an effective frequency of 3.5 GHz. This study focuses on the 1-bit binary coding design and performance analysis of RIS with steerable capabilities, particularly configurations to achieve angles of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$0^{\circ}, 18^{\circ}, 25^{\circ}, 39^{\circ}$</tex>, and 47°. The proposed architecture might offer the simplest and cost-effective approach to facilitate the next wireless generation communication.

title: The Design Challenges and I/O Performance Tuning Methodology for Advance GPU System Integration
authors: Li Wern Chew, Cheng Yu Tan
publish: 2025 20th International Microsystems, Packaging, Assembly and Circuits Technology Conference (IMPACT)
abstract: This paper provides an overview of a graphics processing unit (GPU) product universal baseboard (UBB) integration into data center system design, including the introduction of common end-to-end system topology and its channel electrical characteristics such as insertion loss and impedance discontinuity. Due to the uniqueness of each system’s electrical performance, a comprehensive signal integrity (SI) simulation is first conducted. Additionally, a post-silicon retimer tuning process is also discussed to improve I/O link performance during UBB system integration at a customer data center. The work presented here helps not only to enable end consumers for a smoother and quicker time-to-market adoption of GPU products, but it could also help to improve the working model efficiency and enlighten customer support services.

title: Prototype for Measuring Local Gravitational Acceleration Using the Free-Fall Method for Calibration of Force Measuring Instruments
authors: Endang Priyatna, Arisa Olivia Putri, Ariep Jaenul, Devan Junesco Vresdian, Sinka Wilyanti, Legenda Prameswono Pratama
publish: 2025 International Conference on Smart-Green Technology in Electrical and Information Systems (ICSGTEIS)
abstract: Local gravitational acceleration is a key parameter in force calibration, enabling accurate conversion from mass to Newtons. However, many calibration laboratories lack access to precise gravity data at their sites. This paper presents a gravity measurement prototype based on the free-fall method in a vacuum chamber to minimize air resistance. The system incorporates dual infrared sensors, an HX711 module for high-precision data acquisition, and IoT-based monitoring through Blynk and an LCD interface, and was developed using the ADDIE model. Sensor calibration showed optimal distance accuracy at 4 cm, time calibration with a maximum deviation of 34.66 ms over <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$0.5-10 \mathrm{s}$</tex>, object detection with a 0.0043 standard deviation, and vacuum pressure accuracy with a maximum error of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{0. 0 7 5 k P a}$</tex>. Measurements at five sites in Jabodetabek yielded local gravity values between <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$9.77179 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}$</tex> and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$9.77971 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}$</tex>. These measurements were compared against local gravity values computed using ASTM E4-16 standards, confirming accuracy. The prototype demonstrates suitability as a gravity-based force calibration instrument, providing traceable measurements and remote monitoring capabilities for calibration laboratories.

title: Energy-Efficient Acceleration of Hash-Based Post-Quantum Cryptographic Schemes on Embedded Spatial Architectures
authors: Yanze Wu, Md Tanvir Arafin
publish: 2025 34th International Conference on Parallel Architectures and Compilation Techniques (PACT)
abstract: This work introduces AXIOS, a novel spatial architecture for accelerating hash-based post-quantum cryptography (PQC) primitives. AXIOS demonstrates that structural regularities in hash-based algorithms can be efficiently mapped to spatial accelerators that support FPGA-based programming for granular control and coarse-grained reconfigurable arrays (CGRA) for repeated tasks. AXIOS selects the key generation task of the eXtended Markle Signature Scheme (XMSS), which embodies critical implementation challenges in modern hash-based (PQC) algorithms. The AXIOS implementation on AMD’s VCK190 platform demonstrates an $8.54 \times$ improvement in runtime and a $71.65 \times$ improvement in energy efficiency compared to a benchmark implementation on Intel’s Core $\mathbf{i 9 - 1 4 9 0 0 K}$. AXIOS also breaks the current record of XMSS acceleration in terms of execution time on an embedded SoC or an FPGA platform. To our knowledge, this is the first efficient hardware implementation of compute-intensive hash-based PQC schemes in an embedded spatial architecture. Albeit complex, this FPGA+CGRA-based design is a promising step to support compute-intensive PQC applications at the edge. This work’s code and experimental artifacts are publicly available at https://github.com/SPIRE-GMU/AXIOS.

title: Charge-Mediated Effects in Dual-Gate Reconfigurable Field-Effect Transistors
authors: Zhenlei Qin, Bin Sun
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: In this work, we investigate charge-mediated effects in dual-gate reconfigurable field-effect transistors (RFET) using TCAD simulations. It is revealed that both the characteristic kink in transfer curves of program gate at source (PGAS) and the sub-linear triode regime in output curves of program gate at drain (PGAD) originate from charge-mediated modulation of the source-side Schottky junction. In PGAS mode, this effect degrades the local subthreshold swing, with its severity controlled by both the program gate and drain voltages. In PGAD mode, the resulting sublinearity adversely impacts inverter performance, significantly degrading noise margin.

title: A Design of 110GHz-150GHz Bandpass Filter Based on Rectangular Waveguide
authors: Xiaoye Luo, Bo Zhang, Bin Li
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: A ninth-order waveguide bandpass filter with a center frequency of 130 GHz and a passband of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$110 \text{GHz}-150 \text{GHz}$</tex> is designed in this paper. Based on the introduction of transmission zeros in the upper stopband of the high-order mode resonator, the filter is simulated and optimized with the advantages of low insertion loss and a simple structure. The simulation results show that the ninth-order rectangular waveguide bandpass filter designed in this paper has good performance, with return loss better than 19.6 dB in the passband, insertion loss less than 0.1dB in the passband, and out-of-band suppression greater than <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{4 0 d B}$</tex> at <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{9 5 G H z}$</tex> and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{1 6 5 G H z}$</tex>.

title: The Influence of Control Points on Reconstruction Accuracy and Analysis of Surface Point Cloud Deviation
authors: Fanwen Meng, Yuxiang Zhang, Weixian Shao
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Information Technology (AICIT)
abstract: The surface point cloud error and surface smoothness characteristics and their influencing factors are studied, and the methods to improve surface quality are proposed. The number of control points affects the final surface reconstruction accuracy. For millions of point clouds and 100 quadrilateral domain subdivision areas, it is more appropriate to use 60-80 control points for surface fitting. The influence of surface order, node number, and smoothness coefficient on surface point cloud error was analyzed. For 6082 point cloud data, when fitting with a surface order of 4×4, node number of 5 × 5, and smoothness coefficient of 0.7000, the maximum deviation between the surface and point cloud was only 0.0408mm. By reducing redundant control points and dynamically adjusting the spatial position of control points, the surface smoothness can be improved while satisfying the surface point cloud error.

title: Integrating Supervised and Unsupervised Learning for Prognostic Prediction in Breast Cancer
authors: Chun Yi Lim, Hui Na Chua, Muhammed Basheer Jasser, Bayan Issa, Ghassan Saleh ALDharhani
publish: 2025 IEEE 15th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology (ICSET)
abstract: Breast cancer prognosis remains a critical clinical challenge, with the Nottingham Prognostic Index (NPI) serving as a widely used standard for outcome prediction. While machine learning has been increasingly applied in oncology, most studies focus either on predictive modelling or unsupervised subgroup discovery, limiting their translational value. This study addresses that gap by integrating both regression-based prediction and clustering-based stratification into a unified framework. Using clinical and molecular features, multiple regression models were evaluated for NPI prediction. XGBoost achieved the highest accuracy (R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> = 0.85, MSE = 0.0012), outperforming Random Forest (R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> = 0.80), Support Vector Regression (R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> = 0.72), and Linear Regression (R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> = 0.65). For post-treatment stratification, clustering methods were employed to identify subgroups with distinct therapeutic responses. K-Means achieved the best separation (silhouette score = 0.72), while DBSCAN and Hierarchical Clustering offered complementary but less distinct subgroup structures. Beyond methodological validation, the combined supervised-unsupervised framework contributes new domain knowledge by linking predictive prognostic models with patient stratification, thereby extending the utility of the NPI. This dual approach demonstrates that advanced ensemble regression can improve prognostic accuracy while clustering reveals hidden treatment-response patterns, supporting progress toward more personalized oncology.

title: Design and Implementation of AODV Routing Protocol for IoT Devices Using Raspberry Pi
authors: Yuslinda Wati Mohamad Yusof, Murizah Kassim, Mohd Nazri Ismail, Meor Mohd Azreen Meor Hamzah
publish: 2025 IEEE 15th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology (ICSET)
abstract: The Ad-hoc On-demand Distance Vector (AODV) routing protocol has been widely studied for its reactive nature and low control overhead that make it suitable for Internet of things (IoT) applications. However, most evaluations of AODV have been conducted in simulation environments, limiting insights into its real-world performance particularly regarding energy consumption and constrained hardware. This paper explores the real implementation AODV routing protocol in real world IoT system to enable dynamic communication between devices. A small-scale testbed consisting several sensors with Raspberry Pi was designed. A physical IoT server was developed using a Raspberry Pi while the client nodes were created using NetSim tool. The server code was executed to listen for incoming connections, and the AODV protocol was used to handle route discovery and maintenance. Packet exchanges were monitored using Wireshark to analyze both control and data transmission. The results showed successful route discovery through AODV Route Request and Reply packets, followed by the transmission of real-time sensor data from sensors via UDP protocol. Payloads such as temperature, <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$23.0{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$</tex> and humidity, 88.0 % confirmed the end-to-end communication. In conclusion, AODV proved to be a feasible and effective routing protocol for decentralized IoT networks, offering a lightweight and dynamic solution for real-time data exchange in infrastructure-less environments.

title: A Dual Port MIMO Utilizing Perforated DRA Fed with SIW for Enhanced Performance
authors: Nida Nasir, Mohd Haizal Jamaluddin, Hamza Ahmad, Abdullah Abdullah, Khaloud Aljahwari
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: A dual port MIMO with a perforated dielectric resonator antenna fed with a substrate-integrated waveguide is presented. The designed antenna provides enhanced performance.in terms of the reflection coefficient <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\left(\mathrm{S}_{11}<-10 \text{dB}\right)$</tex>, port isolation <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\left(\mathrm{S}_{{2 1}}<-2 5 \text{dB}\right)$</tex>, peak gain 9.6 dBi, efficiency >95%. In addition, MIMO parameters, Diversity Gain (DG) exceeds 9.99 dB, and Envelope Correlation Coefficient (ECC) below 0.006 at the resonant frequencies.

title: Multi-Algorithm ML Framework for Intrusion Detection and Resilient Security in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks
authors: Ramya S, Jehan Kadhim Shareef Al-Safi, B J Ashwin, G. Manikandan, Arul Mary Rexy V, Revathi R
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The proposed system explores the improvement of security in MANETs using Machine Learning-based IDS. The paper starts by providing a comprehensive examination of vulnerabilities in MANETs and the increasing risks posed by wormhole attacks. Intrusion detection uses a range of ML techniques including SVM, KNN, Decision Tree, LDA, NB, and CNN. The findings demonstrate significant improvements over time: a rise in accuracy from 96.7% in 2021 to 98.3% in 2023, and an increase in sensitivity from 95.2% to 97.2%. The specificity exhibited a continuous high level, with an average of 98.8% observed throughout the years. The precision showed a significant increase, rising from 95.2% to 98.1%. The results highlight the efficacy of ML-based IDS in enhancing the security of MANETs, specifically in identifying wormhole assaults. The study's findings indicate that the use of ML methods greatly improves the ability to identify intrusions, hence enhancing the resilience and security of the MANET system.

title: MCPNet: A New Maximum Correlation Point Pruning for Few-shot Semantic Segmentation
authors: SijieWang, TaoLu, KanghuiZhao
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Information Technology (AICIT)
abstract: Few-shot semantic segmentation (FSS) effectively reduces the model’s dependence on large-scale data annotation and significantly improves its generalization performance. However, existing pruning strategies remain insufficient in handling significant target variations and generalizing to complex scenes, often resulting in decreased segmentation accuracy. To address these challenges, this study proposes a novel maximum correlation point pruning strategy that aims to fully retain key discriminative information while suppressing redundant and interfering features. Specifically, we design an attention-guided Maximum Correlation Point Pruning Module (AMP). This module fuses global context information with local detailed features and employs an attention mechanism to adaptively weight the correlation information, accurately selecting the most discriminative key feature points for the semantic segmentation task, thereby effectively improving segmentation performance. Based on this innovations, we construct a complete Maximum Correlation Point Pruning Network (MCPNet). Extensive experiments conducted on the PASCAL-5<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">i</sup> and FSS-1000 datasets demonstrate that the proposed method significantly outperforms current state-of-the-art methods across various evaluation scenarios and settings.

title: Structural design and development of cross-legged robot based on STM32
authors: Yijie Dai, Haoyang Wang, Baoxian Jiao, Yanfei Dong, Zhenzhen Cheng
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Control, Robotics and Cybernetics (CRC)
abstract: This study focuses on the external mechanical structure design, gait planning, and servo control system development of the cross-legged robot. By equipping pitch degrees of freedom at the hip, knee, and ankle joints, the system effectively addresses error accumulation caused by the absence of sensor feedback, significantly enhancing the robot’s stability and locomotion capabilities. The servo control system achieves precise execution of critical gait movements, including center of gravity transfer and leg swing, through accurate angle regulation and motion sequence coordination, thereby improving operational stability during complex maneuvers. The sensor-free architecture endows the robot with enhanced adaptability to extreme environments, indicating significant engineering potential in practical applications.

title: High Response Joint with a Large Range of Variable Stiffness Range and based on Magnetorheological Fluids
authors: Wei Sun, Shujian Liu, Yunfei Liu, Jiyong Fan, Xiaofeng Yang
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Control, Robotics and Cybernetics (CRC)
abstract: Magnetorheological fluids (MRFs) with excellent rheological characteristics can be effectively employed in the variable stiffness joints. In the case of service robots, which are entailed in physical human–robot interactions, highly responsive joints with a large variable stiffness range are required. Thus, we synthesized MRFs by dispersing magnetic Fe particles in a Ga–In–Sn eutectic alloy. This fluid-to-solid change of MRFs under an applied magnetic field occurs precisely within milliseconds and is completely reversible. The mechanical structure of the variable stiffness joint actuator (VSJA) based on MRFs was proposed in this study. By embedding an MRFs transmission inside a traditional robot joint, a compliant joint with controllable and adjustable stiffness characteristics, which allows it to possess both rigidity and flexibility, was developed. Further, a shear yield stress model based on the average energy density was proposed. The variable stiffness model of the joint actuator was established based on the shear yield stress and kinematic equations. Moreover, we built an experimental platform for the mechanical performance tests of the VSJA. Compared with the joints with a mechanically variable-stiffness mechanism, the VSJA has a large stiffness, ranging from 0 to 512 N∙m/rad, and can be beneficial for safe human–robot interactions. Further, the VSJA prototype based on MRFs has short response time (approximately 100–200 ms from the minimum to the maximum torque). Thus, a high-frequency response for a variable-stiffness joint is fabricated and verified for application in robotics research.

title: A Model Reference Adaptive Control System for Phase-Locked Loop (PLL) in Grid-Connected Power Systems
authors: Mostafa Khavaninzadeh, Ramin Nahavandi, Mojtaba Moti
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Control, Instrumentation and Automation (ICCIA)
abstract: This paper proposes an advanced control architecture leveraging Model Reference Adaptive Control (MRAC) principles for Phase-Locked Loop (PLL) systems, specifically engineered for coordinated transformation in rotating frame-based control architectures of high-power converter applications. The presented methodology introduces an innovative hybrid approach that synthesizes linear control mechanisms with adaptable nonlinear control elements, underpinned by model reference adaptive control theory. The robust stability characteristics of the closed-loop system have been rigorously established through comprehensive Lyapunov stability analysis. Utilizing the theoretical framework of the Lyapunov stability theorem, the adjustment parameters for the adaptive mechanism are derived autonomously. Additionally, the proposed framework exhibits inherent self-tuning capabilities under various grid perturbations. Extensive simulation studies conducted under nominal, unbalanced, and harmonic grid conditions substantiate the efficacy of the proposed methodology.

title: A Passive X-Band Wide-Angle High-Gain Van Atta Reflector
authors: Yunxiang Pei, Wu Ren, Dan Ding, Weiming Li
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: In this paper, a new design of Van Atta reflector array is proposed, a circularly polarized antenna is designed as the array element based on circularly polarized patch antenna, and a 16-element circularly polarized Van Atta directional retrospective circular arrangement array is designed to solve the problems of limited angular coverage and insufficient gain in Xband applications of traditional Van Atta arrays. According to the post-simulation results, the maximum enhancement amplitude of RCS at <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$9.55 \text{GHz}, 9.65 \text{GHz}$</tex>, and 9.75 GHz can reach more than 30 dB.

title: Symmetrical Orthomode Transducer for Low Cross-Polarization W-Band Horn Antennas
authors: Zhenhao Wang, Shibo Ya, Hongfu Meng
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper presents a symmetrical orthomode transducer (OMT) for low cross-polarization W-band horn antennas. Both orthogonal polarizations input from the common port are transmitted in the dominant mode to the corresponding polarization ports with high isolation. Symmetrization is applied to all discontinuous structures to suppress higher-order modes and reduce cross-polarization. Within the operating frequency range of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$90-110 \text{GHz}$</tex>, the reflection coefficients of both horizontal and vertical polarized waves are less than -12 dB, the transmission loss is less than 0.7 dB, the isolation between the two polarization ports is less than <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$-\mathbf{3 5 d B}$</tex>. The cross-polarization is less than <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$-\mathbf{5 0 d B}$</tex> with the addition of a horn. The designed OMT has the performance advantages of low cross-polarization, high isolation, wide bandwidth, and low transmission loss.
