Paired t-tests confirmed these differences were statistically significant for AUSMI-based models $(\mathbf{p}\lt 0.05)$. GRU yielded the best overall performance ($\mathrm{R}^{2}=0.727$), and visual analysis showed it better captured rainfall patterns. These findings suggest that, for short-term rainfall forecasting, local precipitation histories offer greater predictive value than largescale climate indices.

title: Employ the Reinforcement Learning (RL) and Predictive Handover Techniques: Apply Intelligent Mobility Management in 5G Wireless Networks
authors: Karpagam P, Hebatullah Awwad, K Seejamini, Shobana D, Kambham Pratap Joshi, G. Karthikeyan
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The forthcoming 5G wireless networks impose various requirements such as seamless connectivity, ultra-low latency, and high mobility support. Conventional handover techniques that are based on fixed thresholds and reactive actions cannot efficiently ensure the robustness of handover in high-density 5G networks. To overcome these issues, in this study, we submit that we will use reinforcement learning mechanisms and anticipate their possible handover method considered smart mobility management in 5G networks. RL frameworks enable an agent to learn a policy for an optimal handover scheme by interacting with the environment to learn long-term user mobility patterns, network load and signal quality metrics. Compared to the traditional static algorithms, RL based solutions dynamically makes handover decisions and thereby resources are utilized in an efficient manner, which leads to reduction in unnecessary handovers, ping-pong effects and radio link failures. Predictive handover approaches additionally improve mobility management by predicting user movement and network state, and by supporting proactive resource allocation and cell changes. By combining RL with predictive models, our system is able to predict user movement and accordingly adapt handover triggers, providing better QoS and a better user experience. This article proposes a new RL-based handover model using location prediction algorithm, real-time measured signals, and historical mobility data change for handover resting time and target cell decision to be optimized. Simulation results show that the proposed scheme can achieve significant improvements over traditional handover schemes in three perspectives, including: lower handover failure rate, less latency in handover transition, and superior load balancing among base stations. The ability of the framework to learn and adjust for diverse network environments makes it a promising candidate for future 5G implementations in urban cities, high-speed rail, and dense vehicular environments. Moreover, the proposed scheme is consistent with network slicing and edge computing and can provide QoS requirements for various applications including autonomous driving, VR and massive IoT. In summary, the combination of RL with predictive handover techniques provides a disruptive way to approach mobility management in the 5G context. By involving data-driven, adaptive, and proactive handover policies, this work alleviates the constraints of static policies, supporting the vision of intelligent, self-organizing networks. More advanced because their concepts can be unfortunately extended to 6G systems using for example: cutting-edge AI models, real-time federated learning, and cross-layer optimization to achieve even better mobility management under high dynamics and heterogeneous wireless settings.

title: Impact of Smoking and Lung Capacity on Disease Recovery: A Machine Learning Perspective
authors: R. Susmitha
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: In this research, we use machine learning methods to forecast recovery outcomes for lung disease patients from clinical and lifestyle information. From a dataset of anonymized patient records, we performed exploratory data analysis that identified smoking status and disease type as major differentiators in recovery. The Random Forest Classifier reached an accuracy of 87.3% with precision at 89% and recall at 85% and F1-score at 87% while processing the test data. The model determined lung capacity, smoking status, and treatment type as the most important predictive variables. These findings demonstrate how well data-driven strategies work to improve prognostic abilities and customize treatments for respiratory conditions.

title: Modeling and Control of an Electro-hydraulic Active Suspension System
authors: Hongyu Ye, Lijun Zhang, Dejian Meng
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: This paper conducts a study on an electro-hydraulic active suspension system. Initially, models of the vehicle, actuator, controller, and road profile are established. Subsequently, the actuator model is validated. Finally, control of the active suspension under road excitation is investigated. The results indicate that the RMS-normalized RMSE (NRMSE) of the actuator output force error is less than 3% and 2% under passive and active modes, respectively. Active suspension control achieves a reduction of 23.63% in the root mean square (RMS) value of sprung mass acceleration and 12.34% in the RMS value of suspension dynamic deflection under speed bump excitation. Similarly, under random road excitation, it yields reductions of 21.12% and 17.27% in the respective metrics. Under both bump road excitation and random road excitation, the NRMSE value of the active control force error remains less than 2%. Overall, this paper contributes to the future research on active suspension systems.

title: Analysis Of The Success Factor Of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Oracle Netsuite In Coal Mining Company With The Delone And Mclean ModelL Approach
authors: Jodhi Caster, Viany Utami Tjhin
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electronic and Electrical Engineering and Intelligent System (ICE3IS)
abstract: The adoption of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems has become pivotal for modern enterprises seeking to enhance operational efficiencies and decision-making processes. This study evaluates the acceptance level of Oracle NetSuite ERP at PT PADA IDI, a coal mining company, utilizing the DeLone and McLean Model for measuring information systems success. The research aims to identify critical factors influencing ERP acceptance and to address operational challenges observed in the ERP’s integration with auxiliary applications. By conducting a mixed-methods approach, the study not only quantifies ERP acceptance through user surveys but also delves into qualitative insights from ERP users to understand the nuances behind the acceptance levels. Initial findings suggest that system quality, information quality, and service quality significantly impact user satisfaction and the subsequent utility of the ERP system, which ultimately influences organizational efficiency and operational success.

title: Artificial Intelligence in Oral Health: A Study for the Detection of Oral Precancerous Conditions
authors: K. S. Shashikala, S. Umamaheswaran
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Timely identification of precancerous abnormalities in oral tissues is essential for preventing their advancement to oral cancer, a disease characterized by significant morbidity and fatality rates. Algorithms focused on machine learning (ML) or deep learning (DL) have exhibited significant potential in augmenting diagnostic precision, facilitating early detection, and minimizing the necessity for invasive treatments. This study offers a thorough examination of recent developments in ML and DL applications for the identification of oral precancerous lesions. This study presents a comparative analysis of two powerful architectures based on deep learning, namely Google Net and EfficientNet-B0, for the task of binary classification of oral cancer images. The models were fine-tuned using transfer learning on a curated dataset consisting of non-cancerous and cancerous oral images. A rigorous methodology incorporating 5-fold cross-validation was adopted to ensure robust and unbiased evaluation, along with data augmentation methods to improve model generalization and address the limited dataset size. F1-score, recall, precision and accuracy were the evaluation metrics used to examine the model performance. The results revealed that EfficientNet-B0 slightly outperformed Google Net, achieving an average accuracy of 91.67% and a balanced precision, recall, and F1-score of 0.92. Google Net also performed competitively, with an average accuracy of 90.44%, precision of 89.58%, recall of 92.02%, and F1-score of 90.43%, indicating its reliability. The study demonstrates that while both models are effective, EfficientNet-B0 offers a marginal edge in performance for oral cancer detection tasks, making it a promising choice for clinical decision support systems. The analysis also emphasizes the importance of cross-validation and augmentation in medical image classification where data scarcity is common.

title: Dual-Layer Cavity Backed Circular SIW Antenna for 5G Smart-Watches
authors: Ashutosh Srivastava, K. Venkateswaran
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: In this study, a Dual-Layer Cavity-Backed Circular Substrate Integrated Waveguide (SIW) antenna for 5G smartwatches is implemented. In this firstly, a planar uniform circular SIW cavity-backed slot-patch antenna is considered, and radiation from the slot antenna is reactivated with a symmetric planar patch antenna. The design is aimed at the smartwatch antenna. The slot antenna, which has an extended water drop shape, is made to fit inside the scopes of smartwatches. The target frequency is 5 GHz. A medical wristband operating on the 5 GHz Wi-Fi frequency might be added to the application. Conducting material is taken in the construction of the design cavity. This is a cylindrical-shaped device with a total volume of π ×900× 2.07 mm3. The antenna's circular boundary has a circumference of approximately 0.5λ. This makes the design suitable in the sense of concerning of size for smartwatch applications. The suggested smartwatch antenna design is meant to be used in a natural air environment without any RF influence. The design is examined using a computer hand artificially created using software and has real-world muscular characteristics to accomplish robust performance. The findings from the simulation demonstration shows that the antenna's efficiency on a phantom body is greater than 95%. To evaluate the antenna's performance in a more practical environment, the testing setup incorporates a conductive slab that simulates the microelectronic components of a smartwatch. The antenna's transmission and reception characteristics are thoroughly examined, with particular focus on surface current distribution and resonant behavior. The design maintains the full-mode Substrate Integrated Waveguide (SIW) structure while achieving size reduction through the use of a circular metallic SIW cavity. To further enhance electromagnetic performance and efficiency, a conductive via is strategically introduced within the cavity. This modification enables the coupling of two higher-order resonance modes at adjacent frequencies, contributing to improved overall antenna functionality. The suggested SIW antenna has an attained impedance frequency range of 152 MHz (4.918 GHz–5.07 GHz) and a highest gain of 13.0 dBi in free space, respectively. The proposed antenna cross-polarization level is also examined, and it shows at least -15 dB in the course of radiation. Under the simulation result, the mechanism of operation of the proposed antenna is the same as in real-world conditions. This proves that the suggested antenna is stiff and suitable for both on-body and off-body situations.

title: Design of Multi-Logic ALU with 6TSRAM for 2x1 SRAM Memory in SCL 180nm Technology
authors: Anand Yadav, Rajesh Khatri, Dinesh Kumar Choudhary, Gireesh Gaurav Soni, Rupali Mahant
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: In this paper, a 2x1 SRAM Memory (ALU: Arithmetic Logic Unit) is designed for performing multi-logic operations with the help of 6TSRAM and peripheral circuitry in Cadence Virtuoso; the technology node is SCL 180nm, and the supply voltage is 1.8V. The proposed ALU performed Boolean function operations like OR, NOR, AND, NAND, XOR, and XNOR at an accelerated speed, only with the help of a final single circuit. ALU consists of peripheral circuitry like a precharge circuit, a 2x1 column mux, and two voltage mode sense amplifiers (VMSA), two 6TSRAMs. All peripheral circuits comprise a final ALU, which is power efficient, and overall power consumption of ALU is 95.24μW, making the Boolean computation faster in comparison to normal logic operation with the help of transistor. This ALU reduces delay(latency) during performing logic operations. VMSA, which is an important part of this ALU implementation, senses voltage from BL/BLB on one node and compares it with a reference voltage on another node. Based on the reference voltage and voltage on BL, BLB, multi-logic operations happen with the help of 6TSRAM and another peripheral circuitry.

title: A Rapid and Accurate Monitoring Method for Birds in Substations Based on the Improved YOLOv11
authors: Sishi Fu, Zhiang Zhang, Junan Guo, Bo An, Jiarui Zhang, Qiang Dong, Sizhe Chen, Anqi Wang, Ruihuan Wang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: This paper addresses the increasingly prominent issue of “bird-related faults” in modern power systems by proposing an intelligent bird recognition and monitoring method based on an improved YOLOv11 algorithm. Given that traditional bird deterrent methods suffer from delayed response and low efficiency, and existing deep learning models still face challenges in detecting small-target birds, this paper introduces the NASFCOS detection head into YOLOv11 to enhance the model’s detection accuracy and real-time performance for bird targets of varying scales—particularly small-sized birds—in substation environments. The proposed method integrates artificial intelligence-based visual recognition technology with the requirements of power grid security protection, providing key technical support for developing an automated intelligent bird deterrent system that emphasizes “prevention as the priority, combining prevention and control,” thereby enhancing the safety and reliability of power grid operations.

title: Real-Time Phishing Domain Generation Detection using BERT and Lexical Analysis
authors: SivaKumar Depuru, K Lohitha, Yeluru Bhavya Sree, Kethu Karunya
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Phishing is one of the most common attack vectors in cybersecurity where attackers often create fake domains to circumvent blacklist-based filters and legacy classifiers. The current methods of phishing detection lack generalization between datasets and the ability to detect new domains in real-time. In this paper, a hybrid detection framework, which combines Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT) and lexical feature analysis, is suggested to detect phishing domain generations in real-time. The framework isolates domain-given lexical characteristics including entropy, character distribution and suspicious tokens and combines them with contextual embeddings of a fine-tuned BERT model. The experiments on benchmark phishing datasets (ISCX-2016, EBBU-2017, HISPAR-PhishStats) indicate that the proposed methodology results in an average accuracy of 97.2, an F1-score of 96.8, and a false positive rate of 0.9, which is much superior to state-of-the-art baselines. Moreover, the model has an average inference latency of 18 ms per domain, which confirms that it can be deployed in real time.

title: RGCNs: Relational Graph Convolutional Networks for Trust-based Fraud Identification in SIoT
authors: Rahul, Venkatesh, Malsawmtluanga, Vikas V, Vikram Vijeth T M, Vinay S Basavaraddi
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Observing growing use of smart and Social Internet of Things (SIoT) devices, trust and security have become major concerns. As more users connect and interact, fraudsters take advantage of weak trust systems to deceive genuine users. Addressing this particular problem, this paper are presenting a trust based fraud detection approach for SIoT using Relational Graph Convolutional Network (RGCN). Not like traditional methods which treat all connections equally, the proposed method considers different types of relationship between users to better capture real-world interactions. The proposed work build graph model wherein each node indicate users and each edge indicate various trust-based connections, and use RGCNs to learn patterns that help separate fraudsters from legitimate users. Additionally, The paper handle the issue of unbalanced data (fewer fraudsters than normal users) by applying a loss function designed to treat both classes fairly. This work highlights the value of using relationship-aware graph learning to build more secure SIoT environments.

title: Enhanced Optoelectronic Response in Si/GO/Ag Schottky Photodetector by Drop Casting Thin Film
authors: Prabin Kumar Mahato, Swarat Choudhari, Prashanta Patra, Shiv Prakash Verma
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The fabrication and performance analysis of a solution-processed Si/GO/Ag Schottky photodetector for broadband optical sensing has been reported here. Graphene oxide (GO) thin films were synthesized via the modified Hummers' method and deposited on Si substrates by drop casting, followed by thermal annealing. The device shows strong and stable photoresponse under visible illumination, achieving a peak responsivity of 4.4 A/W and a specific detectivity of ~1.9 × 1011 Jones under 532 nm light. Raman and XPS analyses confirm partial oxidation and surface functionalization of GO, while AFM reveals a moderately rough yet uniform film morphology. The photodetector exhibits low dark current (~1 nA), a high ON/OFF current ratio (4400), and sub-millisecond response times, making it a promising candidate for low-cost, high-performance optoelectronic applications in environmental sensing, imaging, and wearable devices.

title: Efficient Load Balancing in Electric Vehicle Charging Grids Using Reinforcement Learning
authors: Radhika Baskar, Sarithala Shareef, Ch. Sarada, Sandeep Reddy Narani, Gayathri S, Sathishkumar V E
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The fast adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) requires efficient management of charging infrastructure to avert grid overload and enhance energy distribution. This research introduces an innovative method for load balancing in EV charging networks using reinforcement learning (RL) methods. The proposed architecture utilizes Q-learning algorithms to assign charging resources dynamically, contingent upon real-time demand and energy availability. The simulation of several charging conditions illustrates how RL may adaptively acquire optimum charging techniques, therefore minimizing peak demand while maintaining user pleasure. Key performance parameters, including average waiting time and energy expenditures, demonstrate substantial improvement relative to traditional load-balancing techniques. Moreover, findings suggest incorporating renewable energy sources with RL-based load control might improve grid resilience and sustainability. It advances the creation of intelligent charging systems that can effectively manage the rising volume of EVs while enhancing grid stability and minimizing operating expenses. Future research will investigate incorporating advanced prediction models to enhance the load-balancing procedure.

title: Child Safety Net: An IoT-Driven Wearable Solution using Arduino UNO
authors: S. Sheeba Jeya Sophia, Boya Ramya, Pamappagari Jyothi, Nallapaneni Bhargava Nandhini
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Children are the most valuable and vulnerable group in society today. Concern over ensuring their safety has grown, especially when they are commuting to and from school every day and when they are in public or unfamiliar settings. Alarming incidents involving children are regularly highlighted in the media, frequently as a result of a lack of proactive monitoring or real-time tracking. In order to prevent such incidents, this paper discusses the urgent need for an all-encompassing child safety system that makes use of contemporary IoT technologies. Built on the Arduino Uno platform, the suggested system offers a wearable and portable safety gadget with GPS and GSM modules for precise location tracking and real-time SMS-based alerts, even when there is no internet connection. In an emergency, the system incorporates a panic button that allows the child to immediately notify parents or guardians. The gadget has anomaly detection systems and health tracking sensors to further improve dependability and enable ongoing child welfare monitoring. A small webcam module facilitates activity surveillance, and sensors are used to identify dangerous situations like high temperatures, gas leaks, or dangerous environments to guarantee environmental safety. The design places a high priority on low maintenance, waterproofing, and long battery life, guaranteeing that the device will continue to work in real-world settings for extended periods of time. In order to overcome connectivity issues in remote or low- signal areas, the system can also function in offline mode and provide real-time updates via GSM. In line with the current requirements of child protection in public, educational, and travel settings, the combination of these features provides parents and guardians with a strong and intelligent child safety net.

title: A Cybersecurity Framework for Non-Invasive Disease Detection and Medical Data Protection
authors: N. Gomathi, G. Abhirose Kumar, A. Suriya Madhava Prakash, N. Vigneshwaran
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: The integration of Internet of Things (IoT) technologies in healthcare has led to efficient remote monitoring of patients. However, securing sensitive medical information remains a major concern. This paper presents a secure and non-invasive system for disease diagnosis that safeguards patient data. The framework combines real-time patient health monitoring with a robust encryption technique using hybrid cryptography. Data gathered from sensors is encrypted before storage or transmission, ensuring confidentiality. This work emphasizes both diagnostic effectiveness and data privacy, providing a dual advantage in modern healthcare applications.

title: Analysis of Microwave Bond Interconnect with Curve-Fitting Modeling and Neural Network-Based Prediction
authors: Xianfei Zheng, Le Kang, Guozhuang Fan, Jiancheng Shi
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: A curve fitting and neural network-based approach for performance analysis of microwave interconnect structures is proposed in this work. The approach characterizes bond wire shapes through the use of Bézier curve fitting, enabling flexible modeling. Subsequently, the generalized regression neural network (GRNN) is employed to establish the mapping relationship from model features to electrical properties. Compared to existing techniques, it takes a common methodology to modeling and analyzing various interconnect types with both regular and irregular shapes. As demonstrated by the numerical and simulation results, it is shown that low modeling complexity and fast computation time can be also achieved, along with comparable prediction accuracy.

title: A Dual-Mode Broadband Adjustable Energy Selective Surface
authors: Jie Zhou, Fengyuan Sun
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper presents a dual - mode tunable energy-selective surface (TESS) based on varactor diode design. A hole at the center of the unit connects the top and bottom layers, simplifying the circuit. When the working signal is incident, adjusting the external bias voltage changes the varactor diode's capacitance, achieving wide-band frequency tuning. As the capacitance is tuned from 1 pF to 0.1 pF, the center frequency shifts from 3.44 to 2.02 GHz and from 8.68 to 6.80 GHz. Moreover, under high-power electromagnetic pulse incidence, the shielding efficiency of this TESS reaches 85.5% within the shielding bands of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$0-6.57$</tex> and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$7.43-9.41 \text{GHz}$</tex>. With ease of operation and fabrication, this TESS can effectively shield electromagnetic pulses. Future research will focus on expanding its frequency tuning range.

title: Enhancing the Filtering Antenna Performance by Cooperating Characteristic Mode Analysis and Fragment-Type Structure Optimization
authors: Gongda Hu, Yukun Fang, Dong Wang
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper proposes a CMA (characteristic mode analysis)-FTS (fragment-type structure) joint optimization method for filtering antenna design. A CMA-based optimization with coarse adjustment of the FTS is performed to quickly obtain the preliminary structures with filtering response. After the probability estimation for the generated design matrix, fine adjustment of the FTS is carried out by MOEA/D-GO for the final antenna structure. For demonstration, a triple-mode microstrip filtering patch antenna with impedance bandwidth of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$6.1 \% (4.75 - 5.05 GHz)$</tex> and steep roll-off is designed and tested.

title: A Grating Lobe Suppression Antenna Based on the TM01 and TM02 Modes
authors: Ru-Nan Wu, Zhong-Xun Liu, Yongtao Jia, Ying Liu
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper proposes a grating lobe suppression antenna based on the TM01 and TM02 modes. The antenna employs a rectangular patch for radiation, where slots are introduced to reduce the resonant frequency of the TM02 mode, while shorting pins are loaded to increase the resonant frequency of the TM01 mode without affecting the TM02 mode, enabling both modes to operate at the same frequency. By adjusting the phase and amplitude of the two ports, the angle and depth of the pattern nulls can be controlled. The antenna operates at 4.8-4.9 GHz with an isolation of over 20 dB. Finally, a 6-element array with <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$1 \lambda$</tex> spacing is constructed, demonstrating excellent grating lobe suppression with a 25 dB reduction at the grating lobe location.

title: Implantable MIMO Antenna for WMTS and ISM Bands in Leadless Cardiac Pacemaker System
authors: Chen Shunbiao, Tahir Bashir, Wei Li
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This study presents a compact dual-band implantable multi-input multi-output (MIMO) antenna for leadless cardiac pacemaker applications. The proposed antenna operates within the Wireless Medical Telemetry Service (WMTS) band <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$(1.395-1.4 \text{GHz})$</tex> and the Industrial, Scientific, and Medical (ISM) band (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{2. 4 - 2. 4 8 3 5 G H z}$</tex>). To achieve miniaturization, a meandered structural configuration is employed, resulting in an overall compact dimension of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$8 \times 6.4 \times 0.5 \text{mm}^{3}$</tex>. The antenna is encapsulated in implantable biomedical device (IMD) and evaluated in both homogeneous and heterogeneous heart phantom simulation environments. Performance indicate optimal characteristics, including reflection coefficients of -29.29 dB and -29.48 dB, gains of -26.3 dBi and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$-30.15 \text{dBi},-10 \text{dB}$</tex> impedance bandwidths of 170 MHz and 370 MHz, mutual coupling below 20 dB, and fractional bandwidths of 12.2% and 14.6% at resonant frequencies of 1.3975 GHz and 2.45 GHz, respectively. Additionally, specific absorption rate (SAR) compliance and wireless telemetry performance assessments further validate the antenna suitability for biomedical applications.

title: Design of an Unequal Power Divider with High-Dividing Ratio on Microstrip
authors: Jia Lu, Liqiang Li, Anqi Wu, Chuang Liu
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This letter presents the design of an unequal power divider with a high-dividing ratio. As the traditional microstrip Wilkinson power divider can not realize high-dividing ratio, we introduce a factor <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{C}$</tex> to reduce the high characteristic impedances and T-type structure to replace quarter wavelength transmission lines with very low characteristic impedances, the proposed circuit can be easily constructed by traditional planar microstrip lines. To verify our proposed idea, a <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$5: 1$</tex> microstrip unequal power divider operating at 1.3 GHz is designed and simulated by ADS. The result fully proved the validity of the design.

title: Propagation Characteristics and Eavesdropping Risks of Terahertz Channels Through Indoor Materials
authors: Peian Li, Wenbo Liu, Xiangzhu Meng, Jianjun Ma
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: Terahertz (THz) communication is susceptible to scattering and transmission loss, making secure non-line-of-sight (NLoS) transmission a significant challenge in indoor environments. This study characterizes the scattering and penetration properties of common indoor materials, such as curtain and wallpaper, at 170 GHz. A wavy surface covered with these materials is used to simulate potential eavesdroppers, enabling analysis of NLoS propagation. By analyzing the scattering distribution of signals, we assess the risk of eavesdropping under various spatial configurations. The results reveal that, even the surface is covered with lossy indoor materials, eavesdropping remains feasible in specific angles. These findings highlight the importance of considering material effects in the design of secure THz communication systems.

title: A Polarization-Reconfigurable Metasurface Antenna for 3.4 GHz Bluetooth Applications
authors: Jiaxin Wang, Zhendong Ding, Nasimuddin, A. Alphones
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper proposes a polarization-reconfigurable metasurface antenna designed for 3.4 GHz Bluetooth communication applications. The antenna has a compact overall size of only <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$0.55 \lambda_{0} \times 0.55 \lambda_{0} \times 0.008 \lambda_{0}$</tex> and adopts a metasurface structure composed of irregular hexagons and chamfered rectangles arranged radially. Two PIN diodes (SMP1345 series) are integrated in the central region to dynamically control the current paths, enabling flexible switching between linear-polarization (LP) and circular-polarization (CP). Simulation results show that in the ON-state of the PIN diodes, the antenna works in linear-polarization-mode with an impedance bandwidth (IBW) of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$39.1 \%(2.49-3.70 \text{GHz})$</tex> and a max. gain of 5.3 dBi. In OFF-state, the antenna switches to circular polarization, achieving an IBW of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$41.4 \%(2.41-3.67 \text{GHz})$</tex>, a 3dB axial-ratio bandwidth (ARBW) of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$38.4 \%(2.46-3.63 \text{GHz})$</tex>, and a peak gain of 4.5 dBi. Related with traditional single-polarized antennas, this design offers greater polarization flexibility and improved robustness against multipath interference, making it suitable for complex wireless communication environments.

title: Dual-Channel Multiplexing Circularly Polarized Folded Transmitarray for Generating Bessel OAM Vortex Beams
authors: Meng Xu, Jun Hu, Chenglong Wang
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper presents a dual-channel multiplexed circularly polarized (CP) folded transmitarray (FTA) for generating non-divergent vortex orbit angular momentum beams. Firstly, a linearly polarized (LP) to CP unit with 360° geometric phase (GP) coverage was designed for the upper transmitarray. In addition, in order to achieve the polarization conversion function of the lower reflection array, a polarization torsion element with orthogonal LP conversion was designed. The phase distribution information of transmitarray is constructed by using the LP-to-CP phase shift element, and the phase information of two different modes of non-divergent vortex OAM beams is recorded simultaneously to achieve channel multiplexing of non-divergent vortex OAM beams in <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\boldsymbol{l}_{1}=+1$</tex> and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\boldsymbol{l}_{2}=-1$</tex> modes. Finally, the FTA was simulated, fabricated and measured. The full-wave measurement results were in good agreement with the simulation results. The combined bandwidth of 10 db impedance and 3 db axis ratio (AR) can cover <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$24 \text{GHz}-32 \text{GHz}(28.6 \%)$</tex>). Compared with traditional OAM beams, the divergence characteristics of the designed vortex OAM beam are effectively suppressed, and the diffraction distance is longer, approximately <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$800 \text{mm}\left(73 \lambda_{0}\right)$</tex>. The measured purity of the <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\boldsymbol{l}_{1}=+1$</tex> and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\boldsymbol{l}_{2}=-1$</tex> modes is both higher than 76.8 %. The designed antenna has excellent performance and is expected to play an important role in millimeter-wave wireless communication and radar detection.

title: A 72-Channel RF transceiver with High Flatness for Massive MIMO Channel Emulator
authors: Jianhong Xie, Zhaopeng Fu
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: Flatness of RF transceiver directly affects the signal-to-noise (SNR) of the system, for the flatness calibration must performed at the cost of the system SNR. This paper presents a high-performance 72-channel RF transceiver with high flatness designed for a Massive MIMO channel emulator. The proposed transceiver is designed based on superheterodyne technology. It operates at the frequency of 0.4 to 6 GHz with a 200 MHz bandwidth, supporting up to MIMO <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$64 \times 8$</tex> configuration. The transceiver demonstrates excellent RF performance, with an inband flatness of average 1 dB and EVM of less than 1%. Experimental results confirm the outstanding RF performance of the proposed transceiver, meeting the requirements for the channel emulator testing and simulation.

title: A Compact Dual-Polarized ME-Dipole Antenna with Ultra-Wide ARBW and Wide HPBW
authors: Xinyu Zhang, Neng-wu Liu, Peng Liu
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: In this paper, a compact dual-polarized magnetoelectric (ME) dipole antenna with ultra-wide axial ratio beam width (ARBW) and wide half-power beam width (HPBW) is proposed. This paper attempts to add an arc on the <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\Gamma$</tex>-shaped feed lines to reduce the mutual coupling between the ports and improve the axial ratio performance of the antenna. In addition, the proposed antenna is also miniaturized and low-profile optimized. The simulation results show that an ultra-wide ARBW can be achieved using the above method and optimized geometrical parameters. Finally, the proposed antenna is simulated, and it can be found that the antenna achieves a halfpower beam width of not less than 99.0° and an axial ratio beam width (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\text{AR} \leq 3 ~\text{dB}$</tex>) of 177.9° to 233.6° within the operating frequency band, and achieves a impedance bandwidth (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$S_{11}<- \mathbf{1 0 d B}$</tex>) of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{2 0. 3 \%}$</tex>. In addition, the dimension of the proposed antenna is relatively small, only <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$0.45 \lambda \times 0.45 \lambda \times 0.18 \lambda$</tex>.

title: Single-Frequency Near-Field Microwave Detection of Subsurface Small-Scale Defects in GFRP
authors: Heyuxuan Wang, Chao Sun, Zhen Yang
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper presents a near-field microwave non-destructive testing (NDT) method for estimating the depth of subsurface defects in glass-fiber reinforced polymer (GFRP) using single-frequency reflection measurements at 24 GHz. We propose a clustering-assisted normalization approach to improve depth estimation for weakly scattering defects under 5mm. By leveraging the complex-valued trajectory of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$S_{11}$</tex> during lateral scanning, a dual-stage unsupervised clustering framework combining K-means and DBSCAN is employed to isolate subtle dielectric discontinuities. Simulation and experimental results confirm its effectiveness in resolving sub-wavelength voids, demonstrating its feasibility for low-cost, non-contact nondestructive testing (NDT).

title: Reduction of Cross-Polarized Radiation of Microstrip Antennas by Incorporating Periodic Structure in DGS
authors: Haowei Mao, Jian Guo
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper presents a method of incorporating periodic structures in the defect grounding structure (DGS) that effectively enhances its ability to suppress the cross-polarization of microstrip antennas in H-plane. The current research on DGS optimization mainly focuses on the external asymmetric shape and defect location, while less research has been conducted on the internal structure of the defect. In this study, multiple circular metals arranged as photonic crystal structure are innovatively inserted inside the defect. The presence of multiple circular metals generates resonance at the defect, thereby reconfiguring the electric field distribution of the antenna substrate and enhancing the symmetry of the field which is the principal factor contribute to enhanced polarization purity. Subsequently, this method is applied to the non-propimal symmetrical DGS. The proposed DGS structure effectively improves the peak isolation between the co-pol and cross-pol radiations by around 18dB.

title: Robust R-Peak Detection in Terahertz Pulse Signals Using Adaptive Thresholding
authors: Jiaqi Wang, Yuan Yao, Xiaohe Cheng, Liting Wang, Lu Sun
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: We propose a robust algorithm for detecting R-peaks in terahertz-wave plethysmography (TPG) signals to enable accurate pulse rate estimation. Unlike prior methods based on frequency domain analysis, our approach integrates adaptive thresholding and dynamic filtering to identify individual R-peaks in time-domain THz signals. Evaluations using reference photoplethysmography (PPG) data show significant reductions in both mean absolute error (MAE) and root mean square error (RMSE), highlighting the algorithm's potential in non-contact heart rate variability (HRV) monitoring.

title: IoT-Enabled Automatic Self-Cleaning and Smart Toilet Management System
authors: M Arun Kumar, Aarthi R, Aswin S, Dharani S
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: This paper presents an IoT-enabled smart sanitation system designed to enhance cleanliness, operational efficiency, and user comfort in modern restrooms. The system integrates multiple sensors connected to a microcontroller that enables intelligent automation. User presence detection triggers real-time cleaning once the toilet is unoccupied, while other sensors monitor flushing performance and water consumption. The MQ-135 gas sensor identifies unpleasant odors and activates a disinfection process with spray nozzles and suction fans to maintain air freshness. After each use, a robotic cleaning cycle performs surface washing, UV sterilization, and hot-air drying. A local LCD and a mobile application display live status updates such as "Occupied," "Cleaning," or "Ready to Use." By merging IoT technology with automated cleaning mechanisms, the system minimizes manual labor, conserves water and energy, and delivers a hygienic, contactless, and sustainable sanitation experience.

title: AI Powered Multimodal Dermatological Chatbot for Skin Disease Diagnosis and Consultation
authors: Naisargee Bagal, Kashish Dingreja, Prasad Bachhav, Aditya Pawar, Arjun Khadekar, Anuradha Yenkikar
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Skin diseases affect a significant majority of the population of the world, and early diagnosis is crucial for treating them successfully. To meet the needs of on-time diagnosis as well as appropriate communication, we put forward a dialogue system based on LLaMA- 3 vision LLM model. The system shall be capable of processing dermatology images along with user inputs in the form of speech to output correct, medicinally sourced answers. Utilizing large-scale pre-trained language models and embedding medical domain-specific vocabularies, the chatbot provides initial diagnosis, possible medical conditions, and suggestions for prevalent skin disorders. The audio is recorded using an audio recorder, processed with OpenAI Whisper to be converted into text, and images uploaded for examination using the LLaMA-3 Vision model. The image and transcribed text are processed by the model through GroqAPI, producing a response that is synthesized to speech using Eleven Labs or GTTS. Gradio provides an easy interface, allowing for smooth interaction with the system. The system is especially useful in areas where dermatologists are scarce, providing an initial line of consultation that is affordable and scalable. The goal is to augment conventional dermatological procedures, decrease diagnostic delays, and equip users with instant, informative feedback in response to visual and textual inputs.

title: Digital Design Interactive Real-Time Color Theory Application in Digital Education
authors: Ana-Maria-Andreea Căiniceanu, Muguraș Daniel Mocofan, Diana Andone
publish: 2025 IEEE Digital Education and MOOCS Conference (DEMOcon)
abstract: This paper presents a practical implementation of color theory using a web application built with Python and the Flask framework and its implication on digital education in multimedia technologies. The system enables automatic extraction of dominant color palettes from both static images and live webcam streams. Leveraging libraries such as OpenCV, Pillow, and Color Thief, the application supports real-time analysis and visualization of RGB, HEX and CMYK color formats. Users can upload images or use their device’s camera to generate personalized palettes, providing immediate feedback through a dynamic web interface. The implementation also demonstrates asynchronous communication between client and server using AJAX calls to periodically refresh color data without page reload. This architecture ensures an interactive and fluid experience, simulating real-world conditions relevant to digital design. Moreover, this approach showcases the synergy between computational tools and design principles, validating the feasibility of integrating real-time image analysis into creative workflows. The prototype developed in this work is fully functional and integrates live video analysis, automatic palette extraction, and format conversion into a unified web application. Unlike existing tools that are limited to static image processing or API-only services, this solution provides a more efficient method of color analysis. By enabling dynamic interaction through both image upload and live webcam input, it establishes a practical foundation for a new category of interactive design tools, more accessible compared to existing implementations. This allows for a better understanding of multimedia principles by undergraduate students.

title: A Hybrid Filtering Framework for Enhanced Movie Recommendations
authors: Nalabothu Siva RamaKrishna, Avanigadda Bhagya Sreelakshmi, Sanagapati Uma Veerendra Chari, Vemula Ramanjaneyulu, Polepaka Sanjeeva, Yelaki Prakash
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: This study presents the design and implementation of a hybrid movie recommendation system that synergizes content-based and collaborative filtering techniques to overcome the limitations of standalone approaches. The system integrates multi-source data, including user ratings from MovieLens, popularity metrics from IMDb, and rich metadata from TMDB. For content-based filtering, textual features such as movie overviews and taglines are processed using Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF) vectorization to create a weighted content profile. Sentiment analysis is further applied to capture the emotional tone of these features. Similarity between movies is computed using cosine similarity on the resulting TF-IDF vectors. The collaborative filtering component employs user-based similarity measures to identify users with correlated rating patterns. Predictions from both models are combined through a weighted averaging hybrid strategy. This fusion effectively mitigates classic challenges such as the cold-start problem for new users, limited diversity in content-based recommendations, and data sparsity in collaborative filtering. The system is deployed as an interactive web application using Streamlit, facilitating real-time user interaction. Empirical observations indicate that the hybrid framework yields more relevant and diverse recommendations compared to individual models, demonstrating enhanced accuracy and personalization. Future work will explore model-based techniques like matrix factorization to improve scalability and computational efficiency.

title: Towards Intelligent FinOps: A Predictive Analytics Approach for Cloud Cost Management
authors: Jaydeep V Ayachit, Vahida Attar
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: With the widespread adoption of cloud computing, organizations face the challenge of managing dynamically created cloud resources and the corresponding costs. Users can acquire cloud resources on demand to run workloads and applications. This elasticity helps applications adjust to variability in demand to meet required performance and reliability of service. Traditionally, over-provisioning of resources is used to meet peak demands. This results in average to low utilization of resources resulting in extra costs, maintenance, and administration.FinOps, or Cloud Financial Operations, has emerged as a cultural and operational framework that promotes collaboration between engineering, finance, and operation teams to achieve financial accountability in cloud spending. It promotes data-driven decision-making in a timely manner and fosters financial responsibility. This research proposes a system that integrates machine learning-based forecasting with FinOps practices to enable proactive, cost-aware decision making in cloud environments. The system models resource usage patterns, predict future demands, and translates those predictions into actionable financial strategies. The goal is to support both short-term operational efficiency and long-term financial planning. Leveraging Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) and Support Vector Regression (SVR) models, the system demonstrates flexibility in adapting to various prediction techniques.

title: Research on Formation Mechanism of Short Video Platform Information Cocoon Based on User Perspective
authors: Siying Li, Jiamin Gu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Digital Media Technology and Social Computing (ICAIDS)
abstract: Algorithm recommendation technology is the catalyst of information cocoon, and user behavior is the key to the formation of information cocoon. Based on the theory of information ecology and the short video platform environment of algorithm recommendation technology, this paper discusses the influence of user factors such as user demand, selective psychology and value judgment on the information cocoon, and constructs the formation mechanism model of the short video platform information cocoon. This paper uses SPSS and Amos software to statistically analyze the questionnaire data and model test. The research shows that the user demand, selective psychology and value judgment of the short video platform have an impact on the information cocoon. In order to avoid the information cocoon, users should broaden their diversified information needs, reduce the directional selective behavior of information, and improve their judgment ability.

title: Design Trade-Offs in M–C and R–C Delay Architectures for Secure and Scalable Arbiter PUFs
authors: Madeshvaradhan V, Aman Singh, Marco Ottavi, Vishal Gupta
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: As IoT devices become increasingly interconnected and resource-constrained, hardware-level security is essential. Physically unclonable functions (PUFs) offer a lightweight, tamper-evident solution for secure authentication and key generation. Among them, the Arbiter PUF stands out for its simplicity and scalability, utilizing delay differences in identically structured paths. Traditionally, these delays are generated using resistor-capacitor (RC) circuits, but they suffer from static resistance, limited tunability, and higher power consumption. To overcome these limitations, this work proposes a memristor-capacitor (MC) based Arbiter PUF. Memristors provide tunable resistance, non-volatility, and inherent variability, enhancing both entropy and adaptability in PUF architectures. Our analysis demonstrates that replacing resistors with memristors in delay elements significantly enhances the key performance metrics of the PUF. Simulation results reveal improved uniqueness, increased intra-die hamming distance (HD), greater reliability under supply voltage fluctuations, higher minimum entropy, and substantial reductions in both power and energy consumption. These improvements underscore the potential of memristor-capacitor-based delay structures as a robust and energy-efficient alternative for next-generation secure PUF implementations.

title: Advancements in Deep Learning Techniques for Hate Speech Detection: A Comprehensive Review
authors: Siji Rani S, Mirza Benny
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Social networks are essential in vast exchange of information all over the world. People can post views, news, or personal experiences at once which affects the social understanding and the public discourse. It has its disadvantages though; circulation of toxic content like hate speech, misinformation, and cyberbullying. Hence, it is required to have effective Hate Speech Detection systems to ensure safe and inclusive online spaces. In this survey, various Deep Learning (DL) architectures and hybrid models in the task of Hate Speech Detection are compared and evaluated using performance metrics. DL models such as Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM), and Bidirectional LSTM (BiLSTM) have so far proven high potentiality in Hate Speech Detection. They are able to identify very useful patterns directly from plain text at different levels of meaning, unlike traditional Machine Learning (ML) approaches. Hybrid models of DL architectures are empirically tested here. The hybrid models of DL architectures are assumed to perform better than the stand-alone models and hence lead to more accurate identification of hate speech.

title: Enhancing the Diagnosis of ENT Disorders using Artificial Intelligence Techniques
authors: Jagmeet Kaur, Puneet Kumar
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: An accurate and timely diagnosis of Ear, Nose, and Throat (ENT) disorders is critical in improving patient outcomes. Traditional diagnostic methods are effective but limited by human expertise and processing delays. This study focuses on accurate and efficient detection of ENT disorders by analysing and comparing the existing AI-oriented techniques such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs), ensemble learning models, etc. It reveals that AI-based techniques are superior to conventional methods in the identification of complex patterns in medical images and clinical data with greater accuracy. However, challenges such as interpretability, generalization to other datasets, and the lack of standardized validation remain significant concern. This scenario gives rise to the introduction of a novel methodology that incorporates optimized feature extraction and fine-tuned classifiers for more reliable diagnoses. This study evaluates AI-driven ENT diagnostics, highlights strengths, limitations, and future improvements for clinical integration and accuracy.

title: Population Growth Analysis and Forecasting Using Machine Learning
authors: Sandeep Kumar Saini, Kudrat Virk, Shagun Verma, Anshika Pandey, Muskan Rana, Garima Chandel
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: The population projection forms a critical component of the country planning process, economic growth, and resource management. Policymakers and governments can prepare for the challenges they might face in the field of healthcare, education, infrastructure, and employment by employing valid prediction models. In the proposed work, going to study population predictions of five major countries China, India, Indonesia, Pakistan, and the United States in 2025-2050 applying three predictive models, Linear Regression, XGBoost, and ARIMA. The models have different mechanisms for making predictions, either by statistical means or by machine learning means. In order to obtain your final prediction, you simply use the average of all the three model outputs. This ensures that what is predicted is accurate and successful. This mean value can play a balancing role in counterbalancing the partialities of the two models and provides a better forecast. The key demographic trends depicted in the statistics include the fact that both India and China would exhibit population growth until 2035, but the Indian population would increase at a higher rate compared to that of China by the same year. In 2050, the population of India will be 1.71 billion, compared toed to 1.68 billion in China. Chinese growth is slowing, with the present population standing at approximately 1.64 billion. Indonesia, Pakistan, and the United States too are likely to continue the expansion of their population along the regular trend with 336.7 million, 295.3 million, and 390.3 million inhabitants, respectively, by 2050. The research demonstrates the importance of the use of various models in combination to create more accurate long-term predictions. Such knowledge is important to effective policy making, control of resources, and strategic development.

title: Analyzing the Relationship Between Air Quality and Public Sentiment in South Tangerang
authors: Ilma Hamala Nur Faiza, Dita Pramesti, Hanif Fakhrurroja
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electronic and Electrical Engineering and Intelligent System (ICE3IS)
abstract: South Tangerang has been recorded as one of the cities with the poorest air quality in Indonesia from 2023 to 2024. This condition has a significant impact on public health. Public concern over this issue is often voiced through social media, particularly Twitter. This study aims to develop a machine learning-based sentiment analysis model and apply non-parametric statistical approaches, namely the chi-square test and Kruskal-Wallis test, to analyze the relationship between public sentiment and the air quality index. The research process follows the KDD stages, including data selection, data preprocessing, data transformation, data mining, and evaluation. The Support Vector Machine (SVM) algorithm is used to classify sentiment into two classes: positive and negative. The SVM model achieved an accuracy of $94.3 \%$ with an AUC value of 0.95. Analysis using the chi-square test yielded a Pearson value of 27.757 with a p-value lower than 0.001, indicating a statistically significant relationship between public sentiment and the air quality index. Meanwhile, the KruskalWallis test produced an $\mathbf{H}$ value of 7.932 with a $\mathbf{p}$-value of 0.047, indicating significant differences in sentiment scores across AQI categories. This study provides insights for air quality monitoring based on public opinion and contributes to the development of Natural Language Processing and data mining in environmental issues.

title: A Comparative Study of Single-Ended and DoubleEnded Traveling Wave Methods for Offline Fault Location in 10-kV Distribution Cables
authors: Ji Huang, Guozheng Han, Yanchen Zhang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: This paper expounds the core working principles of the single-ended traveling wave method and the double-ended traveling wave method in cable fault location. For the application scenario of $\mathbf{1 0 k V}$ distribution cable fault location, it studies and compares the fault location accuracy of the two methods. This study lays an important theoretical foundation for an in-depth understanding of the traveling wave-based positioning technology for distribution cables.

title: Unveiling Oral Cancer: Deep Learning's Diagnostic Eye
authors: Vandana Tank, Kailash Chandra Bandhu, Ratnesh Litoriya
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: There is a major global health issue with oral cancer, and early detection of this condition is key to improving the outcomes for patients. Standard methods of diagnosis rely on clinical examination and histological investigation, both invasive and often requiring considerable staff and resources. We recognize the unmet need for an accurate, non-invasive, and efficient diagnostic technique for initial screening. To address this point, we present a machine learning-based approach for the classification of oral cancer through imaging data, using state-of-the-art convolutional neural network (CNN) structures. The proposed method uses the CNN to spend a lot of time personalizing the network in the previous work, and it’s evaluated by comparing the state-of-the-art models, ResNet50 and ResNet152. The starting point is an image data set of oral lesions for training and validating the networks. We measure the networks' performance based on the amount of loss and the correct rate. The measures used to compare the model designs are shown in a number of graphics. These plots show the loss between training and validation and accuracy in addition to the models' confusion matrices. The comparison demonstrates that the suggested CNN outperforms its predecessor in both the training and validation phases. The deepest and most intricate model, ResNet152, performs the worst, having the biggest loss and the lowest accuracy. With percentage gains in validation accuracy of roughly 2% and 7% over ResNet50 and ResNet152.

title: Research on grid based cluster voltage management strategy incorporating distributed micro energy storage
authors: Zhanlei Gu, Tengju Guo, Guangdong Zhao, Zezhong Zhao
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: With the large-scale grid connection of distributed photovoltaic systems in rural power grids, the penetration rate of photovoltaic within low voltage lines has been continuously increasing, leading to increasingly prominent voltage over limit issues in rural distribution networks. In response to the slow response, complex regulation strategies, and photovoltaic output curtailment issues of traditional centralized regulation, a grid based cluster voltage management strategy based on distributed micro energy storage is proposed. Firstly, indicators for electrical spacing of low voltage lines, sensitivity between different grids, and grid based voltage flexibility self healing capability are constructed, and an optimal voltage control strategy is formed through improved grid based algorithms. Then, grid based voltage control for active and reactive power is performed on the low voltage grid, with voltage regulation selected at key nodes within different grids. Finally, the proposed grid based voltage control strategy is experimentally verified on low voltage lines. The results show that the voltage qualification rate at the end of low-voltage lines has been effectively improved.

title: Research on Sensor-Based Derivation and Multi-Point Coupling Calibration Methods for Vehicle Bus
authors: Zhiyuan Zhao, Cui Mao
publish: 2025 10th International Seminar on Computer Technology, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (ISCME)
abstract: In response to the problems existing in the current automotive inspection and testing process, such as long preparation time, high equipment occupancy rate, and difficulty in sensor layout, this paper, based on the vehicle controller area network bus, proposes a sensor-based vehicular bus traceability and multi-point coupling calibration method. Firstly, based on the actual sensor measurement data and bus messages recorded synchronously under specific conditions, a homologous linear mapping model is constructed. Then, the sliding analysis method is used to split and extract the bus message. Taking the measured data of the sensor as the standard, the Pearson correlation coefficient is introduced to trace the source of the bus target signal. After that, the analytical parameters of the bus target signal are calibrated based on the least square method to obtain the precise bus protocol of the target signal of this vehicle model. In the traceability calibration test for the bus voltage and current signals of a certain model of vehicle’s power battery, the results demonstrate that this method not only effectively identifies the target bus signals, but also produces energy consumption calculations—under both WLTC and CLTC driving conditions— that exhibit minimal deviation when compared to actual sensor measurement data. Specifically, the total energy consumption deviations are 0.21Wh and 0.26Wh, respectively, while the average deviations amount to only 0.01Wh/km, which fully satisfies the requirements for vehicle detection. This fully demonstrates that the test data obtained by this method has a high degree of credibility and can greatly simplify the energy consumption test of this vehicle model, improve the test efficiency, reduce the test cost, and provide effective data support for the inspection and testing of this vehicle model.

title: Cross-system Disaster Damage Analysis and Coordinated Restoration Strategy for Urban Distribution Networks Based on Interdependent Network Theory
authors: Ganggang Yu, Na Luo, Jie Feng, Zeyu Liu, Wentao Wu, Xinran Ren
publish: 2025 10th International Seminar on Computer Technology, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (ISCME)
abstract: The evolution of urban power grids toward the Energy Internet has intensified their dependency on communication systems, creating tightly coupled power-communication cyber-physical systems. This interdependence, while enhancing operational efficiency, introduces significant risks of cross-system cascading failures. To bolster the resilience of urban distribution networks against extreme disasters, this paper presents a novel strategy for cross-system disaster analysis and coordinated restoration in interdependent power-communication networks. We first establish a universal distribution network model and a multi-layer communication network model, formally defining their “partial one-to-one” interdependent relationship. Next, leveraging nodal functional dependencies, we develop an iterative simulation algorithm to model the propagation of cascading failures, revealing the evolution mechanism of local faults across the two networks. For post-disaster recovery, a two-stage strategy, termed “reconfiguration-first, repair-coordination,” is proposed. The first stage employs a network reconfiguration algorithm to rapidly restore loads by optimally closing tie lines. The second stage addresses persistent permanent faults by introducing a repair prioritization method based on “forward-looking simulation” to determine the optimal repair sequence. Case studies on the IEEE 33-bus system validate that the proposed strategy effectively simulates cascading failures and formulates a highly efficient, coordinated restoration plan.

title: Time-Varying Window-Based Iterative Learning Control with Initial State Adjustments
authors: Wentao Lu
publish: 2025 10th International Seminar on Computer Technology, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (ISCME)
abstract: To address the impact of arbitrary initial states on systems in iterative learning control and to improve dynamic response and steady-state error, this paper proposes a PD-type iterative learning control (ILC) algorithm for arbitrary initial state conditions. By designing a time-varying window algorithm that shortens as the iterative process advances during the initial transient state, the control algorithm corrects state deviations. The system tracking error converges to a minimal range determined solely by the system’s inherent uncertainties and uncertain external disturbances, independent of initial state errors. The system’s stability and convergence are then demonstrated using contraction mapping theory. Ultimately, the performance of the proposed method is confirmed via trajectory tracking simulation experiments on a two-joint robotic arm model.

title: Carbon-Based Electronics for Flexible, Sustainable, High-Performance, and Energy-Efficient Electronic Device Applications
authors: Shamim Ahmad Khan, Eswararao Boddepalli, Sudhakar Ajmera, Nilesh Bhosale, Sajiv G, A. Balakumar
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: The human interaction with technology has been transformed through its evolution from bulky vacuum tubes to compact silicon based integrated circuits which power today’s computing. With continued shrinkages of electronic devices in size towards flexibility, sustainability, and energy efficiency has been rapidly desired. However, while they are highly efficient, conventional silicon-based electronics are limited mechanically, in energy consumption, as well as their harsh impact on the environment: for this reason, alternative materials have been searched for that are lighter, more flexible, and more ecofriendly. There is an urgent need for advanced 2D and 3D materials to succeed the current generation electronics based on silicon due to their exceptional electrical conductivity, mechanical flexibility and thermal stability. The combination of these properties makes them good for applications in wearable devices, energy storage systems, high performance transistors and optoelectronic technologies. These materials can potentially integrate into electronic devices to revolutionize computing, communication, and other energy applications with low power, high speed, and environmentally sustainable devices. This work studies the fundamental properties, fabrication techniques and their application fields of carbon-based electronics, and their advantages over traditional semiconductors. This study also covers issues of scalability, material consistency and industry adoption and trends in terms of AI driven design, hybrid material integration and green manufacturing. This research endeavors to elucidate the utility of carbon-based materials in modern electronics by offering a detailed analysis of carbon-based materials as relevant in driving technological progress, sustainable innovation, and the future electronics, in particular, flexible and environmentally friendly electronics.

title: Optimized Machine Learning Framework for Brain Tumor Detection and Classification Using Fuzzy-Based Feature Extraction
authors: Radhika Sethuraman, Gururama Senthilvel P
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Medical diagnostics mostly depend on brain tumor detection and classification which provides early treatment solutions and intervention strategies. To achieve accurate and efficient brain tumor prediction this research project integrates Fuzzy Color and Texture Histogram with Fuzzy Opponent Histogram Filter alongside various machine learning classifiers. Different scopes of measure were employed to evaluate the models by monitoring their accuracy performance along with precision levels, recall ratios, Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) scores and Precision-Recall Curve (PRC) outcomes and running time metrics. The combination of FOHF with AdaBoost delivered benchmark accuracy of 93.98% and ROC of 0.95 because it turned out to be the best model for brain tumor identification. The FOHF + Bayes Net model performed with 92.02% accuracy which was close to FOHF + AdaBoost while demonstrating the highest PRC value (0.95) but took 0.27 seconds to execute. The combination of FCTH + Bayes Net achieved both top-notch computational efficiency (0.01 seconds) and high accuracy (91.16%) to become suitable for real-time usage. The FCTH + Gaussian Process model failed to yield adequate results because it achieved just 81.01% accuracy during brain tumor classification. The experiment showed FOHF models achieve superior classification performance than FCTH models and the prediction accuracy reaches peak levels when using AdaBoost or Bayes Net classifiers. The recommended algorithm for precise classification is FOHF + AdaBoost while FCTH + Bayes Net provides the most effective combination for real-time operations and resource restriction applications.

title: Power Information Feedback Routing Optimization Method for Multi-Node IoT System
authors: Yong Qu, Li Shao, Xuwen Xiao, Chunsheng Guo
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: Aiming at the power optimization problem of multinode internet of things (IoT) systems with randomly distributed locations, a routing power optimization model for multi-node wireless IoT systems is constructed, and a minimum reliable communication power calculation method and a power optimal routing path sniffing method are proposed. Multi-frame routing information establishment commands are sent in turn to sniff the power optimal routing path, and the routing path is selected according to the optimal power probability of each path, which realizes the establishment of the optimal power routing of the multi-node IoT system. Through experiments on a LoRa IoT system containing 20 nodes, it is verified that the proposed method can efficiently achieve the optimal power routing establishment of a multi-node IoT system. Under the premise of ensuring link quality, it significantly reduces the cost of IoT nodes. The transmit power and transmit current extend the service life of batterypowered IoT nodes.

title: Brain Tumor Synthesis and Segmentation Using Multi-Scale Diffusion and SAM-Adapter
authors: Mudassar Ali, Tong Wu, Muhammad Zeeshan Tahir, Jiaqi Hu, Olumayowa Idowu, Haoji Hu
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Intelligent Perception and Computer Vision (CIPCV)
abstract: The scarcity of annotated 3D brain image data is the most significant challenge in developing accurate brain tumor segmentation AI models. The data paucity causes poor model generalization and inhibits the proper use of AI in clinical settings. Herein, we settle this crucial issue by presenting a novel pipeline composed of a multi-scale attention diffusion model and a hybrid segmentation framework, pairing the 3D SAM-Adapter with the Swin Transformer. Our multi-scale diffusion model generates high-quality synthetic brain tumors that enhance image features and create realistic tumor edges and textures that nicely mimic clinical MRI scans. This approach fills the gap in annotated data by generating realistic synthetic tumors, enabling model training for improved accuracy. With hierarchical refinement from prompt-based inputs, the segmentation framework offers accurate global anatomical context while preserving precise local tumor boundaries for high-performance 3D segmentation. Our methodology significantly improves segmentation results, offering an efficient solution for the data inadequacy challenge and enhancing realistic usage of AI-driven brain tumor segmentation in practical environments.

title: Emotion Aware IoT Systems: Analyzing Stress as a Precursor to Pre-eclampsia in Expectant Women
authors: Mohammad Shahnawaz Shaikh, Asif Ali, Aaquib Multani, Ritika Bhatt, Neelesh Kumar Jain, Prangya Parimita Pradhan, Ashwini Sharma
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Pre-eclampsia, a leading pregnancy complication, is strongly linked to chronic stress, yet current monitoring methods lack real-time, data-driven solutions. This paper proposes an Emotion-Aware IoT System that integrates multi-modal sensing (wearable ECG, voice, facial expressions) and AI analytics to predict pre-eclampsia risk through stress detection. Our hybrid architecture combines edge-based lightweight models (LSTM + CNN) for real-time stress classification (91% accuracy) with cloud-based risk prediction (AUC 0.84) using fused physiological (HRV, BP) and behavioral (vocal jitter, facial action units) features. Validated on the WESAD and CK+ datasets with synthetic augmentation, the system achieves <50 ms latency for alerts while maintaining explainability via SHAP values (HRV: 38% contribution). Key innovations include a pregnancy-optimized ensemble model outperforming single-modality approaches by 9% F1-score and GDPR-compliant anonymization for data privacy. Results demonstrate strong stress-pre-eclampsia correlation (r=0.58, p<0.001), enabling proactive clinical interventions. This work bridges IoT, AI, and maternal healthcare, offering a scalable framework for early risk detection.
