title: Construction of Vocational Quality Assessment and Feedback System for Higher Vocational Students based on Data-driven
authors: Meihua Chen, Zuyi Wang, Dongmei Chen
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Information Technology (AICIT)
abstract: In order to improve the scientific rationality of the professional quality assessment and the speed of feedback of students in higher vocational colleges, this paper creates a data-driven professional quality assessment and feedback system. The system is generally divided into four modules: data collection, preprocessing, model evaluation and result feedback. The AHP-TOPSIS approach is used to build a multi-index evaluation model, and a differentiated and multi-role feedback mechanism is achieved through front-end visualization. The system uses a real data set in 2024 for experimental verification. This system shows good performance in terms of stability, scoring accuracy and feedback practicality, and has the potential for promotion and application. This study not only finds a new route for the digital assessment of professional quality, but also provides a reference example for the education management information system, which has practical significance for enhancing the teaching quality and actual effectiveness of talent training in higher vocational colleges.

title: Performance Analysis of 5G Systems at 3.5 GHz Using Measurement and Simulation
authors: Semaa Kh. Al-Khero, Younis M. Abbosh
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: For a variety of applications, path loss modeling is crucial for designing 5th-generation cellular networks. Measurements and simulations were carried out inside at 3.5 GHz in a department of communication engineering at an electronics engineering college in Iraq. Measurements and simulations of line-of-sight (LOS) and non-LOS were conducted along the second-floor corridor. Path loss models were computed after the samples had been taken, as predicted both path loss exponent (PLE) values are less than free space value of two for the LOS cases, whereas for NLOS case in both measurement and simulation is larger than free space value of two.

title: Detection and Classification of Pesticide Residues in Pak Choy Using Raman Spectroscopy
authors: Aiman Aqil M. Ishak, Fazida Hanim Hashim, Maizom Hassan, Ahmad Faris Seman, Asraf Mohamed Moubark
publish: 2025 IEEE 15th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology (ICSET)
abstract: This study investigates the use of Raman spectroscopy combined with machine learning for detecting and classifying pesticide residues on Pak Choy (Brassica rapa subsp. chinensis). Raman spectroscopy enables rapid, non-destructive molecular analysis, and its integration with machine learning provides a promising approach for food safety monitoring. To date, no published work has applied Raman spectroscopy to pesticide detection on Pak Choy leaves. A total of 52 samples were prepared under four case studies: (1) pesticide concentration levels, (2) spraying frequency on laboratory-grown Pak Choy, (3) spraying frequency on hydroponic Pak Choy, and (4) residue reduction through vinegar and baking soda washing. Raman spectra were preprocessed, deconvoluted, and statistically analyzed. Classification models including Artificial Neural Networks (ANN), K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), and Support Vector Machines (SVM) were developed using MATLAB's Classification Learner. Results showed that pesticide residues on non-living Pak Choy leaves (Case Studies 1, 2, and 4) were classified with 100% accuracy using the Linear Discriminant model. Living hydroponic plants (Case Study 3) achieved 77% accuracy with the Linear SVM model. Two Raman peaks, 1348 <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{c m}^{-\mathbf{1}}$</tex> and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$1593 \mathbf{c m}^{-\mathbf{1}}$</tex>, were identified as biomarkers for Cypermethrin detection. These findings demonstrate that Raman spectroscopy, combined with machine learning, offers a practical solution for pesticide residue monitoring. The approach has potential for portable, on-site applications as a rapid, cost-effective complement to conventional laboratory methods such as GC-MS and HPLC.

title: Parallel-Accelerated Neural Network-Based Lifetime Prediction and Design Optimization for Wafer-Level Packages Using Finite Element Simulation
authors: Y.T. Su, C.H. Lo, K.N. Chiang
publish: 2025 20th International Microsystems, Packaging, Assembly and Circuits Technology Conference (IMPACT)
abstract: This study examines the computational efficiency and predictive accuracy of Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) for predicting solder ball fatigue life in Wafer-Level Packaging (WLP), trained on Central Processing Units (CPUs) and Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), utilizing data generated from validated Finite Element Method (FEM) simulations. By testing across multiple dataset scales and hyperparameter combinations, we find that GPUs significantly reduce training and search time, with grid search achieving an average 1.6× speedup and single optimal hyperparameter search reaching an average 2.5× speedup. While models trained on CPU and GPU exhibit nearly identical predictive accuracy (<±1% deviation), GPUs provide clear advantages for large-scale design exploration and optimization tasks. Furthermore, inference and inverse inference using trained ANN models demonstrate that both CPU- and GPU-trained networks yield consistent optimization trends, indicating that the choice of hardware primarily impacts computational efficiency rather than model reliability.

title: Blockchain-Assisted Secure Fine-Grained Searchable Encryption for Cloud-Based Healthcare Cyber-Physical Systems
authors: Inderpreet Kaur, S. Karthikeyan, P. Chitra, M. S. Parkavi, S Silvia Arockia Regi, T. Chandrasekar
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The interaction of the Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) and cloud platforms with healthcare systems triggers severe privacy and security issues because of the sensitivity of the data of patients. To overcome these issues, a fine-grained searchable encryption scheme using blockchain is introduced on how to securely and decently access the encrypted medical records. Attribute-based encryption is used within the system to provide fine-grained access control, and Bloom filter-based searchable encryption has been applied to provide forward and backward privacy with PRF-generated trapdoors. Hyperledger Fabric blockchain runs smart contracts that handle access rules and audit leverages. Experimental analysis Based on real-world healthcare datasets, latency in performing a search was 725ms, the encryption overhead was 1130ms, access grant was accurate with a 98.7% hit rate. High query loads resulted in a throughput of 158 records/sec. The new system was more efficient than the past systems in privacy assurance, auditing, and responsiveness. The framework provides a secure, scalable, and auditable access to medical data and, therefore, is viable in modern healthcare CPS environments.

title: A next generation non etching adhesion promoter enabling streamlined process for Advanced IC substrates
authors: Valentina Belova-Magri, Thomas Thomas, Christopher A. Seidemann, Christiane Le-Tiec, Thomas Huelsmann, Martin Thoms, Christian Noethlich, Fabian Michalik, Josef Gaida, Stefanie Ackermann, Yuan Zou, Andry Liong, Toshio Honda, Frank Bruening
publish: 2025 20th International Microsystems, Packaging, Assembly and Circuits Technology Conference (IMPACT)
abstract: As IC substrate technology advances towards fine lines and higher circuit densities, there is an increasing demand for copper (Cu) surface preparation to ensure reliable adhesion with lamination materials and resistance to external stress conditions. At the same time, it is essential to ensure process efficiency and support signal integrity. Conventional approaches often rely on multi-step roughening techniques to maintain adhesion in the presence of thermal, humid and chemical stresses between Cu and the dielectric. However, these techniques compromise the integrity of the Cu surface and are incompatible with the requirement for ultra-smooth conductors.This study presents an innovative, self-synthesized, organo-silane-based adhesion promoter designed to form strong chemical bonds between dissimilar materials such as various dielectric laminates and Cu surfaces (including electrolytically plated Cu). Unlike traditional roughening-based systems, our non-etch solution enables a streamlined two-step process that simplifies manufacturing, reduces costs, and maintains the high bond strength required for next-generation packaging, eliminating the need for aggressive copper etching, our non-etch solution allows for the creation of narrower lines and spaces, which are essential for advanced IC substrate designs.The system also demonstrates excellent chemical resistance to desmear process, which is necessary to clean blind microvias (BMVs) after laser drilling and prepare them for subsequent Cu filling. Smooth Cu surfaces typically struggle in these harsh conditions, but post-desmear testing of structured designs confirmed the integrity of the sidewalls and minimal wedge formation at the BMV interfaces. Roughness measurements show that our process does not alter the original surface topography. Extended IR Reflow and high-temperature accelerated stress testing (HAST) provide further validation of the durability of the interface. The effectiveness of the promoter in maintaining strong Cu-dielectric bonding under harsh stress conditions is demonstrated by FESEM and FIB analysis.As a global leader in laser, desmear chemistry and surface treatment, our understanding of interfacial processes extends beyond adhesion alone. This allows us to support customers with fully integrated bonding solutions, combining advanced materials, process integration and application expertise to meet the evolving demands of IC substrate manufacturing.

title: Parameters Identification of Lithium-Ion Battery Model Based on Dung Beetle Optimization Algorithm Improved Particle Filter
authors: Yuxuan Yao, Shiping Zhao, Quan Ran
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Information Technology (AICIT)
abstract: Accurate modeling of lithium-ion batteries is fundamental to effective battery management systems. This paper proposes an improved particle filter method enhanced by the dung beetle optimizer for online identification of battery model parameters. The optimizer quickly converges to a global optimum, optimizing noise parameters within the filter and improving estimation accuracy. Simulation results demonstrate that the proposed method significantly reduces identification errors compared to the standard particle filter approach, yielding parameter estimates closer to true values.

title: Broadband Two-Array Metasurface-Gridded MIMO Antenna with Dual-CP Bi-Directional Capabilities
authors: Nathapat Supreeyatitikul, Khwanlada Kakhong, Pusit Prasong, Chuwong Phongcharoenpanich, Jessada Konpang
publish: 2025 Research, Invention, and Innovation Congress: Innovative Electricals and Electronics (RI2C)
abstract: This study presents a novel two-array MTS-gridded MIMO antenna with dual circular polarization (CP) bidirectional capabilities for full-duplex communications. The proposed antenna consists of two mirrored clusters, each comprising a single-element antenna formed by a 3 × 4 MTS-gridded element array, a circular patch, and a ground plane. The antenna demonstrates a wide measured return loss bandwidth (RLBW) of 56.46% (5 – 8.67 GHz), axial ratio bandwidth (ARBW) of 18.15% (6.26 – 7.44 GHz), and strong isolation below –22 dB. Peak gains of 6.5 dBic and 6.55 dBic were observed at 6.6 GHz and 6.54 GHz for Ports 1 and 2, respectively. Furthermore, the low envelope correlation coefficient (< 0.005) and high diversity gain (> 9.985 dB) validate its effectiveness for multi-port applications. The bidirectional radiation pattern and dual circular polarization support simultaneous transmission and reception, making the design well-suited for full-duplex MIMO operation.

title: Design and Implementation of a Microwave Laboratory Setup for Training in Engineering Education
authors: Sangwon Kittiwittayapong, Kittisak Phaebua, Chidapha Khongchim, Wasin Kheawsawang, Danai Torrungrueng, Akkarat Boonpoonga
publish: 2025 Research, Invention, and Innovation Congress: Innovative Electricals and Electronics (RI2C)
abstract: This paper presents the design and implementation of a microwave experimental setup to support engineering education in Thailand, focusing on 5G communication technologies. The setup includes a Wilkinson power divider, a quadrature hybrid, and a ring hybrid, all operating at 2.6 GHz. Lab sheets with theoretical content and detailed procedures were developed alongside circuit prototypes to enhance student understanding of microwave circuits. Expert evaluation yielded an average score of 4.38, indicating high educational value, while student satisfaction averaged 4.40, reflecting effective skill development. The results demonstrate that this setup effectively bridges theoretical knowledge and practical competencies in microwave engineering education.

title: Simulation Study of a Hybrid PV-Grid Multi-Voltage Battery-Swapping System for Electric Motorcycles
authors: Dianti Utamidewi, Andi Erwin Eka Putra, Yusran, Gerard Antonini Duma, Ahmad Fathulshadiq Suherman
publish: 2025 International Conference on Smart-Green Technology in Electrical and Information Systems (ICSGTEIS)
abstract: Battery swapping offers a promising solution for electric motorcycle charging by minimizing downtime and enhancing operational efficiency. This paper presents the design and simulation of a hybrid PV-grid powered battery swapping station capable of simultaneously charging three battery types <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$(48 \mathrm{V}, 60 \mathrm{V}$</tex>, and 72 V) using a modular converter system. A realtime MOSFET-based switching mechanism is developed to prioritize solar photovoltaic (PV) energy when available and shift to grid power under low irradiance conditions. The simulation, conducted in MATLAB/Simulink over a 12-second runtime with irradiance levels varying from 500 to <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$1000 \mathrm{W} / \mathrm{m}^{2}$</tex> and down to <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$10 \mathrm{W} / \mathrm{m}^{2}$</tex>, demonstrates smooth source switching and stable voltage regulation (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\sim \mathbf{1 0 0 V}$</tex>). The State-of-Charge (SoC) increased from <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{5 0 \%}$</tex> to <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{5 9. 7 4 \%}$</tex> for the <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{4 8 V}$</tex> battery, <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{4 5 \%}$</tex> to <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{5 2. 8 4 \%}$</tex> for the <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{6 0 V}$</tex> battery, and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{4 0 \%}$</tex> to <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{4 7. 8 5 \%}$</tex> for the <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{7 2 V}$</tex> battery. These results confirm the effectiveness of the proposed design in enabling adaptive, multi-voltage charging under realistic solar conditions. The proposed architecture shows potential for scalable deployment in regions with nonstandardized battery configurations.

title: Temporal Analysis of Microwave Radiation Bursts Associated with Positive Narrow Bipolar Events
authors: Ahmad Rifhan Salman, Mohd Riduan Ahmad, Muhammad Zuhair Bolqiah Edris, Harry Sucitra Roslan, Muhammad Uwais Farihin Fauzi, Muhammad Haziq Mohammad Sabri, Mohamad Zoinol Abidin Abd Aziz, Farah Hani Nordin, Zen-Ichiro Kawasaki, Yuji Takayanagi, Takeshi Morimoto, Mohd Zafri Baharuddin
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: This study investigates the temporal characteristics of microwave radiation bursts associated with positive Narrow Bipolar Events (+NBEs) using a 0.925 GHz Ultra High Frequency interferometer (UHF ITF) system. Ten +NBE events recorded between September and October 2024 were analyzed, focusing on electric field parameters such as rise time (RT), zero-crossing time (ZCT), and pulse duration (PD), alongside microwave parameters including onset difference, burst duration, and peak amplitude. The results showed that microwave bursts occurred nearly simultaneously with the electric field signals, with stronger bursts during the RT phase and weaker after the ZCT point. The measured onset differences averaged <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$0.398 \pm 0.217 \mu ~\mathrm{s}$</tex>, and burst durations averaged <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$9.32 \pm 1.65 \mu ~\mathrm{s}$</tex>. These findings are generally consistent with previous studies and provide new observational insights into the temporal behavior of microwave radiation in tropical thunderstorms, highlighting the capability of UHF ITF for lightning research.

title: Smart Healthcare and Wellness Systems for Real-Time Monitoring
authors: P.Sathish Kumar, T.Manasa Veena, S.Saranya, S.Ramasamy, S.Aruna Deepthi, K. Radha
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Innovations in intelligent healthcare and the Internet of Medical Things (IoMT) are transforming medical practice, moving it from traditional reactive treatment toward preventive, real-time, and personalized care. This research presents an Edge–Cloud Healthcare Framework that brings together information from a number of sources, including wearable sensors, biomedical imaging equipment, and environmental monitoring systems. Fundamentally, the framework employs a Hybrid Deep Neural Network (HDNN) that integrates convolutional layers for image-based medical Recurrent layer analysis for interpreting time-series physiological signals. Early adoption is in favor this design. anomaly detection and effective risk prediction. In order to balance the computational burdens, a Dynamic Priority Scheduling Algorithm (DPSA) is applied, To maintain equilibrium among the computational demands and cloud resources based on latency requirements and the criticality of patient data, ensuring fast responses alongside accurate results. evaluation of an experiment utilizing 5G-enabled ECG and SpO<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</inf> wearable Devices' inference latency was average of 14.7 ms and improved diagnostic accuracy by 9.3% over conventional telemedicine models. Moreover, smart home simulations demonstrated the task that is adaptive orchestration less energy consumption by 18% while remaining receptive. In general, the results show that combining edge computing with intelligent arranging mechanisms is able to provide scalable, reliable, and patient-focused healthcare solutions, enabling both ongoing observation and personalized wellness interventions in real-world environments.

title: A Transaction-Based Settlement Framework for Electricity Markets
authors: Yifan Wang, Yuxuan Zhao, Zhao Xia Jing
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: This paper proposes a comprehensive framework for separating congestion surplus from generation-load imbalance funds in electricity spot markets through transaction-based settlement and power flow tracing techniques. Current settlement practices in deregulated electricity markets often aggregate different types of imbalance funds without distinguishing their fundamentally different economic origins-congestion surplus arising from transmission constraints versus imbalance funds stemming from forecast errors and operational deviations. This aggregation leads to inefficient cost allocation and distorted market signals. We develop a novel classification methodology that employs power flow tracing to decompose total electricity transactions into bilateral trades between generators and loads, enabling precise identification and separation of congestionrelated revenues. Through systematic analysis using two-node and three-node case studies, we demonstrate that congestion surplus can be accurately isolated and quantified, while generation-load imbalance funds can be eliminated through transaction-pair settlement. Furthermore, we explore the application of separated congestion surplus for transmission loss compensation under flat settlement methods. Our findings indicate that the proposed framework enhances market transparency, improves settlement accuracy, and provides better alignment between financial settlements and physical power flows. The methodology offers practical implementation pathways for system operators seeking to improve imbalance settlement mechanisms and optimize surplus allocation in modern electricity markets.

title: SmartSort for Outlook: A Machine Learning Approach to Automated Email Classification
authors: Virendra Kumar Shrivastava, Pragya Dubey, Sanjana Dixith, Abhishek Kumar Singh, Y. Sunil Kumar
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: As email becomes the predominant digital communication medium, people and organizations are bombarded with enormous amounts of messages ranging from personal and professional communications to promotional and malicious content. In the midst of all these, phishing and spam emails pose the greatest challenge, employing sophisticated obfuscation mechanisms, misleading language, and spoofed sending identities in order to circumvent traditional rule-based and statistical spam filters. In this work, researchers introduced real-time, deep learning-based email classification system that improves digital security and automates email management. Our work presents a new hybrid model that integrates Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory (BiLSTM) networks with Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT), smoothly taking advantage of both contextual semantics and sequential structure of email messages. Apart from raw text content, we have included structural and behavioural metadata such as sender domain reputation, hyperlink features, the presence of HTML tags, attachment file types, and frequency of external links to further enhance the model's capacity to identify subtle indicators of malicious behaviour. The proposed email classification has attained accuracy (94.6%), F1-score (93.4%), and particularly phishing recall (88,2%).

title: MediHealth AI: An Integrated Framework for Automated Health Report Analysis, Symptom Triage, and Conversational Assistance
authors: Dhanshri Kawde, Chetan Puri
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: The surging popularity of health information on the Web and the current lack of healthcare specialists in the world have made it necessary to develop not only clever, but also self-governing health systems. The current paper presents a new product based on the integrated artificial intelligence platform, named MediHealth AI, with the ability to optimize the delivery of healthcare through three functionalities, including self-sustaining health report analysis, intelligent symptom triaging, and interactive patient communication. Through Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and Explainable AI (XAI), the platform provides actionable intelligence of both structured and unstructured healthcare data, lists with the symptomary severity of the patients, and live suggestions and recommendations on an interactive chatbot interface. The potential of the MediHealth AI is unfathomable when it comes to optimizing the clinical workload, diagnostic effectiveness, and providing an individual with the necessary data on their health they need and at the opportune time. Substantiated by literature and supported experimentally, there is great increased accuracy of diagnosis and patient satisfaction. The framework overcomes the existing issues of mismanagement of clinical data related to information overload, interoperability, and fairness of algorithms in AI-driven applications and introduces scalable, transparent, and human-centered digital health.

title: Real-Time AI-Based Skill Gap Analysis and Adaptive Career Guidance Using a Generative AI Framework for the Modern Job Market
authors: Sharmila Sengupta, Soham Parab, Sushanth Shetty, Vighnarth Nile, Atharva Sambhaji
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Conventional career guidance systems face significant limitations, including generic recommendations, inefficient skill-job matching, and a lack of personalized learning pathways. These limitations arise primarily because traditional systems depend on manual resume screening and static keyword-based filters, approaches that cannot adapt to evolving skill requirements or changing labor market demands. To overcome these challenges, this article presents SkillBridgeAI, a web-based solution that leverages generative AI to transform career development. The platform integrates dynamic competency testing with AIdriven analytics to create detailed and adaptive user profiles. By performing real-time skill gap analysis, automated resume tailoring, certificate management, and AI-curated course recommendations, SkillBridgeAI effectively bridges the gap between evolving workforce skills and employer demands. This study introduces a comprehensive AI-driven framework that advances career development tools, simplifying the journey from skill assessment to optimal employment placement.

title: Dynamic Temporal Cross-Modal Attention for Early Parkinson’s Disease Detection using Voice and Spiral Drawing Data
authors: Saranya Ray, Shriranjani R, J. RamaPrabha, Ajanthaa Lakkshmanan, Akash Balaji, G Jeyashaathvee
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Parkinson’s Disease (PD) is a neurodegenerative disorder characterized by progressive motor and vocal impairments. This paper presents a novel multimodal deep learning framework for PD classification that integrates hand-drawn spiral analysis and voice signal processing. We introduce a Dynamic Temporal Cross-Modal Attention (DTCMA) mechanism designed to capture time-aligned degradation patterns across two heterogeneous biomedical modalities: spiral drawing images and voice recordings represented in CSV format. Voice features, including jitter, shimmer, and Mel-frequency cepstral coefficients (MFCCs), are segmented into temporal sequences using sliding windows, while spiral drawings are reconstructed into stroke-level time-series capturing tremor, velocity, and pressure dynamics. The proposed DTCMA employs bidirectional gated recurrent units (Bi-GRUs) and stage-adaptive attention weights informed by Hoehn & Yahr scale embeddings. Our approach demonstrates superior classification performance compared to traditional late-fusion and static attention models, particularly in early-stage PD detection. Additionally, we integrate Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) using Shapley Additive Explanations (SHAP) to uncover cross-modal biomarker interactions, enhancing model transparency for clinical decision support. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first study to apply cross-modal temporal attention to the fusion of voice CSV features and spiral drawing image data for personalized and interpretable PD diagnosis

title: Research and Development of LLC Resonant Converters with Sliding-Mode-PI Hybrid Control Strategy
authors: Likui Xiao, Zhaoliang Meng, Jiahao Hu, Tongtong Yang
publish: 2025 10th International Seminar on Computer Technology, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (ISCME)
abstract: The full-bridge LLC resonant converter offers the advantages of achieving zero-voltage switching for the switching transistors and zero-current switching for the output diodes across a wide load range, making it suitable for medium-to-high power applications. However, it suffers from slow response and poor robustness in PI control, while sliding mode control methods exhibit high-frequency chattering. To address these issues, this paper proposes a fuzzy sliding mode-PI hybrid control strategy. The algorithmic process is thoroughly derived in this paper. Finally, a system simulation model is established in MATLAB / Simulink to conduct simulation analyses under two experimental conditions: startup time and load transients. Results demonstrate that the fuzzy sliding mode-PI hybrid control exhibits advantages such as fast transient response, minimal overshoot, and robust performance. It also eliminates the chattering issue inherent in sliding mode control, delivering excellent control performance.

title: Research on Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor (PMSM) for Train Adhesion Control Based on Active Disturbance Rejection Control (ADRC)
authors: Kangyu Wang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: To address the complex and variable wheel-rail adhesion characteristics during train operation and insufficient anti-interference capability of traditional control methods, this paper applies the Active Disturbance Rejection Control strategy to the train adhesion control of Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motors. By constructing a Nonlinear Active Disturbance Rejection Controller integrated with an Extended State Observer, it achieves precise control of motor speed and electromagnetic torque, and real-time estimation and compensation of internal and external system disturbances. Experimental results show that compared with traditional proportional-integral control, the proposed strategy performs better in dynamic response, anti-load disturbance and adhesion stability: speed overshoot is reduced by over $30 \%$, electromagnetic torque harmonics decrease significantly, adhesion coefficient fluctuation under dynamic disturbances is controlled within $\pm \mathbf{0. 0 1}$, and wheel-rail stick-slip oscillation is effectively suppressed. This study verifies the controller’s effectiveness in improving train adhesion utilization and operational safety under complex rail conditions, providing theoretical reference and technical support for high-speed train traction control system design.

title: Automatic Infusion Liquid Delivery Machine Equipped with Safety Sensor
authors: Muhammad Achsanul In’am, Noor Pratama Apriyanto, Nana Sutarna
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electronic and Electrical Engineering and Intelligent System (ICE3IS)
abstract: Intravenous infusion remains vital for delivering fluids and medications in clinical settings. However, conventional infusion systems are prone to flow rate inaccuracies and undetected safety issues such as occlusions and air bubbles. This study aims to design and evaluate an innovative automatic infusion pump utilizing a rotary peristaltic mechanism with safety sensors for occlusion and bubble detection. The device uses a stepper motor to regulate flow rates ranging from 10 to $50 \mathrm{~mL} /$ hour. A load cell sensor (100 g) is integrated to detect line blockages, while an optical sensor is employed to identify air bubbles in the infusion line. Flow accuracy testing using an Infusion Device Analyzer (IDA) showed all error values were within the $\pm 5 \%$ threshold set by ECRI standards, with the highest error observed at $\mathbf{1 0 ~ m L} /$ hour and the lowest at $40 \mathrm{~mL} /$ hour. The occlusion alarm was triggered at an average pressure of $\mathbf{5. 7 1} \mathbf{P s i}$, below the maximum safety limit of $\mathbf{1 0 ~ P s i}$. The bubble detection system was sensitive enough to detect air bubbles as small as 1.2 mm, exceeding the WHO minimum standard of 3 mm. The results demonstrate that the developed device achieves accurate fluid delivery and provides effective safety monitoring, making it suitable for clinical application.

title: Efficient and Accurate Short Answer Grading Using SBERT
authors: Sampa Das, Udit Kumar Chakraborty
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: In this study, we propose a new ASAG framework utilizing SBERT (Sentence Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers). This language model uses contextual embeddings to evaluate the similarity between a student's answer and the standard response. Sentence-BERT (SBERT) has been widely utilized to generate sentence embeddings with high-quality semantic representation. This study proposes the integration of the FNet model, which replaces self-attention mechanisms with Fourier transformations, to reduce computational complexity while maintaining or improving embedding performance. The suggested model is tested using the PT ASAG dataset with precision and F1 score serving as performance indicators. The findings from the experiments show that the proposed SBERT model surpasses current top-tier models, achieving a 91% accuracy, an RMSE of 0.29%, and an F1-score of 0.89. The incorporation of FNet and the improvements in the pooling contributed to the superior performance of the model on the PT ASAG dataset. Our results highlight the efficiency and scalability of FNet for ASAG tasks, with implications for large scale educational assessment.

title: Numerical Simulation and Experimental Investigation of Plasma Dynamics in Grid-type Compressed Arcextinguishing Device
authors: Yuang Long, Ping Huang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: Lightning strikes pose the primary threat to the safe operation of transmission lines, as the plasma arcs generated can easily cause short-circuiting. To address this, this paper investigates a novel grid-type compressed arc-extinguishing device (GCAD). To analyze its arc-extinguishing effectiveness, a combined simulation and experimental approach is adopted. Finite element analysis software COMSOL Multiphysics is employed to simulate airflow dynamics and arc energy behavior, while power-frequency continuous current interruption tests are conducted to validate its arc-extinguishing performance. The simulation and experimental results demonstrate that GCAD can effectively extinguish power-frequency arcs within 3 ms, exerting a strong inhibitory effect. The re-ignition rate is nearly zero, confirming the efficacy and reliability of this self-excited arcextinguishing mechanism.

title: Secure Federated Learning Framework for Real-Time English Grammar Correction on Edge Devices
authors: Muhammedali Chalikandy Puthiyapurayil, Md. Sahidul Islam, S. Vijayakumar, N. Sheik Hameed, Jaffer Sha S S, Sreela B
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Effective communication, especially in academic, professional, and digital communication, is impossible without the English grammar correction. Conventional grammar correction models, both rule-based and centralized deep learning models, are characterized by severe limitations of low adaptability, high computational costs, and privacy threats to users. In order to resolve these problems, this work presents FedDistil-GEC, a safe and effective grammar correction system that combines DistilBERT and Federated Learning. The model is trained in a collaborative fashion among distributed edge devices so that raw user information is not shared, but only encrypted gradient updates. Trained on the JFLEG corpus and complemented with anonymized edge-user inputs, the system has obtained a high score, GLEU = 0.86, BLEU = 0.78, and a token-level accuracy = 91.30%. In addition, the model has low inference latency of 38 ms on mobile platforms. This is a privacy-aware, resource-saving method that can be used to do real-time grammar correction that can be used in education, language learning, and mobile writing support.

title: Analysis of the Impact of Distributed Phase Modulators on the Static Stability Margin of HighProportion Wind Power Systems
authors: Ri Qu, Yang Liu, Xu Zhang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: The integration of high-proportion wind power into the grid poses significant challenges to static voltage stability due to its inherent weak reactive power regulation capability. This paper focuses on the static stability margin of high-proportion wind power systems, analyzing the impact mechanisms of grid structure, reactive power compensation capacity, and configuration location on static voltage stability. The relationship between the static stability limit and reactive power compensation is theoretically derived by establishing the $\mathbf{P}-\mathbf{V}$ curve of the gridconnected wind power system. Furthermore, the transient and sub-transient characteristics of the distributed phase-shifting transformer (PST) and its reactive power support principle are investigated, clarifying the mechanism by which it improves the static voltage stability margin by enhancing the system’s shortcircuit capacity and critical short-circuit ratio. The results indicate that integrating distributed PSTs shifts the transmission limit point of the P-V curve upward and to the right, effectively expanding the stable operating region of the system. Finally, a wind-thermal-bundled HVDC transmission system model is built on the PSCAD simulation platform. Simulations under various operating conditions verify the theoretical analysis, confirming that reducing line reactance, increasing reactive power compensation capacity, and deploying distributed PSTs can significantly enhance the system’s static stability margin.

title: Enhancing Social and Emotional Skills of University Students through Fisher Score Sparse Auto Encoder Technique
authors: Deependra Nath Pathak, Amit Chawla, Kumaresan V, B. Rama Subba Reddy, Thulasimani T, Rajib Mandal
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Developing students' social and emotional competencies, along with other 21st-century competencies like socio-emotional intelligence and soft skills, has been a growing focus of educational policy in the last 20 years. These abilities are at the heart of the continuing debates over the ethics of artificial intelligence and human progress in the digital era, and their influence on societal, economic, and educational outcomes is well-known. Data preprocessing, feature extraction, and model training comprise the three stages of this study's machine learning-based method for correctly identifying social and emotional abilities. After cleaning the raw data in the preprocessing stage, the Fisher Score-Sparse AE technique is employed in feature extraction to remove superfluous features while keeping the ones that accurately portray emotional qualities. A proposed hybrid localization model combines global and sub models to solve the constraints of subregional localization mistakes. This method achieves above 99.12% accuracy in recognizing social and emotional skills, according to experimental evaluations, which is better than multiple state-of-the-art approaches. The significance of incorporating modern technology to evaluate and cultivate essential 21st-century competencies in authentic contexts is underscored by these results, which also demonstrate the promise of AI tools in assisting educational goals.

title: Telecommunication-Enabled mHealth Intervention: Evaluating the Effect of a Medication Reminder App on Adherence Among Hypertensive Patients
authors: Fachri Argya Cahyadi, Mullah Muhammad Agwa, Muhammad Thesa Ghozali
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electronic and Electrical Engineering and Intelligent System (ICE3IS)
abstract: High blood pressure or hypertension remains a leading non-communicable disease globally, with medication non-adherence causing a significant barrier to effective management, especially in low-resource settings. Digital health technologies offer novel solutions for improving self-management among patients with chronic conditions. This study aimed to evaluate the effect of a mobile-based medication reminder application on adherence to antihypertensive therapy among patients in rural Indonesian settings. A preexperimental one-group pretest-posttest design was employed involving 46 hypertensive patients from Kokap I Community Health Center, Kulonprogo District, Special Region of Yogyakarta, Indonesia. Participants used a smartphone-based medication reminder mobile app for four weeks. Medication adherence was assessed before and after the intervention using validated Morisky Medication Adherence Scale (MMAS-8). Data were analyzed using Wilcoxon signed-rank test. The proportion of patients with low drug adherence decreased from 43.5% to 10.9%, while moderate and high adherence increased to 65.2% and 23.9%, respectively. The mean MMAS-8 score improved significantly from 5.67 to 6.74 (p < 0.001). The mobile reminder application demonstrated a statistically significant improvement in medication adherence. This study supports the integration of simple, scalable mHealth tools in primary care, notably for chronic disease management in underserved communities.

title: Study of Body Bias on the Frequency Tuning Range of a Ring Oscillator in 180 nm SCL PDK Technology
authors: Shivani D, Mohd Ziauddin Jahangir
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: This paper investigates the impact of body biasing on the frequency tuning range of a ring oscillator designed in 180nm SCL PDK technology. Conventional ring oscillators suffer from a limited tuning range, especially under process corner variations. This work applies a body bias to PMOS transistors to modify the threshold voltage, thereby improving oscillation frequency. The design was implemented and simulated using Cadence Virtuoso with the 180 nm SCL PDK Technology. Comparative analysis between conventional and body-bias designs was carried out using various capacitor types (MIM, NW, USG). Simulation results show that the body-bias configuration achieves a frequency tuning range of 0.3–7 GHz, compared to 1–2 GHz in the conventional design, with improved phase noise and jitter performance. The proposed model of the Ring Oscillator with Body Biasing offers a phase noise ranging from -77.23dBc/Hz to -102.11dBc/Hz at 1MHz offset, with power consumption ranging from 48.48-374.529μW. The model achieves approximately 1-14ps of Cycle Jitter, respectively. The proposed method offers a viable approach for high-resolution ADPLL design, particularly in GHz-range applications.

title: Detecting Evergreen Articles: Comparing Word Embeddings for Hybrid Bidirectional GRU and LSTM Model on Indonesian News Portal
authors: Adhelio Reyhandro, Ahmad Faza
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electronic and Electrical Engineering and Intelligent System (ICE3IS)
abstract: Automatically detecting evergreen articles in Indonesian news media is a challenge and vital task for sustaining long-term SEO and audience engagement in media industry. This research propose a hybrid parallel deep learning model that hybrids bidirectional GRU and LSTM layers with FastText embeddings, and compare its performance against other word embedding methods, CNN-LSTM and IndoBERT. The experiments utilize a balanced dataset of $\mathbf{5, 8 1 0}$ manually labeled article titles from Kompas.com, which underwent preprocessing via case folding, punctuation and number removal, and stemming. Three word embedding techniques, TFIDF, Word2Vec, and FastText, are employed, with each model trained under consistent settings. The results shows TF-IDF and Word2Vec yield acceptable performance, FastText enhances model robustness. The hybrid BiGRU-BiLSTM model attains a test accuracy of $92.51 \%$ with low loss, although IndoBERT attains superior performance with $95.09 \%$ accuracy. These findings highlight the effectiveness of word embeddings and hybrid architectures for evergreen article detection. Future work could incorporate attention mechanisms and ensemble methods to enhance classification, offering a promising direction for automated news analysis and supporting strategic decision-making in media organizations.

title: Earthquake Magnitude Prediction : Comparative Study of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Methods
authors: Aulya Sri Utami Ilham, Stefani Tasya Hallatu, Ratih Nur Esti Anggraini
publish: 2025 Eight International Conference on Vocational Education and Electrical Engineering (ICVEE)
abstract: Earthquakes are natural disasters that cause significant damage to infrastructure and pose serious risks to human life, particularly in seismically active regions such as Indonesia. Accurate earthquake magnitude prediction is therefore an important component of early warning and disaster mitigation systems. This study investigates the use of machine learning and deep learning approaches for predicting earthquake magnitudes based on Indonesian earthquake data from 2000 to 2025, comprising 59,571 recorded events. Two experimental scenarios were explored models trained with all available features and models trained on reduced-dimensional data using Principal Component Analysis (PCA). The evaluated methods include Backpropagation, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN), Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM), Feedforward Neural Networks (FNN), Extreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost), and hybrid combinations such as FNN + XGBoost. Model performance was assessed using Mean Absolute Error (MAE), Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE), Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE), and R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup>. Results show that boosting-based approaches, particularly XGBoost and FNN + XGBoost, consistently delivered the best performance, achieving the lowest MAE (0.1426) and highest R<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> (0.7534) when using the full feature set. PCA-based models exhibited a modest accuracy decline of around 8–10% but offered substantial computational gains, with reduced training time and memory usage. These findings highlight a trade-off between predictive accuracy and efficiency, suggesting that feature-rich models are more suitable for high-precision seismic risk analysis, while PCA-reduced models are more practical for real-time operational deployment in earthquake early warning systems.

title: Enhanced Color Image Security Using Chaotic Maps and Genetic Algorithm-Optimized Symmetric Key Encryption
authors: Dhruv Nariani, Falak Shah, Ramchandra Mangrulkar, Vinaya Sawant
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The document describes an approach to securing color images by combining mappings with a symmetric key encryption system optimized by a genetic algorithm. The method involves using Arnold, and logistic mappings create a sequence that rearranges the positions in the original color image. This initial scrambling stage creates confusion. It makes it very difficult to identify the content of the original image. To enhance security more and provide encryption than the essential Standard Data Encryption Standard offers, we include the AES algorithm for the diffusion process in our approach. A crucial part of our method involves using an algorithm to determine the possible key for AES (Advanced Encryption Standard). The fitness function of this algorithm is carefully designed to maximize the Shannon entropy of the encrypted image. Statistical analysis ensures randomness and reduces the risk of information leakage. This paper also examines how chaotic maps converge and diverge to confirm the robustness of the generation process. The research results presented in the study show that the new method achieves top-notch security for images compared to existing methods in terms of key strength and resilience against various types of attacks.

title: AI-Driven Fruit and Vegitable Quality Recognition: A CNN Approach for Agricultural Enhancement
authors: Saranya Devi S, Anandha Mithra A
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: The application of computer vision and deep learning in agriculture has transformed quality assessment, enabling the automated classification of fruits and vegetables based on their health status. This study presents a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) approach using Keras, KerasCV, and TensorFlow to classify Guava, Jujube, Grape, Pomegranate, Potato, Tomato, Carrot, Cucumber, Bell Pepper, Strawberry, Mango, Orange, Banana, and Apple as either healthy or rotten. The model is built on the EfficientNetV2B3 architecture, trained on a dataset of approximately 30,000 images, incorporating image preprocessing, augmentation, and fine-tuning techniques to enhance performance. Experimental results demonstrate the model’s effectiveness, achieving 97.0% accuracy on the test dataset with a low test loss of 0.0863. Over five training epochs, the validation accuracy increased from 90.5% to 97.3%, while validation loss reduced from 0.28 to 0.08, indicating efficient learning. The integration of CNN-based classification in agriculture can significantly enhance quality control, reduce food waste, and optimize the supply chain, ensuring that only high-quality produce reaches consumers.

title: Financial AI: Harnessing Machine Learning for Algorithmic Trading, Risk Assessment, and Fraud Detection
authors: Anurag Shrivastava, RVS Praveen, Saif O. Husain, Prem Kumar Sholapurapu, Kushagra Kulshreshtha, Shashi Prakash Dwivedi
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) in financial markets has revolutionized the way traditional operations are performed, contributing to accelerated decision-making, better risk management, and enhanced returns, driven by data processing technology and its predictive capabilities. We discuss machine learning (ML) as potential risk assessment and fraud detection tools in algorithmic trading as well as its role in improved market efficiency and market security. In algorithmic trading, ML models process large amounts of data, detecting trends and executing trades quickly, minimizing human error and maximizing profits. AI’s predictive capabilities also assist in evaluating market volatility and credit risk for some typical risk assessment processes, as well as in enriching portfolio management with predictive analytics. Ai-assisted fraud detection software also improves detection with real-time scanning for patterns in data, relying on anomaly detection techniques and deep learning models to continuously identify fraudulent activities. However, several other challenges like data privacy, regulatory challenges, and model interpretability persist. Articles and research papers covering methodologies, advantages, challenges, and the future of systemic aspects in Financial AI are published and contribute to implement Financial AI while discussing the ethical aspects in it. Leveraging artificial intelligence in finance needs innovation correctly regulated to build out sustainable and safe ecosystem of finance.

title: Design and Development of Image based Climate Prediction Model by using Quantum Computing Technology
authors: Sandhya K. Yerra, Vivek Pandey, Sunita D. Singh, Bushra A. Momin, Geetanjali P. Mule, Ankit Sanghavi
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Climate prediction plays a crucial role in understanding and mitigating the impacts of climate change. Traditional climate models, though powerful, often face challenges in handling the vast, high-dimensional satellite imagery data required for accurate forecasting. Meanwhile, quantum computing offers new computational paradigms capable of addressing complex problems intractable for classical systems. In this research, we propose an innovative framework for an image-based climate prediction model leveraging quantum computing technology. By integrating quantum machine learning algorithms with satellite Earth observation data, the model aims to extract critical climatic patterns such as temperature anomalies, cloud movements, and vegetation dynamics with enhanced precision and computational efficiency. The study addresses existing limitations by developing specialized quantum algorithms for image processing, exploring quantum-classical hybrid architectures, and optimizing the system for real-world scalability using current and near-term quantum devices. Preliminary results suggest that quantum approaches have the potential to outperform traditional techniques in processing speed and predictive accuracy, particularly for high-resolution, time-series satellite imagery. This work represents a significant step toward practical, quantum-enhanced climate modeling, bridging the gap between quantum computing advancements and urgent global climate forecasting needs.

title: A Comprehensive Approach to Multi-Factor of Medium and Long-Term Electricity Load Forecasting Utilizing a Hybrid Model
authors: Hongyan Li, Jaturapith Krohkaew, Sawek Pratummet, Wanwinit Wijittemee, Boonyang Plangklang
publish: 2025 International Conference on Power, Energy and Innovations (ICPEI)
abstract: Medium and long-term electricity load forecasting is crucial to power system planning, operation and management. Accurate prediction helps to rationally arrange the construction and expansion of power generation, transmission and distribution facilities, optimize the allocation of resources, and improve the reliability and economy of the power system. This paper introduces a hybrid deep learning architecture CNN-LSTM, which integrates principal factors and auxiliary factors from the training dataset. The model initially leverages the feature extraction capabilities of the CNN layer to obtain complex spatial characteristics of the power load and subsequently feeds these features into the LSTM network to capture temporal dependencies. By using a hybrid model, the accuracy of predictions can be significantly enhanced by effectively integrating spatial and temporal information. This experiment is implemented based on the Pytorch deep learning framework, and the analysis of its predictive performance shows that this hybrid method outperforms its component model.

title: Smart Meter Energy Data Compression by a Low-computational Differential Coding based Lossless Compression Algorithm
authors: Subhra J. Sarkar, Kalyanmoy Mukherjee, Binshati Chatterjee, Alok Kumar, Priya Adak, Bidrohi Bhattacharjee
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Smart meter is responsible for producing a large volume of energy consumption data and therefore data compression can be an useful tool for compressing such data sets. As smart meter is having a low computational processing unit, a simple low computational data compression algorithm will be appropriate for the successful embedding of the algorithm at the microcontroller level. Based on the trend of practical energy consumption data sets of four different smart meters over two months, a simple differential coding based data compression algorithm is proposed in the manuscript and the performance is analyzed for sample and practical data sets by developing the respective routine in MATLAB R2013a. The obtained results were encouraging, and about 35% data reduction is obtained for practical data sets. The compression algorithm will be useful in realizing a compressed data transfer system where the practical energy data array collected periodically will be compressed at the encoding end and the compressed information will be transmitted through the communication channel. This compressed data transfer will reduce the energy requirements and thereby improving the energy efficiency. Attempt will be made to implement the work at the microcontroller level to realize a secured compressed time-series data transfer system.

title: Vision transformer-based emergency classification in Azure cloud
authors: Lin Cho, Seongho Kim, Eontae Kim, Seonggyeong Kim, Wooyoung Son, Byungseok Kang
publish: 2025 3rd International Conference on Intelligent Perception and Computer Vision (CIPCV)
abstract: In modern society, due to the rapid aging of the population, health and long-term care (LTC) management of the elderly aged 65 and over are important social issues. Existing machine learning models that analyze standardized features have limitations in effectively interpreting complex bio-signal patterns. To solve this problem, we propose a vision transformer-based emergency classification service. A new foundation model based on the Transformer architecture can understand human language more accurately and classify requests with much less training than before. We modified the existing Transformer model MobileHART to be suitable for emergency classification.

title: Power Allocation of Multi-Stack Fuel Cells in an Electric-Hydrogen Hybrid Storage System for a Wind Farm Under a Dispatch Strategy
authors: Xinyi He, Shanke Liu, Zheng Zhou, Yinkai Bao, Hao Chen, Lijun Yu
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: To tackle the challenges of low system efficiency and irrational operating hours in electric-hydrogen hybrid storage systems, stemming from the constrained output of single fuel cell stacks, this paper constructs a hierarchical energy management strategy. The upper layer employs a Model Predictive Control (MPC) based controller to optimally schedule the power of the hybrid system, with the objectives of ensuring precise grid command tracking and maximizing wind power consumption. In the lower layer, a controller based on the Rotary Daisy Chain (RDC) algorithm allocates the total power reference from the upper layer among individual stacks. This distribution is based on the efficiency-power characteristics and operating conditions of each stack, generating precise commands for their start-stop and power output. The simulation results validate that the proposed hierarchical strategy can effectively mitigate wind power volatility and ensure accurate tracking of dispatch schedules, limiting the wind curtailment rate to 3.43%. Furthermore, it boosts the operating efficiency of the multi-stack system and markedly improves the degradation consistency among fuel cells by dynamically balancing their loads, thereby reinforcing the longterm operational stability of the system.

title: Early Detection of Alzheimer's Disease using Machine Learning and Deep Learning Techniques
authors: Aakash Majeed, Raj Kumar, Navpreet Kaur Walia
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: This study evaluates the performance of four machine learning classifiers—Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, Balanced Random Forest, and a Neural Network Classifier—for Alzheimer’s disease (AD) detection. The models were assessed based on precision, recall, and F1-score to determine their efficacy in distinguishing between cognitively normal (CN) individuals and those with AD. Gradient Boosting achieved the highest accuracy (96%), demonstrating superior recall (92%) for the minority class, making it highly reliable for imbalanced datasets. Balanced Random Forest closely followed, offering improved class balance while maintaining strong predictive performance (95% accuracy). The standard Random Forest classifier showed excellent overall accuracy (95%) but exhibited a slight bias toward the majority class. Meanwhile, the Neural Network classifier, while achieving a competitive 92% accuracy, showed reduced recall for AD cases, suggesting the need for further optimization. These findings highlight Gradient Boosting and Balanced Random Forest as the most effective models for AD classification, offering a balance of precision and sensitivity crucial for early diagnosis.

title: Advanced Flat Cable Innovations for Scalable and Flexible System Architectures
authors: Chiew Yee Ho, Brian Ho, Jimmy Hsu, Lemon Lin, Anderson Lin, Leo Lee, Eric Hsiao
publish: 2025 20th International Microsystems, Packaging, Assembly and Circuits Technology Conference (IMPACT)
abstract: As datacenter’s demands are growing with Artificial Intelligent (AI) workloads, high-speed interconnect (HSIO) channel design highly depends on cable assemblies to support PCIe connectivity. To enable scalable and flexible system architectures, advanced flat cable innovations have been proposed and developed. This study compares flat and round MCIO cables within a 3-connector HSIO topology, evaluating signal integrity, electrical margin, and functional performance. Flat cables offer greater flexibility for cable management but exhibit higher insertion loss and impedance mismatch with the motherboard, which can impact signal quality. In contrast, round cables demonstrate superior electrical margins and lower signal loss. Despite these differences, both cable types deliver comparable throughput when proper transmitter equalization (Tx EQ) settings are applied. These findings provide valuable guidance for selecting optimal cable types and tuning equalization strategies to ensure robust channel design in AI server platforms.

title: Access to Justice Through Artificial Intelligence: An Innovative Journey
authors: Geetanjali Chandra, Namrta, Amrita Singh
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Innovation is crucial for the development of all beings. The courts adopted innovation in China, the USA and the UK for Justice Delivery. One such innovation is the use of "Artificial Intelligence and robots in the Courtrooms". Innovation is crucial in all spheres of life from entertainment to customer services, health monitoring to justice delivery. India’s Court system has incorporated the concept of virtual court during COVID-19 to ensure that access to justice is not hampered. Now this has become a norm in cities like the National capital Delhi. AI can be a new hope in the coming future to aid and reduce the burden of listed cases handled by human judges and clear the backlog of cases, especially in countries like India, which is one of the largest democracies with the second highest population. This paper will cover the Human Rights aspects of AI uses and the AI and Robots used in the Court System in China, the USA and the UK, compared with the use of AI in the legal system of India keeping in mind the limitations including human emotions and privacy. The author's objective is to analyze the delivery of justice through AI and Robots, its regulation, impact and limitations. The author assumes that use of AI and Robots can ensure fast and more efficient delivery of justice.

title: Full Path PIPD Co-Simulation and Correlation with SDLE
authors: Heng Chuan Shu, Brian Shih, Alpha Su, Bhanuprakash Nayak, Kar Leong Lee, Chin Khai Loh, Chee Yang Goh
publish: 2025 20th International Microsystems, Packaging, Assembly and Circuits Technology Conference (IMPACT)
abstract: Stardust load emulator (SDLE) is AMD’s proprietary tool that is used to validate voltage regulator (VR) power delivery (PD) design on motherboards that are dedicated to AMD’s CPU. This paper proposed a new full system simulation methodology to incorporate three major segments of design into a single framework to evaluate system performance. The simulation and lab measurement data are highly correlated with less than 3% discrepancy.

title: AO-Rec: An Adaptive Attention-based Algorithm for Personalized Library Information Services
authors: Ji Kong
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: The rapid development of information technology and the advancement of digitalization are driving library services towards intelligent and personalized development. Traditional recommendation methods face problems such as cold start, interest drift, insufficient capture of high-order relationships, and data sparsity when faced with large-scale, diverse, and dynamically changing user needs. This study proposes a user preference model based on the novel Attention & Adaptive Optimization Recommendation (AAO-Rec). The AAO-Rec model first uses the multi-head self-attention mechanism (MHSA) to weight the user's historical behavior sequence. This key step can capture key points of interest. Secondly, a robust optimization strategy is introduced in the contrastive learning stage. This can alleviate the problems of insufficient negative samples and embedding distribution drift. Subsequently, a graph neural network (GNN) is used to model the high-order semantic relationships between resources to achieve the cross-graph information fusion and deep semantic representation. Finally, the recommendation strategy is dynamically adjusted through a reinforcement learning feedback mechanism. This paper conducted experimental verification on three datasets: Amazon-Books, Book-Crossing, and the self-built QFNU-Lib. The results showed that on the Amazon-Books dataset, AAO-Rec improved P@10 by 12.5% and NDCG@10 by 16.2% compared to the optimal baseline SGL. Then, on the highly sparse Book-Crossing dataset, P@10 improved by 28.1%. On the QFNU-Lib dataset, which is close to the actual library scene, P@10 improved by 21.1% and NDCG@10 improved by 23.3%, both of which were statistically significant (p < 0.01).

title: Design of Microwave Sensor Node for Water Quality Monitoring
authors: B Shweta, Bhavya Merugu, C L Sai Chetan, Parul Mathur
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: This paper presents the development of an innovative, cost-effective microwave sensor node designed for real-time water quality monitoring, leveraging the superior sensitivity and accuracy of microwave sensing technology. The node integrates a microwave coaxial probe sensor, a directional coupler, an ESP32 microcontroller, and a LoRa module for robust communication. By utilizing LoRa-based packet transmission and received signal strength indicator (RSSI)-based signal strength measurements, with the communication channel modeled as an attenuator, the system capitalizes on the microwave sensor’s ability to detect subtle changes in water properties with high precision. The node was calibrated to accurately and rigorously predict channel attenuation characteristics and thoroughly tested on various saline water samples, demonstrating stable short-range communication, reliable RSSI responses, and consistent signal behavior. These attributes highlight the microwave sensor’s advantages in delivering precise, non-invasive water quality analysis, making the system ideal for applications such as flood monitoring, leak detection, smart irrigation, and environmental sensing.

title: AttentionGAN Based Super-Resolution for Enhanced Diagnostic Accuracy in Magnetic Resonance Imaging
authors: Gaurav D. Tivari, Satvik V. Khara
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) plays a very crucial role in medical diagnosis by providing detailed images of soft tissues without any invasive procedures. Achieving high spatial resolution typically requires much longer scan times and more advanced hardware which can increase patient discomfort and image noise. Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) have shown very promise in enhancing low-resolution images by learning to predict fine structural details post-acquisition. Conventional GAN models may overlook subtle anatomical features that are vital for accurate diagnosis. AttentionGAN addresses this gap by integrating attention mechanisms that guide the network’s focus toward clinically important regions such as lesion boundaries and tissue interfaces resulting in sharper, more informative reconstructions. In this paper, we trace the evolution of GAN-based super-resolution methods from SRGAN and ESRGAN to attention-augmented variants and brief how self-attention, channel attention and spatial attention modules enhance performance on brain MRI dataset. I compared these approaches using standard metrics (PSNR, SSIM) with practical challenges including data scarcity, training stability and the need for rigorous clinical validation and highlight future directions such as lightweight attention models and multi-modal integration aimed at bringing high-resolution MRI into routine clinical practice.

title: An Intelligent Real-Time Drowsiness Detection System Using Computer Vision And Facial Landmark Analysis For Enhanced Road Safety
authors: Saraswati Patil, Suyash Bhavalkar, Yash Shinde, Shubham Soni, Vishwajit Virkar
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: While driver drowsiness stands as a major factor in the causation of road accidents all-round the globe, constituting around 20-25% of such fatal vehicular incidents occurring in the world, this work introduces DriveGuard-an intelligent real-time driver drowsiness detection system that is non-intrusive while employing computer vision techniques and facial behavior analysis for determining fatigue indicators in subjects. The system extracts facial landmarks using a highly complex algorithm and calculates important parameters such as the Eye Aspect Ratio (EAR) and Mouth Aspect Ratio (MAR) using the libraries OpenCV and Dlib. The values thus obtained are analyzed in-depth to recognize drowsiness features such as prolonged eye closure instances, irregular blinking patterns, and yawning behaviors. If these features surpass predetermined threshold limits set for specified time periods, DriveGuard comes into action, triggering loud auditory alerts aimed at refocusing attention on the road, thus preventing the occurrence of accidents. Running on standard computer platforms without the need for custom GPU hardware, the system ensures low-latency processing and smooth operation in energy efficiency, making it suitable for implementation in real-life vehicles. Prolonged experimentation in various lighting conditions results in very high accuracy with fast response time. Detection sensitivity can be adjusted at the threshold parameter level, allowing it to be fine-tuned according to each driver's unique behavioral traits and physiological characteristics. The DriveGuard-based approach is highly economical in enhancing vehicular safety, with future expansions likely to incorporate driver identity recognition, vehicle control, and large-scale implementation across all modes of transportation. This research practicalizes the use of AI-backed proactive safety systems in modern transport infrastructure.

title: Certain Investigation on Deep Learning Algorithms for Leukemia Classification
authors: Abinaya V N, Jagadish N, Thiruselvan M, Kamalraj Subramaniam
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Leukemia is a serious blood cancer that is characterized by unrestrained multiplication of atypical white blood cells, which requires rapid and accurate diagnostic strategies to improve patient survival rates. Traditional methods of leukemia type classification are slow and may contain human error. In this paper, we introduce a computerized system of classification for five leukemia classes dependent on microscopic blood smear images using deep learning methods. We use the MobileNet and EfficientNet-B0 architectures with modified layers, trained on a large, publicly sourced dataset uniformly distributed in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL), acute myeloid leukemia (AML), chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and hairy cell leukemia (H). Extensive image pre-processing and large data augmentation were carried out in order to make the models more robust and generalizable. On the test dataset, evaluation shows that MobileNet performed with an accuracy of 91.90%, precision of 91.61%, recall of 92.05%, and F1-score of 91.68%, whereas EfficientNet-B0 scored a slightly higher accuracy of 92.32% but comparatively lower precision of 81.07%, recall of 85.03%, and F1-score of 87.95%. These results point towards the capabilities of deep learning-based systems in automating clinical diagnostic processes, with MobileNet having more balanced performance and EfficientNet-B0 having marginally higher overall accuracy. Our findings indicate that these methods can help healthcare professionals by offering effective, accurate, and scalable solutions for the classification of leukemia subtypes.

title: Digitized Document Tracking System Using QR Code Technology and Graphic Draw (GD) Integration
authors: Jude Allan A. Urmeneta, Joleco C. Agullo, Paulo S. Caperiña, Jenny Rose A. Delos Santos, Zion James P. Gacoscosim
publish: 2025 Eight International Conference on Vocational Education and Electrical Engineering (ICVEE)
abstract: The Document Tracking System (DTS) for Eastern Visayas State University was developed to modernize and optimize the institution's document administration processes. Traditional manual approaches were slow, inefficient, and prone to errors, often causing delays, mismanagement, and difficulties in retrieving records. To address these challenges, the study designed and implemented a web-based system integrated with Quick Response (QR) code technology for secure tracking, categorization, and real-time monitoring of documents. The system architecture consists of a web application, built with HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, PHP, and MySQL, and a mobile application developed in Android Studio for QR code scanning and instant document status retrieval. Additionally, a General Data (GD) function was integrated to digitize physical documents, enhancing classification, storage, and accessibility. The system was evaluated using the ISO/IEC 9126 quality model, which showed high ratings in functionality, reliability, usability, efficiency, maintainability, and portability, with an overall mean of 4.53 (Strongly Agree). Results indicate that the DTS significantly improves workflow efficiency, document security, and sustainability, offering a scalable model for institutional digital transformation.

title: Multi-Omics Data Integration Using Machine Learning for Schizophrenia Risk Prediction
authors: Jananee J, F. Emerson Solomon
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The integrated omics approach to predicting the risk of schizophrenia is still challenging because looking at just one type of data (like genomic or transcriptomic) might miss important interactions between biological pathways. Existing methods frequently fail to integrate across the different available data, resulting in limited prediction accuracy and biological interpretability. To solve these problems, introduces proposed system that combines three types of biological data genomics, transcriptomics, and epigenomics using advanced machine learning techniques to improve predictions for schizophrenia risk. Most of the studies mentioned follow a process that involves careful preparation of data, choosing important features, combining data using an early fusion model, classifying it with Random Forest, SVM, and DNN models, and finally using SHAP for understanding the results. The results show that the proposed system has an accuracy of 88.3%, an F1-score of 87.5%, and an AUC of 0.92, outperforming the existing systems. It also significantly reduces misclassification rates while providing a scalable and interpreted technique for individualized schizophrenia risk estimation.

title: Retraction Notice: Assessing Academic Performance Using Ensemble Machine Learning Models
authors: Siva Balan R V, Senthilnathan T, Gobinath R, Raju Ramakrishna Gondkar
publish: 2023 International Conference on Circuit Power and Computing Technologies (ICCPCT)
abstract: Artificial Intelligence (AI) shall play a vital role in forecasting and predicting the academic performance of students. Societal factors such as family size, education and occupation of parents, and students' health, along with the details of their behavioral absenteeism are used as independent variables for the analysis. To perform this study, a standardized dataset is used with data instances of 1044 entries and a total of 33 unique variables constituting the feature matrix. Machine learning (ML) algorithms such as Support Vector Machine (SVM), Random Forest (RF), Multilayer Perceptron (MLP), LightGBM, and Ensemble Stacking (ES) are used to assess the specified dataset. Finally, an ES model is developed and used for assessment. Comparatively, the ES model outclassed other ML models with a test accuracy of 99.3%. Apart from accuracy, other parameters of metrics are used to evaluate the performance of the algorithms.

title: Design and Analysis of a Fully Automatic Elastic Hook Joint Device for Power Transmission Systems : Fully Automatic Elastic Hook Joint Device
authors: Mian Pei, Zhiping Zhang, Bo Mei, Jie Sheng, Yunfei Yang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: This paper presents the development and comprehensive analysis of a novel fully automatic elastic hook joint device designed for power transmission and cable connection applications. The device addresses critical limitations in traditional mechanical locking systems by incorporating intelligent monitoring, automated cleaning capabilities, and adaptive tension control.
