abstract: Sustainable construction approaches are essential for reducing the environmental effects of the construction sector, especially in the management of demolition debris. Demolition of waste is a substantial fraction of construction debris, which, if inadequately processed, is disposed of in landfills, exacerbating environmental degradation. Traditional manual classification techniques for waste sorting are arduous and ineffective. This research presents an innovative method for classifying demolition waste using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), capitalizing on their capacity to effectively identify and classify materials from images. Using CNNs in the waste classification process automates material sorting, resulting in increased resource recovery and greater recycling efficiency. Utilizing this deep learning model, the system can identify several classes of waste materials, including concrete, wood, metals, and plastics, based on visual attributes, substantially minimizing human involvement. Using CNNs enhances operational efficiency and facilitates sustainable practices in the construction sector by encouraging the reuse and recycling of resources. This research highlights the capability of CNNs to revolutionize demolition waste management, facilitating a circular economy, minimizing landfill use, and eventually aiding the worldwide shift towards more sustainable construction practices.

title: Beyond ETL: Architecting Resilient, Intelligent Data Workflows for Distributed AI Systems
authors: Aishwarya Rajkumar Shah, Gokul Narain Natarajan, Vijayalaxmi Methuku, Direesh Reddy Aunugu
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: The complication is that traditional Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines are becoming insufficient in the needs of the contemporary distributed AI systems which need real-time flexibility, fault tolerance, and scalable intelligence. I have provided in this paper a new architecture paradigm that goes beyond ETL, as an architecture that adds resiliency and intelligence to data workflows, tuned to the needs of heterogeneous, distributed systems. Our program is to design an orchestration framework to incorporate dynamic schema adaptation, decentralized data preprocessing and federated feature engineering to enable scalable and low-latency machine learning operations. The architecture uses event-driven microservices, policy-aware data governance and self-healing functionality to maintain continuity and compliance in highly volatile network environments. Prototyping tests in multi-cloud setup and edge computing clusters show a considerable data throughput, model training speed, and the recovery overhead over traditional ETL-based workflows. Our findings show that the way ETL is currently being thought of, is only working at unlocking the full potential of distributed AI ecosystems dual-incorporated with the rethinking of the ETL as an intelligent, and resilient workflow layer.

title: Protocol-Aware Continuous Monitoring and Anomaly Detection in Internet of Things Networks
authors: Jaison Jacob, Saptarshi Nag, Devanshi Gangrade, Harish R, Poonguzhali P
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Internet of Things and Intelligence Systems (IoTaIS)
abstract: The evolution of the Internet of Things (IoT) has increased its applications, but also introduced significant security challenges, such as unauthorised access, data breaches, device exploitation, etc. A major challenge in the security of IoT environments comes from the presence of multiple wireless protocols like Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, etc., each exhibiting different behaviours and vulnerabilities that lead to various security risks and attack surfaces. The diverse nature of these protocols not only complicates the detection of malicious activities but also increases the likelihood of multi-vector attacks targeting multiple layers of communication simultaneously. Existing intrusion detection and anomaly detection systems mostly focus on individual protocols, making real-time monitoring and threat detection complex and inefficient. To overcome these limitations, this work proposes a unified, protocol-aware continuous monitoring and anomaly detection framework. This approach uses protocol-specific insights along with machine learning (ML) models trained on both existing and custom datasets to accurately detect deviations from normal behaviour across diverse attack types in real time and also generate alerts to reduce the threats. This framework is designed to be modular and scalable, enabling integration of additional protocols in the future. It offers a dashboard for continuous monitoring of multi-protocol environments as well.

title: Optimizing Talent Retention: Comparative Analysis of ML Techniques for Employee Attrition Prediction
authors: Neha Chopade, Shilpa Mahalle, K. Vengatesan
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: A strong machine learning pipeline for business bankruptcy prediction utilizing high-dimensional financial data is shown in this paper. This pipeline uses UCI Machine Learning Repository and Kaggle's Taiwan Bankruptcy datasets for rigorous preprocessing, feature selection using Lasso and RFE, and predictive modelling using Logistic Regression (LR) and Random Forest. Comparisons employing confusion matrices, ROC curves, and k-fold cross-validation showed that RF had greater accuracy (89%) and cross-validation score (90.3%) than LR (85% and 85.7%, respectively), fewer misclassifications, and increased resilience Despite its greater overfitting indication, Random Forest had better generalizability and interpretability through feature significance analysis. The data demonstrate RF's capacity to predict early financial hardship. Future improvements include enhanced ensemble methods and explainable AI for forecast transparency and robustness.

title: Next-Gen Channel Estimation: Unifying RIS, Photonic Processing, and Metaheuristic Intelligence for 5G and Beyond
authors: Mohammad Shahnawaz Shaikh, Swati Sharma, Abhirup Sinha, Prithviraj Singh Chouhan, Ranjana Shaktawat, Divyeshkumar Jayantibhai Hariyani
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Advances in Computing Research On Science Engineering and Technology (ACROSET)
abstract: In wireless communication, a precise channel estimate is essential for beamforming, resource allocation, and signal equalization. Scalability problems arise in high-speed, high-dimensional 5G and developing 6G networks when using conventional methods like Least Squares (LS) and Minimum Mean Square Error (MMSE). Three interesting methods are examined in this review: metaheuristic algorithms, photonic parallel channel estimation (PPCE), and reconfigurable intelligent surfaces (RIS). RIS intelligently regulates the propagation environment to improve energy efficiency and signal quality. To overcome latency and throughput issues in large MIMO-OFDM configurations, PPCE makes use of the intrinsic parallelism of photonic systems. Without requiring prior statistical knowledge, metaheuristic algorithms—like the Whale Optimization Algorithm (WOA)—offer scalable, datadriven solutions. These technologies facilitate large-scale realtime operations, lower latency, and greatly increase spectral efficiency. In order to satisfy the requirements of nextgeneration wireless systems, the study compares and contrasts established and new approaches, emphasizing trade-offs in accuracy, complexity, and usefulness. It also suggests integrated future paths.

title: BERT-based Semantic Matching for Detecting Phishing URLs in Email Content
authors: SivaKumar Depuru, Kolukari Hamsaveni, Madinepalli Akhila, Kolli Durga Prasad, Lavuri Karthik
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Phishing attacks are still one of the widest web security threats, using rogue URLs and content in the email header to avoid the standard detection mechanisms. Conventional machine learning systems tend to be vulnerable to obfuscated or zero-day phishing attacks, and other deep learning techniques (like LSTM) learn the sequential structure that phish websites embed but are not robust to semantic variations. To overcome these issues, this research suggests a BERT-based semantic match framework to detect phishing URLs in email text. The model is able to jointly learn linguistic meaning and URL structural information by using contextual embeddings so as to identify highly sophisticated phishing attacks. The experimental analysis shows the proposed model reaching the 97 percent accuracy and 0.98 AUC, which performs much better than such models as Logistic Regression, Random Forest, and LSTM. The Confusion matrix and the Precision-Recall analysis validates low False Negatives and False Positives, which makes it practically dependable when implemented in real life email filtering frameworks. The results are promising in terms of transformer-based architectures as future options in making phishing detection proceed along accuracy, robustness, and reliability.

title: A Non-Invasive Dental Caries Detection using Hyperspectral Imaging: An Advanced Diagnostic Approach
authors: Koteswararao Mallaparapu, Shrivardhini Indla, Siddi Sathvik Kuruba, K Kiran Kumar, K A Sunitha
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Dental caries remains a significant global health concern, impacting millions worldwide and posing substantial risks to oral and overall health. Early detection of carious lesions is crucial for timely intervention and prevention of further damage. The main objective of this study was to explore the application of hyperspectral imaging (HSI) for the accurate detection of dental caries. Spectral data were collected from physical tooth samples using Specim IQ hyperspectral camera, with a total of 12 readings taken for analysis. Spectral signatures of healthy and carious tissues exhibited significant reflectance variations at a wavelength range of 400nm – 1000nm. Hyper-spectral unmixing was performed to generate abundance maps, enabling the visualization of the spatial distribution of decayed and healthy regions. The findings demonstrate that hyperspectral imaging can effectively distinguish between tissue types, offering a non-invasive and high-resolution tool for caries detection. The study highlights the importance of spectral analysis in improving diagnostic accuracy and suggests that HSI has the potential to revolutionize dental caries diagnosis. These results underscore the need for further research into integrating hyperspectral imaging into clinical workflows to enhance patient outcomes.

title: Strategic Initiative with VIPPO Technology for High-Density DDR Configuration in Next-Generation 19-inch Rack Design
authors: Ann Yen, Ryan Chang, Thonas Su
publish: 2025 20th International Microsystems, Packaging, Assembly and Circuits Technology Conference (IMPACT)
abstract: As high-speed signals evolve, PCI Express (PCIe) and MRDIMM (Multiplexed Rank Dual In-line Memory Module, also known as MCRDIMM) memory transiting from 5.0 to 6.0 and Gen.1 to Gen.2, respectively, the channel's signal integrity becomes more important than before, leading to an increase in the number of package pins to provide an adequate SNR (Signal-to-Noise ratio). This change has rendered the traditional 2 sockets (2S) monoplanar design with 16 DDR5 (Fifth-generation Double Data Rate Synchronous Dynamic Random-access Memory) channels configuration incompatible with installation in a standard 19-inch rack, posing a significant challenge for integration into existing infrastructure. To address this issue, Intel has embarked on a strategic initiative aimed at accommodating a 19-inch rack with 16 DDR memory channels in next server platform to align with customer demands.

title: Energy Efficiency Optimization through Identification and Improvement of Compressed Air Leaks in Production Machine
authors: Rizal Justian Setiawan, Khakam Ma'ruf, Nagib Ismail Ahmed, Darmono, Mubarik Abdikadir, Keisa Abdi Mohamed
publish: 2025 International Conference on Smart-Green Technology in Electrical and Information Systems (ICSGTEIS)
abstract: The compressor is widely used in manufacturing to provide an air supply to production machine, including CNC machine. However, in some cases, the air supply from the compressor is not supplied efficiently due to air leakage in standby mode. This issue can significantly waste energy and increase operating costs in regions with high electricity prices, such as Somaliland. A solution to eliminate energy leakage is needed. This research aims to solve this issue by implementing an integrated system that reduces energy waste caused by compressed air leakage during standby mode. This paper is based on the TRIZ approach with a pilot applied experimental methods in case study at a company in Somaliland. The result led to the successful implementation and testing of a control system that integrated the operations of the compressor machine and CNC machine. Compared to the conventional ball valve components, the new system replaced it with an automatic air control valve integrated with the CNC machine emergency button. Electricity consumption on the compressor machine was observed and calculated for six months before improvement and six months after implementing the improvements. The data collected for six months showed a significant decrease in electricity consumption, from <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$5,491 \text{kWh}$</tex> to <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$4,915 \text{kWh}$</tex> indicating <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{1 0. 4 9 \%}$</tex> energy saving.

title: Contrasting EEG Signatures of Unilateral Motor Imagery Versus Execution: A Spectral and Spatial Feature Analysis
authors: Zheng Dong, Yabing Yang, Xueliang Bao, Jiao Wu
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Biomedical Signal and Image Processing (ICBIP)
abstract: Motor Imagery Brain-Computer Interface (MI-BCI) technology shows significant potential for unilateral stroke rehabilitation. However, its clinical application is limited by a research focus on bilateral limbs and an insufficient understanding of the neurophysiological differences between unilateral motor imagery (MI) and motor execution (ME). This study aims to reveal these detailed differences at the electroencephalography (EEG) signal level. Our analysis using Event-Related Spectral Perturbation (ERSP) and Power Spectral Density (PSD) found that compared to MI, ME induces earlier, stronger Event-Related Desynchronization (ERD) and more complex Event-Related Synchronization (ERS) components, such as low-frequency ERS and beta rebound. The two can also exhibit opposite power spectral patterns in the beta band for specific tasks. Furthermore, an explainable EEGNet analysis identified distinct spatial features, revealing differences in the brain regions that best distinguish ME from MI. These findings clarify the significant neural and spatial differences between unilateral MI and ME, providing a crucial neurophysiological basis for developing more precise MI-BCI systems.

title: Research on Lightning Current Diversion Characteristics of 220 kV Transmission Line Towers Considering Multi-Factor Coupling
authors: Jianwei Zhong, Fengjing Jiang, Siqin Xu, Bin Yu, Zhongyue Chen, Biao Peng, Jing Liu, Zhenyu Li
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Mechatronics Technology (ICEEMT)
abstract: Lightning strikes constitute the primary natural factor threatening the safe operation of transmission lines, with the increasing scale of power grids exacerbating the prominence of lightning-induced tripping incidents. Currently, research on the multi-path current distribution characteristics of lightning strikes on 220 kV transmission line towers remains insufficient, particularly lacking systematic analysis regarding the combined effects of soil stratification, frequency-dependent characteristics of grounding devices, and electromagnetic coupling. This study establishes a refined simulation model incorporating multi-factor coupling based on CDEGS software to quantitatively analyze the current distribution characteristics during lightning strikes on $\mathbf{2 2 0 k V}$ transmission lines and investigate methods for enhancing lightning withstand levels. The research findings indicate: (1) The tower current distribution coefficient exhibits a non-linear decreasing trend with increasing soil resistivity, decreasing by approximately 26% when soil resistivity increases from $10 \Omega \cdot \mathrm{~m}$ to $3000 \Omega \cdot \mathrm{~m}$; (2) The magnitude of lightning current has minimal impact on current dispersion, with identical distribution coefficients observed across different lightning current amplitudes; (3) The lightning withstand level of transmission lines during tower strikes is significantly influenced by soil resistivity, decreasing by approximately 33.93% when soil resistivity increases from $10 \Omega \cdot \mathrm{~m}$ to $3000 \Omega \cdot \mathrm{~m}$, while the impact of lightning current on withstand levels remains relatively minor. These results provide a theoretical foundation for improving lightning withstand levels and implementing differentiated lightning protection designs in high soil resistivity regions.

title: A Comparative Study on Lung Cancer Detection and Classification using Deep Learning Methods
authors: Rajendran Sivakumar
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Lung cancer remains one of the leading causes of cancer-related mortality worldwide, with early and accurate detection being a critical factor in improving patient outcomes. Recent advancements in deep learning (DL) have transformed the landscape of medical image analysis, offering powerful tools for automated lung cancer detection and classification. This comparative study reviews and evaluates various DL techniques, including VGG19, ResNet50 and Xception, across multiple publicly available datasets and clinical case studies. The study assesses model performance based on accuracy, sensitivity, specificity, area under the ROC curve, and robustness to real-world imaging variabilities. Furthermore, preprocessing techniques such as region-of-interest extraction and class imbalance handling are explored for their impact on model effectiveness. The comparative analysis highlights the strengths and limitations of individual approaches, emphasizing the critical role of DL in facilitating rapid, precise lung cancer screening. The findings underscore DL’s potential to support clinicians in accurate diagnosis, risk stratification, and treatment planning, while also identifying areas for future research, including model interpretability, integration of multi-modal data, and validation in diverse clinical settings.

title: Vision based Hand Gesture and Character Identification using Convolution Neural Network
authors: Kural Neri Selvan M, Kirubakar Gupta, Mohanasundaram. T, Annalakshmi Ganesan
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Hand gesture recognition is the interpretation of computer machine with human hand gesture for physically challenged people. This paper proposes a CNN based model for recognizing hand sign language and characters. The image quality is improved by applying the image enhancement technique. This CNN model automatically extracts the discriminative input feature value to produce more accuracy than the traditional model. Fully connected layers are used at the end of the network to perform classification, mapping the learned features to specific ASL character labels. This structured approach ensures the model captures complex patterns within the image data, thereby improving classification performance. To further enhance the accuracy and generalizability of the model, several data augmentation techniques were employed. These techniques include random rotations, flipping, zooming, and shifting of input images. Introducing such variations in the training data, the model becomes more robust to slight differences in image orientation, size, and perspective, reducing the likelihood of overfitting. The proposed technique achieves the classification accuracy of 99.02 percentage on the MNIST dataset.

title: EMDF-YOLO: An Enhanced Multimodal Feature and Cross-Modal Differential Fusion Network for Object Detection in Remote Sensing Images
authors: Jin Peng
publish: 2025 10th International Seminar on Computer Technology, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (ISCME)
abstract: The complementary advantages of visible light and infrared radiation modalities make them highly effective for UAV-based remote sensing target detection. Visible light provides rich texture details but is sensitive to lighting changes, while infrared is robust to lighting variations but lacks fine-grained information. To leverage this multimodal synergy and enhance performance in complex environments, this study proposes an enhanced multimodal feature and cross-modal differential fusion method based on the lightweight and efficient YOLO11 network, termed EMDF-YOLO. The network integrates a new three-branch channel attention (TCA) mechanism, combining global and local information to highlight key targets. Additionally, a Difference Feature Fusion (DFF) module is introduced to better integrate multimodal data, optimized using the MPDIoU loss function to improve accuracy. Experiments on two publicly available multimodal remote sensing datasets, VEDAI and LLVIP, demonstrate the effectiveness of EMDF-YOLO. Compared to YOLO11, our method achieves mean average precision improvements of 5.2% and 1.2%, respectively, with only a slight increase in the number of parameters.

title:
A Novel Quasi-Z-source Coupled-Inductor High-Gain DC/DC Converter
                    <sup>*</sup>
authors: Xiufan Pei, Xuanjin Sun, Wenguang Tang
publish: 2025 10th International Seminar on Computer Technology, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (ISCME)
abstract: Under the background of photovoltaic power generation and wind power generation are widely used, in order to obtain stable output voltage, it is necessary to improve the traditional DC / DC converter to solve the problems of low gain, high voltage stress of switch tube and diode. In this paper, the quasi-Z-source network is combined with the voltage doubling unit to further improve the voltage level through the coupled inductor while saving the circuit volume, achieving efficient energy utilization and solving the problems of existing converters. This paper first explains the deduction of the topology, then analyzes the working principle and process in detail, calculates the voltage stress of the main devices and the voltage gain realized by the topology, and verifies its feasibility by comparing with the same type of converter. Finally, the correctness of the theoretical analysis is verified by building a prototype for experiments.

title: A Hybrid LSTM–STGNN Framework for Reliable Earthquake Magnitude Prediction
authors: A. Rajasekaran, J. Jasmine Gabriel, Doneeswaran J, K. Raju, R. Raja, Priya M
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Innovative Data Communication Technologies and Application (ICIDCA)
abstract: Earthquake forecasting remains one of the most challenging problems in geophysical science, with magnitude prediction being critical for mitigating disaster impact. The paper proposes a hybrid deep learning framework that integrates a Dual-Stage Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) network, a Spatio-Temporal Graph Neural Network (STGNN), and an ensemble learning strategy. The Dual-Stage LSTM is employed to capture both short- and long-term temporal dependencies in seismic sequences, while the STGNN models spatial correlations among earthquake events across regions. An ensemble fusion mechanism combines their outputs to enhance prediction accuracy, robustness, and reliability. The framework is trained on earthquake records from 1995 to 2023, incorporating geospatial coordinates, depth, and temporal patterns. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method outperforms standalone LSTM, GNN, and traditional statistical baselines, achieving lower prediction error and improved resilience to noisy or incomplete data. These findings highlight the effectiveness of combining sequential and graph-based learning for reliable and actionable earthquake magnitude forecasting.

title: Teaching Machine Translation Post-editing in the Context of Language Service Industry
authors: Yanqi Lu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Digital Media Technology and Social Computing (ICAIDS)
abstract: Machine translation and post-editing (MTPE) in the language service industry is widely recognized with the development of machine translation (MT) technology and the increase in global translation demand. Nowadays the workflow of using machine-translated text as the original translation and post-editing (PE) by translators tends to be common, which naturally stimulates people's interest in how translators and post-editors should be trained. As an institution of talent cultivation, colleges are obliged to cultivate talents suitable for the development needs of the society, and provide the society with high-level, application-oriented and specialized translation talents, so as to promote the further development and upgrading of the industry. Therefore, this paper discusses the teaching mode of MTPE as a college course against the background of the development of language service industry. By analyzing the practical experience of PE teaching in colleges at home and abroad, and combining with the teaching case of Shanghai Sanda University, this paper constructs a systematic teaching system of MTPE. The system covers the whole process from the teaching of theory to practical skills, with special emphasis on the importance of project-based teaching method.

title: When Should We Meet? Automating Team Formation for Synchronous Projects in Online Education
authors: Yeray Barrios-Fleitas, Eduardo Lalla-Ruiz
publish: 2025 IEEE Digital Education and MOOCS Conference (DEMOcon)
abstract: Organizing synchronous teamwork in self-paced MOOCs is complicated because students join and progress at different times. Typical methods like random assignment or student-selected teams from, for example, discussion forums can result in teams with limited availability to meet or significant differences in prior knowledge. In this work, we introduce an optimization-based approach for automatically creating effective project teams. Our approach prioritizes: (i) maximizing common availability (hours per day all team members are available to meet) and (ii) minimizing differences in course progress. Each student specifies their time availability per day; their progress is directly measured from platform activity logs in the MOOC as course progress. We formalize this as the Online Team Formation Problem (OTFP) formulated as mixed-integer linear programming problem and solve it using a multi-start heuristic approach to solve realistic scenarios. The algorithm ensures that each team has at least a given number of shared hours per day while minimizing the team members’ progress difference.

title: Novel Two-Stage GNN Approach For VLSI Floorplanning With ISPD-Inflated Data
authors: Harshada Hemant Vaidya, Vaidehi Deshmukh
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Physical design Floorplanning is a critical phase in VLSI, where joint optimization of design objectives such as Half-Perimeter Wirelength (HPWL), aspect ratio, displacement, and overflow is taken care of. This paper presents optimization of a critical phase of physical design of VLSI floorplanning, using key metrices such as Loss, Half-Perimeter Wire Length (HPWL), Aspect ratio, Displacement and Overflow using Two - stage Graph Neural Network (GNN) Model. In this approach the model learns placement trends directly by analyzing ISPD 2005 Aptec1 Inflated benchmark dataset. The results from Stage 1 and Stage 2 are evaluated to highlight the performance and convergence of the algorithm. The discussion on current limitations such as congestion handling and outline future integration paths with legalization and detailed placement tools is also mentioned.

title: Automated Thyroid Dysfunction Screening from Voice Using CNN-LSTM Deep Learning Models
authors: Balivada Deepak, Bhumika Karsh, Ram Kumar Karsh, Madhumita Banerjee
publish: 2025 5th Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
abstract: Thyroid disorders affect millions worldwide but often go undiagnosed because their symptoms like fatigue, mood changes, and weight fluctuations are subtle and easily mistaken for stress or aging, delaying treatment and worsening outcomes. Conventional diagnostics depend on blood tests and clinical visits, creating barriers in resource-limited areas. To address this, we propose a simple, non-invasive screening method using voice analysis, motivated by evidence that thyroid dysfunction alters vocal characteristics. Our automated system leverages a hybrid deep learning framework combining Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks applied to Mel-frequency cepstral coefficients (MFCCs) extracted from voice recordings. The CNN layers capture distinctive spatial patterns in spectrograms, while the LSTM layers model temporal speech dynamics, enabling robust analysis of voice biomarkers. Trained and validated on a curated dataset of healthy and hypothyroid voice samples, the system achieved over 90 % classification accuracy, with interpretability enhanced through MFCC heatmaps and statistical visualizations highlighting feature differences. This lightweight, scalable solution requires only a short smartphone voice recording, making it ideal for telemedicine and deployment in underserved communities. By offering accessible, early screening without invasive tests or specialist visits, our approach holds promise to improve timely diagnosis and global health outcomes through more equitable and proactive thyroid care.

title: Synthesis of 3D Ultra-Wideband Structure for 45° Linear Polarization Rotation
authors: Jiwei Shen, Bo Li, Wanping Zhang, Lei Zhu
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper presents a synthesis technique for ultrawideband three-dimensional (3D) polarization-rotating structure (PRS). Initially, a circuit model is derived based on the power division principle, with its frequency responses synthesized using Chebyshev functions. By defining performance parameters including rotation angle (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\varphi$</tex>), filter order, fractional bandwidth (FBW), and return loss (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$R L$</tex>), all circuit parameters are synthesized from filter response specifications. Subsequently, a fourth-order wideband 3D PRS featuring 45° oblique polarization, 120% FBW, and 10 dB RL is implemented through a slotline-slotline structure. The close agreement between theoretical and simulated results validates the proposed method's efficacy for wideband arbitrary-polarization PRS design.

title: A Fast Roll-Off Low-Pass Energy Selective Surface
authors: Yongqi Zhang, Yi Du, Weiliang Yu, Guo Qing Luo
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper proposes a low-pass energy selective surface (ESS) with rapid roll-off characteristics. A hybrid 2-D/3D ESS structure was combined to provide high-power electromagnetic (EM) protection for sub- 3 GHz electronic devices and antenna systems. This structure synergistically combines the narrow transition band inherent to 3-D geometries with the broadband shielding capabilities of 2-D configurations. Under low power, the proposed ESS achieves a 3-dB passband below 2.99 GHz and a shape factor (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$K=B W-10 ~\text{dB} / \text{BW}-3 ~\text{dB}$</tex>) of 1.217. Under high power, it achieves a 10-dB protection band below 8.53 GHz. An equivalent circuit model (ECM) is established, and the circuit simulations and full-wave simulations have good agreement, demonstrating the formation mechanisms of the transmission poles and zeros. The proposed hybrid 2-D/3-D ESS has superior selectivity and wideband stopband suppression, establishing a novel design paradigm for energy selective surfaces.

title: A Broadband Ku/Ka-Band Shared-Aperture Antenna Array with High Isolation and Wide-Angle Scanning Capability
authors: Yi-Lin Lang, Mei Li, Runjun Xiao, Ming-Chun Tang
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper presents a compact dual-band dual-polarized shared-aperture antenna array for <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\text{Ku} / \text{Ka}$</tex>-band millimeter-wave phased array applications. The proposed design integrates Ku - and Ka-band elements within a unified aperture to reduce system size and support wide-angle scanning. The Ku-band antenna uses a cross-shaped patch with orthogonal slot coupling to achieve wideband dual polarization. The Ka-band element is a probe-fed magneto-electric dipole, enhanced with parasitic patches for better impedance matching and radiation patterns. The Ka-band structure also serves as a parasitic load to the Ku-band, improving bandwidth and reducing resonance frequency. An <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$8 \times 8$</tex> shared-aperture array prototype is fabricated and tested. Measurements show Ku-band -10 dB impedance bandwidths of 20% and 18.7% for horizontal and vertical polarizations, and over 22.2% in the Ka-band. Good isolation confirms the array's ability to support <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\pm 60^{\circ}$</tex> wide-angle scanning. This design offers a compact, high-performance solution for integrated millimeter-wave systems.

title: Graphene Metasurfaces Guiding Terahertz Waves
authors: Tiancheng Zhang, Faqian Chong, Hongsheng Chen, Song Han
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: In this paper, we investigate a reflective graphenebased metasurface to control terahertz (THz) waves for applications in imaging and beam steering. By varying the width of a one-dimensional graphene grating, we achieve two key functionalities relying on its resonant phase control: the formation of a terahertz metalens and the deflection of the beam. The ability to precisely control the reflection phase through structural design enables efficient manipulation of THz waves, making graphene metasurfaces an effective tool for advanced terahertz applications. Finite element simulations show the potential of these metasurfaces in achieving high reflectance and near <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{2} \boldsymbol{\pi}$</tex> phase coverage, offering a new pathway for THz wave manipulation.

title: Wideband Dual Circularly Polarized Multi-Beam Antenna Array for 5G/6G Applications
authors: Yikai Liu, Kuikui Fan, Qingquan Tan, Guo Qing Luo
publish: 2025 18th IEEE United Conference on Millimeter Waves and Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT)
abstract: This paper proposes a wideband dual circularly polarized (CP) multi-beam antenna array, which consist of a <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathrm{1} \times \mathrm{6}$</tex> dual linearly polarized (LP) antenna array with a 3D-printed dielectric polarizer lens. The dual LP antenna is fed by folded substrate-integrated waveguide (FSIW) resonant cavities, which realize multi-mode resonance through etched slots and metallic vias. Based on this scheme, the antenna achieves an operational bandwidth of 14.8% (25.8 - 29.9 Ghz) and an port-to-port isolation level exceeding 35 dB. The dielectric polarizer lens uses spindle-shaped unit cells following the permittivity distribution profile of a Luneberg lens, ensuring the conversion of linearly polarized (LP) beams to circularly polarized (CP) beams. To maintain the axial ratio below 3 dB during wide-angle beam scanning, the polarizer incorporates a phase compensation structure. The proposed dual CP multi-beam antenna realizes a maximum gain of 22.4 dBic and a beam scanning coverage of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\pm 45^{\circ}$</tex>, showing great potential for applications in 5G / 6G systems.

title: An Explainable AI Approach for Pinkeye Detection Using LIME for Enhanced Diagnostic Transparency
authors: Sabo Anas Gidado, Hongyu Zhao
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Biomedical Signal and Image Processing (ICBIP)
abstract: Infectious Bovine Keratoconjunctivitis (IBK), commonly known as pinkeye, is extremely contagious retinal disease that impacts cattle worldwide, coursing significant economic losses in the livestock industry. Early detection and precise classification of pinkeye are vital for efficient disease control and treatment. In this work, we propose a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)-based model for AI pinkeye detection in cattle using image classification frameworks. The dataset, obtained from Roboflow Universe, includes annotated images differentiating between infected and healthy eyes. To augment interpretability, we incorporate Local Interpretable Modelagnostic Explanations (LIME) to offer visual explanations for the model's predictions. The model was trained using TensorFlow, with data processing steps including image resizing, normalization, and data augmentation to enhance generalization. Effective evaluation metrics, including loss, accuracy, precision, and Area Under the Curve (AUC), exhibited the model's Performance in detecting pinkeye. The outcome highlights the ability of AI-driven analytical tools in veterinary medicine, offering an authentic and interpretable framework for early disease detection.

title: Electromagnetic Characteristics of Polyesterbamboo Sheet Reinforced With Graphene Oxide Composite Material at Microwave Frequency
authors: Huda A Majid, Fahmiruddin Esa, Herdawatie Abdul Kadir, Muhammad Azfar Abdullah, Osman Ayop, Mohd Nazrul Roslan
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: This study investigates the electromagnetic (EM) performance of polyester/bamboo fiber composite sheet reinforced with <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$1 \text{wt} \%$</tex> of graphene oxide (GO) in single-layer and multi-layer forms. Using the waveguide method with a WR90 waveguide operating in the X-band frequency range (8 9 GHz), the reflection (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{S}_{11}$</tex>), transmission (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{S}_{21}$</tex>), and absorbance characteristics of the composites were evaluated. The results reveal that the multi-layer GO composite exhibits higher reflection and significantly lower transmission compared to the single-layer GO composite. Absorbance calculations based on the measured S-parameters show that the multi-layer GO composite achieves better absorption across the frequency range. These findings highlight the potential of multi-layer GOreinforced natural fiber composites as efficient microwave absorbers or EMI shielding materials at microwave frequency range.

title: Insulator Defect Detection Based on Improved YOLOv8n
authors: Yihui Zhou, Yanfei Chen, Tong Yue
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Information Technology (AICIT)
abstract: To address the issues of high computational complexity, limited detection types, and low detection accuracy inherent in existing insulator defect detection methods within the power industry, in this paper, a novel model for insulator defect detection is proposed. Based on the YOLOv8 model as the foundational architecture, for the neck network, we employ the Scale Sequence Fusion YOLO (ASF-YOLO) structure for optimization, thereby augmenting the model's anti-interference capability and feature extraction capacity. We replace the conventional convolutions in the C2f module with the Dynamic convolution (DynamicConv) module to accelerate the model's detection speed. Additionally, a small object detection head is appended to the detection head section to further strengthen the model's ability to detect small targets. The experimental outcomes clearly illustrate that our enhanced algorithm attains outstanding performance, with mean Average Precision (mAP) scores of 84% and 62.8% for mAP@0.5 and mAP@0.5-0.95, respectively, across various types of insulator defects. Moreover, the parameter count of the model is reduced by 17.3%, showcasing its efficiency and effectiveness in insulator defect detection tasks.

title: A Comparative Evaluation of Fall Detection Algorithms Based on a Unified Benchmarking Framework
authors: Zihan Wang, Jingchao Wu, Yuan Du, Li Du
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Biomedical Signal and Image Processing (ICBIP)
abstract: The global population aging has made falls a leading cause of accidental mortality among the elderly, underscoring the urgency to develop effective fall detection systems (FDS) and performance evaluation frameworks. Given the heterogeneity in hardware configurations, data modalities, and algorithmic implementations across existing systems, establishing fair benchmarking standards is critical for guiding algorithm optimization and scenario-specific deployment. This study systematically investigates the hardware-algorithm coupling characteristics inherent in elderly fall detection systems and their impact on performance evaluation. We conducted a cross-dataset comparative assessment of three representative algorithms under normalized conditions: threshold-based methods (TH), support vector machines (SVM), and convolutional neural networks (CNN). Experimental results demonstrate that CNN achieves superior comprehensive performance (<tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$>99.5 \%$</tex> accuracy), followed by SVM, while traditional threshold methods underperform. Our work transcends the limitations of conventional evaluation paradigms, providing empirical support and methodological references for future FDS development. Additionally, the ENSet and ENSet-CNN datasets constructed in this study, which feature normalized sensor data and labeling protocols, offer benchmark resources for cross-dataset algorithm development and generalizability testing.

title: Adversarial End-to-End Learning Encryption over Fading Channels for Secure Wireless Communication
authors: Zhraa Zuheir Yahya, Dia M. Ali
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: This paper proposes an adversarial deep learning framework for secure communication over noisy wireless channels. Unlike traditional methods that rely on fixed modulation schemes or cryptographic algorithms, the proposed model trains a transmitter-receiver pair jointly with an adversarial eavesdropper. The transmitter is optimized not only to enable reliable decoding by the legitimate receiver but also to confuse the eavesdropper, even under varying channel conditions such as AWGN and Rayleigh fading. Through alternating training, the transmitter learns robust and adaptive signal representations that exploit the non-cooperation of the eavesdropper. Simulation results demonstrate that the legitimate receiver achieves high accuracy (over 78%) and low Bit Error Rate (BER), while the eavesdropper performance remains near random, with approximately 0.5 across a wide SNR range. Compared to existing works, this work offers enhanced physical layer security without requiring prior knowledge of the eavesdropper channel. The proposed system highlights the potential of adversarial learning as a powerful tool for developing intelligent, secure, and resilient wireless communication architecture.

title: DEMSAG-Net: Medical Image Segmentation Based on Dual-Encoder Multi-Scale Attention-Guided Network
authors: Zhengyi Tian, Jing Gao, Shiwei Lv, Xinyue An, Yuxiao Zhang
publish: 2025 10th International Conference on Biomedical Signal and Image Processing (ICBIP)
abstract: Accurate segmentation of lesion areas in dermoscopic images is crucial for early diagnosis and treatment planning of skin diseases. With the rapid development of deep learning in the field of medical image segmentation, existing segmentation methods still face many challenges. This paper proposes a new neural network model, Dual-Encoder Multi-Scale Attention-Guided Network (DEMSAG-Net). In order to enable the network to fully capture the structural characteristics of skin lesions, we introduce an additional encoder branch into the network. By introducing the gated attention mechanism, the limitation of traditional convolution in distinguishing background noise in dermoscopic images is overcome, so that the model can more effectively enhance key features and suppress interference information. Combining multi-head attention and mask attention mechanisms helps the model focus on uncertain areas such as lesion edges and more accurately model long-range contextual dependencies, thereby reducing mis-segmentation. By decomposing the large kernel convolution into multi-branch small kernel convolution, the model significantly improves the segmentation accuracy of skin lesions while maintaining a low number of parameters. Extensive experiments were conducted on two public datasets, ISIC-2017 and ISIC-2018, and the results show that our method can accurately segment the target area and outperform other networks in accuracy.

title: A Bibliometric Analysis of Artificial Intelligence Applications in Higher Education Technology
authors: Samuel-Soma M. Ajibade, Rex V. Culpable, Efrahrim C. Caballero, Mersin C. Villagonzalo, Celestino A. Quirante, Arvie L. Dacillo, Johnry P. Dayupay, Muhammed Basheer Jasser, Anthonia Oluwatosin Adediran, Kayode A. Akintoye
publish: 2025 IEEE 15th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology (ICSET)
abstract: This study analyzes Scopus-indexed publications and documents from 2000 to 2023 on AI-HETT. We investigated publishing trends, identified key articles, and analyzed the most active AI-HETT research participants and funding institutions. A bibliometric analysis of coauthorships, keywords, and citations was done in artificial intelligence and higher education research. Scopus yielded 2,736 AI-HET publications. Trend study showed a <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{4 2, 4 5 0 \%}$</tex> increase in publications from 2000 to 2023. Most publications are conference papers, 1,430. The Computer Science Lecture Notes, Subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Bioinformatics, with 116 papers, are the main source. Salas Rueda is the leading higher education AI researcher with nine papers. The National Science Foundation, the largest US funding agency, has contributed to 42 publications and is responsible for creating the nation's active interest in the subject. A keyword co-occurrence analysis highlighted six main study domains with the important tools, concepts, methodologies, and socioeconomic and financial elements of AI in higher education. Artificial intelligence research in higher education will focus on deep learning, machine learning, and neural network methods. The study aims to accurately predict student learning habits.

title: A Survey on Swarm Intelligence Algorithms Employed for Optimizing Cloud Computing Solutions in Smart Cities
authors: Ives Tan Kian Hang, Muhammed Basheer Jasser, Samuel-Soma M. Ajibade, Hui Na Chua, Ahmad Sahban Rafsanjani
publish: 2025 IEEE 15th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology (ICSET)
abstract: This article provides a review of swarm intelligence (SI) techniques used in the optimization of cloud computing applications in smart cities addressing studies published from 2020 to 2025. SI, which is driven by the collective and emergent behaviors found in natural systems, such as swarming birds or ants, has been used extensively to develop optimization solutions for complex problems. The range of SI applications reviewed in the different smart city domains included urban infrastructure and services, health care, e-commerce and web services, data centers, and big data analytics. The review findings demonstrated that SI is essential in the development of intelligent, sustainable, and resilient cloud computing solutions in smart cities by enhancing scalability, solution quality, and decision-making. Classical algorithms, such as particle swarm optimization (PSO) and ant colony optimization (ACO), seem promising but face limitations with effectiveness, solution quality, and scalability in real-time situations. Hence, hybrid swarm intelligence strategies have evolved to overcome these limitations. Among the SI algorithms and methods reviewed in this article, PSO remains the most common swarm intelligence algorithm used today. Also, it has been found that hybrid SI models achieve superior robustness, scalability, and effectiveness compared to classical methods, with the cost of increased computational complexity.

title: AI Driven Support System for Neurologists in Diagnosing Anxiety Disorders in Neurologically Affected Patients
authors: H. K. Buddhima Kaushalya, K.A.D.T Kulawansa, Luckshika Amarakoon
publish: 2025 IEEE 15th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology (ICSET)
abstract: This research presents a multimodal AI-driven supportive system designed to assist neurologists in diagnosing anxiety disorders in neurologically affected patients. The proposed system integrates audio features, facial action units, and textual transcripts from clinical interviews to detect and classify three primary anxiety disorders: generalized anxiety disorder, social anxiety, and panic disorder. The methodology combines unsupervised clustering to identify distinct anxiety disorders with supervised ensemble classification for accurate prediction of different anxiety disorders. Feature-level analysis and explainable AI techniques provide insights into the key factors influencing each disorders supporting neurologists in clinical decision-making. Evaluated on the DAIC-WOZ dataset, the system demonstrates high accuracy and robustness, enabling early identification of this important comorbidity for proper referral and monitor progress.

title: CFDL-Based Model-Free Adaptive Control for Nonlinear Discrete-Time MIMO Two-Tank Systems
authors: Nasim Haghi, Mina Salim, Amir Rikhtegar Ghiyasi, Amir A. Ghavifekr
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Control, Instrumentation and Automation (ICCIA)
abstract: Model-Free Adaptive Control (MFAC) is a data-driven control method that does not require a mathematical model or knowledge of the system's order. With minimal assumptions about the input-output behavior of system, it can effectively control unknown nonlinear discrete-time systems. The basic idea behind MFAC design is to build an equivalent dynamic linearization data model of the nonlinear system. Then, the Jacobian Matrix (PJM) of the MIMO system is estimated online using input-output data from the controlled system. In conclusion, the controller design is based on appropriate cost function. The analysis focuses on a nonlinear MIMO two-tank system. To control the system, both compact form dynamic linearization (CFDL), MFAC and a model-based PID controller are used, with the goal of comparing their performance. The results demonstrate that MFAC outperforms PID control both in the presence and absence of disturbances, despite lacking access to the system model.

title: Book Recommendation System Using Hybrid-Based Filtering Model
authors: I Made Suwija Putra, Mananda Davar Sinaga, Wayan Oger Vihikan
publish: 2025 8th International Conference of Computer and Informatics Engineering (IC2IE)
abstract: The rapid growth of digital information presents a significant challenge for readers in discovering books that align with their interests. While the volume of published books increases annually, this does not guarantee a corresponding rise in reading interest, highlighting the need for effective discovery tools. This paper proposes a hybrid, web-based book recommendation system that integrates two powerful deep learning techniques: Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT) for content-based filtering and Neural Collaborative Filtering (NCF) for modelling user-item interactions. BERT is utilized to generate rich, contextual embeddings from book titles and descriptions, enabling accurate semantic similarity analysis. NCF is employed to capture the complex, non-linear relationships in user preference data. By combining these two approaches, our system generates candidates via NCF and re-ranks them using BERT's content understanding, aiming to provide recommendations that are not only personalized but also diverse and semantically relevant. The evaluation demonstrates that this hybrid approach significantly outperforms a standalone NCF model, effectively mitigating its weaknesses and enhancing the overall user experience.

title: Trajectory Tracking of a Car-Like Wheeled Mobile Robot via Koopman Operator and PSO-Tuned Model Predictive Control
authors: Ashkan Jelodar, Kevin Babakhanloo, Mohammad Olyai, Khalil Alipour, Bahram Tarvirdizadeh, Mohammad Ghamari
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Control, Instrumentation and Automation (ICCIA)
abstract: This paper addresses the challenging trajectory tracking control of a car-like wheeled mobile robot. The approach initiates by transforming the robot's nonlinear four-state kinematic model into a linear representation using Koopman operator theory and Extended Dynamic Mode Decomposition (EDMD). This linearization method enables the design of an efficient linear Model Predictive Controller (MPC). A key innovation of this paper is tuning the controller through Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO), that optimizes the MPC weighting matrices systematically, and replaces the manual trial-and-error methods. Simulation results show that the PSO-optimized MPC achieves superior tracking accuracy on a complex reference trajectory compared to a manually tuned controller.

title: Design and Analysis of Miniaturized Implantable Antenna with Metamaterial for Fat-Intrabody Communication
authors: Nurr Izzaliya Natasha Azizi, Muhammad Ridzuan Hafiz Zuriene Heslin, Robin Augustine, Noor Badariah Asan
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: This paper introduces the design and comprehensive analysis of a miniaturized implantable antenna using metamaterial structures, which is optimized for intrabody communication in human fat tissue at 4.4 GHz. The antenna is designed using RT/duroid 6010 LM as the substrate, and it performs effectively. Advanced electromagnetic simulation, CST Studio Suite, was used to evaluate the parameters of the antenna, including reflection coefficient <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$(S_{11})$</tex>, transmission coefficient <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$(S_{21})$</tex>, gain, and radiation efficiency. The findings indicate that the resonance is high and energy is transmitted effectively in fat tissues with maximum gain of 2.3 dBi and good impedance matching <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$(S_{11}= -32.6 ~\text{dB})$</tex>. The results indicate that the proposed metamaterialbased design has the potential to enhance the reliability and efficiency of wireless communication in biomedical implants to a great extent. Compared with conventional designs, the metamaterial integration enables 40% miniaturization while maintaining efficient link budgets.

title: Multi-Directional Beam Control Circular Patch Antenna Based on Shorted Parasitics at 3.5 Ghz
authors: Rabiatuladawiah Akhbar, Hajar Ja'afar, Nurul Huda Abd Rahman, Nurulazlina Ramli, Mohamed Nasrun Osman, Rina Abdullah
publish: 2025 IEEE International RF and Microwave Conference (RFM)
abstract: This paper presents a simple and low-cost beam tilting by using shorted parasitic elements method, eliminating the need for complex feeding networks or a large number of switches. The planar antenna is unidirectional, while the suggested antenna supports multidirectional beams, hence accommodating a greater number of users. In this study, multidirectional beams are achieved by ON/OFF the condition of parasitic elements around the driven element. The simulation findings for the suggested antenna design, functioning at a frequency of 3.5 GHz, validate that the shorted parasitic circular patch antenna may produce seven beam patterns oriented at <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$+39^{\circ},+36^{\circ},+23^{\circ}, 0^{\circ},-23^{\circ},-36^{\circ}$</tex>, and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$-39^{\circ}$</tex>. Besides, the findings indicate that the suggested antenna achieved an average gain of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$7 \mathbf{~ d B i}$</tex>.

title: Model-Free Inverse Optimal Control Based on Dynamic Linearization
authors: Mohammadreza Gilak, Raziyeh Mehraban, Behzad Ahi, Mohammad Saleh Tavazoei
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Control, Instrumentation and Automation (ICCIA)
abstract: This paper presents a novel method for inverse optimal control (IOC) of linear systems with unknown dynamics. By combining dynamic linearization techniques from modelfree adaptive control with windowed system identification, we develop a data-driven approach to recover the state cost matrix of linear quadratic regulators (LQRs). The proposed method first estimates a pseudo partial derivative matrix leveraging solely state and input measurements, then constructs an extended state-space model that enables IOC via sliding window processing. In contrast to classical model-based IOC techniques, our method circumvents the requirement for exact system knowledge while preserving robustness to noise and limited excitation. The method's effectiveness is verified through several numerical examples.

title: Adoption of AI Technologies in Energy-Efficient Housing Systems: A Global Scientometric Analysis
authors: Anthonia Oluwatosin Adediran, Samuel-Soma M. Ajibade, Muhammed Basheer Jasser, Angela Lee Siew Hoong, Faizah Mohammed Bashir, Yakubu Aminu Dodo, Kayode A. Akintoye
publish: 2025 IEEE 15th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology (ICSET)
abstract: We studied AI and energy-efficient housing systems research (AIEE-HS) through publishing patterns and bibliometric analysis of related publications indexed in Elsevier's Scopus database between 1994 and 2024. The method included Scopus search queries and front-page filtering to find and screen AIEE-HS publications. Results showed <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{1, 0 3 1}$</tex> publications: <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{7 7. 3 \%}$</tex> articles, <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{1 8. 7 \%}$</tex> conference proceedings, and 4.0 % reviews. The study found 3,900 % increase in AIEE-HS articles from 3 to 121 (average: 33.26) during 30 years. The findings show stakeholder interest in the topic. According to the top stakeholders analysis, Pawson H has 15 publications and Delft University of Technology has 29. The UK publishes 284 times, while the European Commission funds 46. Due to the researcher's interest, organizational strategies, co-authorship collaborations, and funding, stakeholders were productive. Social housing (1168), housing policy (135), housing (844), and energy efficiency (343) topped AIEE-HS's keywords. The study showed that AIEE-HS is a dynamic, impactful, multidisciplinary research landscape with diverse subject areas and the potential for more publications and discoveries.

title: A Comprehensive review of Short-Term Weather Forecasting Using Artificial Intelligence Techniques Based on Internet of Things
authors: Sulis Setiowati, Jefri Al Bukhori, Tegar Tri Hartono, Yurixa Sakhinatul Putri, Rika Novita Wardhani, Nuralam
publish: 2025 8th International Conference of Computer and Informatics Engineering (IC2IE)
abstract: Recent advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and the Internet of Things (IoT) have significantly improved short-term weather forecasting by enabling high-frequency, localized predictions—critical for applications in agriculture, disaster management, and urban infrastructure. This paper presents a comprehensive review of AI-driven forecasting methods, including classical machine learning (ML), deep learning (DL), and hybrid models, all integrated with IoT-based meteorological data sources. These methods are categorized and evaluated in terms of predictive accuracy, computational efficiency, scalability, and interpretability, with findings synthesized from peer-reviewed literature. Deep learning models such as Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) and CNN–LSTM offer superior accuracy; however, they require substantial computational resources, limiting their feasibility for real-time IoT applications. In contrast, models like Support Vector Regression (SVR), Random Forest (RF), and Adaptive NeuroFuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) offer more interpretable and computationally efficient solutions, albeit with reduced accuracy. Hybrid models provide a compromise, balancing performance and resource demands. The review highlights key challenges, including data heterogeneity, limited standardization, the absence of explainable AI (XAI), and minimal integration of physics-informed learning. This study concludes by proposing future directions aimed at developing lightweight, adaptive, and interpretable AI models suitable for scalable, real-time IoT deployment—thus advancing intelligent and resilient weather forecasting systems.

title: Security Testing of an Online Assistant Recruitment System Using OWASP ZAP
authors: Chandra Bayu Samudra, Arfive Gandhi, Ario Harry Prayogo
publish: 2025 8th International Conference of Computer and Informatics Engineering (IC2IE)
abstract: The increasing reliance on online academic platforms demands robust security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure system integrity. This research presents a comprehensive security assessment of the XYZ Online Assistant Recruitment System using the OWASP Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) with a Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) methodology. The evaluation was conducted on the live production environment through three sequential phases: passive scanning, spidering, and active scanning. These combined processes identified 394 vulnerability instances, classified according to the OWASP Top 10 (2021) categories. The results revealed that Security Misconfiguration (A05) dominated with the highest frequency, encompassing issues such as missing HTTP security headers, misconfigured Content Security Policies, and exposure of server details. Cryptographic Failures (A02) followed, primarily involving insecure cookie configurations and sensitive data stored in browser-based mechanisms like localStorage. Identification & Authentication Failures (A07) were less frequent but still critical, indicating weaknesses in session management and authentication handling. Although no high-severity vulnerabilities were detected, several medium-severity issues including the absence of anti-CSRF tokens and cross-domain misconfigurations represent significant risks when exploited in combination. These findings emphasize that even low-and medium-severity vulnerabilities can substantially increase the attack surface if left unaddressed. The study concludes that secure-by-default configurations, strict policy enforcement, and continuous testing are essential for maintaining a strong security posture in academic systems. Future work will focus on integrating static application security testing (SAST), applying formal risk scoring models such as CVSS for prioritization, and conducting periodic re-assessments to ensure ongoing resilience against emerging threats.
